original: @1b # // tshul gsum pa'i rtags shes kyang brjod pa la mi mkhas pa'i byis pa la bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs su bab nas bshad pa /
analyzed: @1b # // tshul gsum pa'i rtags shes kyang brjod pa la mi mkhas pa'i byis pa la bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs su bab nas bshad pa /
translated: The occasion for explaining the definition of inference for the sake of others, which is the sign that teaches the trimodal relation, has now arrived.

original: gzhan gyi ched ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ched ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The purpose of others is the purpose of others.

original: rang gis te bdag nyid kyis gang mthong ba'i don de 'dis gsal bar byed pas na /
analyzed: rang gis te bdag nyid kyis gang mthong ba'i don de 'dis gsal bar byed pas na /
translated: This makes manifest the object that is seen by oneself.

original: gsal byed de /
analyzed: gsal byed de /
translated: It is a manifestor.

original: 'chad par byed pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'chad par byed pa'i sgra'o //
translated: It is a verbal expression.

original: rjod par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes ni mi bya ste /
translated: It is not said that it is that which expresses.

original: gang gi phyir rjod par byed pa'i sgra nyid ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjod par byed pa'i sgra nyid ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the verbal expression itself is not an inference,

original: gcig rtogs par bya ba yin pas na tshul gnyi ga brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig rtogs par bya ba yin pas na tshul gnyi ga brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is not the expression of both modes, because it is to be understood as one.

original: sgra gang zhig tshul gsum ston par byed pa de nyid ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra gang zhig tshul gsum ston par byed pa de nyid ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: That verbal expression which teaches the trimodal relation is itself an inference.

original: gal te rtags dang rjes su dpag par bya ba gnyi ga yang rang gis mthong ba'i don yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te rtags dang rjes su dpag par bya ba gnyi ga yang rang gis mthong ba'i don yin mod kyi /
translated: Although both the reason and the object to be inferred are objects seen by oneself,

original: de lta na yang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshig rjes su dpag pa nyid 'gog pa 'chad par 'gyur ba las na rang gis mthong don smos pa ni don gyis na rtags la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshig rjes su dpag pa nyid 'gog pa 'chad par 'gyur ba las na rang gis mthong don smos pa ni don gyis na rtags la gnas pa yin no //
translated: nevertheless, the words ‚Äúobject seen by oneself‚Äù are used in the sense of the reason, because the refutation of the statement ‚ÄúThe object to be inferred is the very inference‚Äù will be explained later.

original: gal te de lta na ni /üîΩ@2a * // tshul gsum rtags ni gsal byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni / @2a * // tshul gsum rtags ni gsal byed pa'o //
translated: If that is so,

original: zhes de skad du brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: zhes de skad du brjod par bya'i /
translated: then it should be said that ‚ÄúThe reason makes the trimodal condition clear.‚Äù

original: rang gis mthong don zhes smos pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rang gis mthong don zhes smos pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is ‚Äúobject seen by oneself‚Äù mentioned?

original: ji ltar rang nyid ces smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar rang nyid ces smos te /
translated: Why is ‚Äúoneself‚Äù mentioned?

original: ji ltar te don gyi tshul gang gis tshul gsum pa ste ;
analyzed: ji ltar te don gyi tshul gang gis tshul gsum pa ste ;
translated: In what way?

original: tshul gsum gang la yod pa'i rtags de las rtags can lkog tu gyur pa'i don la bdag nyid shes pa bskyed pa de kho na ltar te /
analyzed: tshul gsum gang la yod pa'i rtags de las rtags can lkog tu gyur pa'i don la bdag nyid shes pa bskyed pa de kho na ltar te /
translated: The reason that has the trimodal condition generates knowledge of the object to be inferred, which is a hidden object, in just that way.

original: don gyi rim pa de nyid kyis gzhan la ste rgyud gzhan dag la rtags can gyi don gyi shes pa gang yin pa de bskyed par 'dod pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: don gyi rim pa de nyid kyis gzhan la ste rgyud gzhan dag la rtags can gyi don gyi shes pa gang yin pa de bskyed par 'dod pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa ste /
translated: By that very order of meaning, he wishes to generate in others, i.e., in other mind-streams, the cognition of the meaning of the sign. Therefore, he teaches the sign having three modes.

original: gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: That which teaches, i.e., makes clear, the sign having three modes is inference for the sake of others.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rang gis mthong ba'i don gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes de ltar de nyid tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis mthong ba'i don gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes de ltar de nyid tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is that which makes clear the meaning that one has seen oneself. Thus, it is explained that it is that which teaches the sign having three modes.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa yin pas tshig rjes su dpag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa yin pas tshig rjes su dpag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If inference is a cognition, how can it be an expression?

original: bshad pa / rgyu tshig la 'bras bu shes pa btags pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / rgyu tshig la 'bras bu shes pa btags pa ste /
translated: It is said: The result, cognition, is figuratively designated as the cause, expression.

original: sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a superimposition.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: tshig kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags dran par byed pas brgyud nas lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nye bar @2b btags nas rjes su dpag par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags dran par byed pas brgyud nas lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nye bar @2b btags nas rjes su dpag par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The words also are the cause of the knowledge of the object which is hidden by the indirect process of reminding one of the triply characterized reason. Therefore, the words are figuratively called inference.

original: des na don 'di bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the point being made.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa bstan par bya ba ni rgyu tshul gsum pa'i rtags bstan par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du de'i tshig kyang bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa bstan par bya ba ni rgyu tshul gsum pa'i rtags bstan par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du de'i tshig kyang bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the teaching of inference is the teaching of the triply characterized reason which is the cause of inference, in the same way, the words of the teaching of inference are also to be taught.

original: gal te de lta na mthong ba gsal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba tsam zhig bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mthong ba gsal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba tsam zhig bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the words of the teaching of inference are merely the words that clarify what is seen.

original: rang smos pas rang don smos pa ni dgos ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: rang smos pas rang don smos pa ni dgos ba med do zhe na /
translated: Since the words of the teaching of inference are the words that clarify what is seen, it is pointless to mention the words of the teaching of inference.

original: bshad pa / gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid 'dir rang gis mthong ba dang don zhes mtsho pa na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid 'dir rang gis mthong ba dang don zhes mtsho pa na'o //
translated: In response to this, the text says, ‚ÄúHere, the words of the teaching of inference are the words that clarify what is seen.‚Äù

original: bshad pa 'di ni rang gi sgra dang don gyi sgra dag la spyir nye bar bkod pa yin te ;
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ni rang gi sgra dang don gyi sgra dag la spyir nye bar bkod pa yin te ;
translated: This explanation is generally applied to the words ‚Äúitself‚Äù and ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag nyid la rnam par bcad pa 'chad kyi mthong ba'i sgra la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag nyid la rnam par bcad pa 'chad kyi mthong ba'i sgra la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the exclusion is stated only with respect to these, not with respect to the word ‚Äúseen.‚Äù

original: rang smos pa ni gzhan gyis mthong ba gcod do //
analyzed: rang smos pa ni gzhan gyis mthong ba gcod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù excludes the seeing of others.

original: gal te tshad mas mthong ba ni dngos po nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas mthong ba ni dngos po nyid yin la /
translated: If seeing is established by a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma yang thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mthong bar ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma yang thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyis mthong bar ga las yin zhe na /
translated: then how can it be the seeing of others, since a valid cognition is shared?

original: bshad pa / lung las mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho nas mthong ba yin gyi rang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / lung las mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho nas mthong ba yin gyi rang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: In response, ƒÄryadeva says: That which is seen by testimony is seen by another, not by oneself.

original: de bzhin du don gyi sgra'i rnam par bcad par ston pa ni don med pa las kyang grub pa min zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don gyi sgra'i rnam par bcad par ston pa ni don med pa las kyang grub pa min zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the exclusion of the word ‚Äúobject‚Äù is stated in the line ‚ÄúNor is it established from a nonexistent object.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar na log par rtogs pa ma mthong bar rang nyed kyis dogs par byas nas dogs pa bcad pa'i phyir khyad par nye bar 'god snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar na log par rtogs pa ma mthong bar rang nyed kyis dogs par byas nas dogs pa bcad pa'i phyir khyad par nye bar 'god snyam pa la /
translated: If you think that the exclusion of doubt is stated in the line ‚ÄúNor is it established from a nonexistent object‚Äù because it is doubtful whether one sees or does not see a false appearance,

original: log par rtogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate a false appearance,üîΩƒÄryadeva says:

original: ji ltar kha cig na re zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig na re zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúSome people say‚Äù is mentioned.

original: gzhan rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is that it is for the sake of making others understand.

original: sgrub par byed pa grub pa gang yin pa de ni rtogs par bya bas don rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa grub pa gang yin pa de ni rtogs par bya bas don rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The proof of the proof is the reason for understanding the meaning that is to be understood.

original: sgrub par byed pa des rgol ba nyid don rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa des rgol ba nyid don rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The proof does not make the opponent understand the meaning,

original: 'on kyang phyir rgol ba rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir rgol ba rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: but it makes the opponent understand.

original: des na sgrub par byed pa sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni phyir rgol ba rtogs pa la nye bar mkho ba yin gyi rgol ba rtogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni phyir rgol ba rtogs pa la nye bar mkho ba yin gyi rgol ba rtogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proof of the proof is necessary for the opponent to understand, but not for the proponent to understand.

original: des na gal te phyir rgol ba nyid la grub ba yin na de tsam gyis de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa de la rgol ba la grub pa brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: des na gal te phyir rgol ba nyid la grub ba yin na de tsam gyis de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa de la rgol ba la grub pa brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if it is established for the opponent, that alone is the proof, so what is the point of considering whether the proof is established for the proponent?

original: des na gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis mthong ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the other party‚Äôs perception is established.

original: @3a * // 'di la dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: @3a * // 'di la dper brjod pa ni /
translated: An example of this is as follows:

original: blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni chos can no //
analyzed: blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni chos can no //
translated: The subject is the mind, pleasure, etc.

original: sems pa med pa'i bsgrub bya ste bsgrub par bya ba ni sems pa'i dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sems pa med pa'i bsgrub bya ste bsgrub par bya ba ni sems pa'i dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The probandum is the absence of sentience, i.e., the absence of the nature of being sentient.

original: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù or ‚Äúbecause of being impermanent.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab pa'i yul nye bar ston pa'o //üîΩ'di la med par skye ba'i skye ba can nam yod pa gtan nas 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gtan tshigs su nye bar blangs pa gang yin pa de ni grangs can rang nyid la ma grub ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab pa'i yul nye bar ston pa'o // 'di la med par skye ba'i skye ba can nam yod pa gtan nas 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gtan tshigs su nye bar blangs pa gang yin pa de ni grangs can rang nyid la ma grub ste /
translated: The example is ‚Äúlike form, etc.‚Äù This shows the pervasion.üîΩHere, the reason ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù or ‚Äúbecause of being impermanent‚Äù is not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself.

original: de ni yod pa kho na gsal ba dang ma gsal ba skye ba dang 'jig par smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yod pa kho na gsal ba dang ma gsal ba skye ba dang 'jig par smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he asserts that only what exists is produced and destroyed, whether manifest or unmanifest.

original: gzhan la ni grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni grub pa yin te /
translated: However, it is established for the other party.

original: des na go bar byed pa yin no zhes gzhan gyi de ltar 'dod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na go bar byed pa yin no zhes gzhan gyi de ltar 'dod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for others to assert that it is a means of understanding.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul rtogs par bya ba'i don rjes su dpag pas yul du byed pa gang yin pa 'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul rtogs par bya ba'i don rjes su dpag pas yul du byed pa gang yin pa 'am /
translated: It is said: The object that is understood by inference that engages by the power of the thing is the object that is made an object by inference,

original: gang las rjes su dpag pas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang las rjes su dpag pas 'byung ba ste /
translated: or that from which inference arises.

original: tshad mas mthong ba'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the evidence of the three modes that is seen by valid knowledge.

original: tshad mas mthong ba'i tshul gsum pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i don de la ni tshig gis byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba'i tshul gsum pa dang / rtogs par bya ba'i don de la ni tshig gis byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the three modes that are seen by valid knowledge and in the object that is to be understood, there is no function of words.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blangs dgos te /
translated: This must be accepted without doubt.

original: tshig tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshig tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If words are valid knowledge, then inference would not engage.

original: dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshig tsam gyis bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid kyi don grub pas gtan tshigs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshig tsam gyis bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid kyi don grub pas gtan tshigs la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because the object that has the character of the probandum would be established by mere words that have the character of a thesis. Therefore, there would be no need for evidence and so on.

original: stsogs pa smros pa ni dpe la sogs pa nye bar gzung pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stsogs pa smros pa ni dpe la sogs pa nye bar gzung pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is mentioned because it is meaningless to cite examples and so on.

original: gal te 'di snyam du tshig thams cad tshad ma yin na ni de ltar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du tshig thams cad tshad ma yin na ni de ltar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If you think that if all words are valid cognitions, then that is so,

original: 'on kyang khyad par can gyi tshig 'ga' kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par can gyi tshig 'ga' kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: but only some words that are special are valid cognitions.

original: des smras pa ni /
analyzed: des smras pa ni /
translated: He says that

original: de las gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur bas ni tshig nyid khyad par yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur bas ni tshig nyid khyad par yin te /
translated: the words are special because they are different from others.üîΩSince they are valid cognitions, there is no fault.

original: de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes gzhan dag dogs na /
analyzed: de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes gzhan dag dogs na /
translated: If others suspect this,

original: bshad zin to zhes smos te /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis has already been explained.‚Äù

original: tshig gis khyad par 'di la 'gog par byed pa gang zhig brjod par bya ba de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshig gis khyad par 'di la 'gog par byed pa gang zhig brjod par bya ba de ni bshad zin to //
translated: This is the refutation of the words that are special. What is to be said has already been explained.

original: gang du bshad ci na /
analyzed: gang du bshad ci na /
translated: Where was it explained?

original: lung gi tshad ma bsam par ro //
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma bsam par ro //
translated: It was explained in the chapter on the validity of scripture.

original: der ni ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis khyad par @3b lung ma yin la /
analyzed: der ni ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis khyad par @3b lung ma yin la /
translated: There, the words are not special because they have the characteristic of being unfabricated.

original: don skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang lung ma yin zhing /
analyzed: don skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang lung ma yin zhing /
translated: The definition of a scripture that is not composed by a person is not scripture.

original: yid ches pas byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang des par mi nus pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang yod dam med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yid ches pas byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang des par mi nus pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no // gzhan yang yod dam med kyang rung ste /
translated: And the definition of a scripture that is composed by a trustworthy person is not scripture.

original: khyad par 'di dag gis ci bya /
analyzed: khyad par 'di dag gis ci bya /
translated: Moreover, what is the point of these distinctions, whether or not scripture exists?

original: gal te lung de'i don tshad mas 'thad pa ma yin ba de'i tshe khyad par yod kyang khyad par 'ga' zhig yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lung de'i don tshad mas 'thad pa ma yin ba de'i tshe khyad par yod kyang khyad par 'ga' zhig yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning of scripture is not established by a valid cognition, then even if there is a distinction, it is not established by any distinction.

original: khyad par yod kyang med pa dang 'dra ba kho na'o //
analyzed: khyad par yod kyang med pa dang 'dra ba kho na'o //
translated: Even if there is a distinction, it is just as if there were no distinction.

original: mi bslu ba yod na ni tshad mas 'thad pa'i don can gyi tshig des grub pa gang yin pa des pha rol 'ba' zhig la grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi bslu ba yod na ni tshad mas 'thad pa'i don can gyi tshig des grub pa gang yin pa des pha rol 'ba' zhig la grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is a nondeceptive scripture, then the meaning of the words of that scripture is established by a valid cognition. That which is established by that is not established only for the opponent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rgol ba la yang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgol ba la yang grub pa nyid do //
translated: It is established for the proponent as well.

original: tshad ma dang ldan pa'i tshig de ni rgol ba des kyang khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang ldan pa'i tshig de ni rgol ba des kyang khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: The words that possess a valid cognition are accepted by the proponent.

original: des na de ni khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no distinction.

original: yang na tshad mas mthong ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de la tshig gis ci bya ste /
analyzed: yang na tshad mas mthong ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de la tshig gis ci bya ste /
translated: Or else, what is the use of words for that which is seen by a valid cognition?

original: de ni tshad ma nyid kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma nyid kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: That is to be accepted just by the valid cognition itself.

original: tshad ma yang gnyi ga la khyad par med do //
analyzed: tshad ma yang gnyi ga la khyad par med do //
translated: And the valid cognition is not different for the two.

original: des na pha rol la grub pa gang yin pa de ni rgol ba la yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na pha rol la grub pa gang yin pa de ni rgol ba la yang grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is established for the opponent is also established for the proponent.

original: gang gi phyir tshig tshad ma ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig tshad ma ma yin pa des na /
translated: Since words are not a valid cognition,

original: khas blangs nas te tshig khas blangs nas brtag pa byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs nas te tshig khas blangs nas brtag pa byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: one does not engage in analysis after accepting, that is, after accepting words.

original: ma brtags pa tshad mas mi bslu ba dang bral ba ni khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags pa tshad mas mi bslu ba dang bral ba ni khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without analysis, one is devoid of the nondeceptive valid cognition, there is no acceptance.

original: 'on kyang brtags pa nyid las khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brtags pa nyid las khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: However, one should accept after analysis.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir brtags pa nyid khas len pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'ga' zhig kyang grub ba ste grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtags pa nyid khas len pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'ga' zhig kyang grub ba ste grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because you accept the mere imputation, therefore the mere acceptance of the other is not established as the meaning of the probandum at all.

original: brtags shing tshad mas dag pa ni gnyi gas khas blang bar 'os pa yin pa'i phyir dang / ma brtags pa gnyi gas kyang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags shing tshad mas dag pa ni gnyi gas khas blang bar 'os pa yin pa'i phyir dang / ma brtags pa gnyi gas kyang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is imputed and purified by valid cognition is suitable to be accepted by both, and because that which is not imputed is not accepted by either.

original: 'di snyam du rigs pas 'jug pa ni 'di 'dra ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rigs pas 'jug pa ni 'di 'dra ma yin mod kyi /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúThe engagement of reasoning is not like this.

original: 'on kyang blun po 'ga' zhig mngon zhen gyis lung khas len pa de la ltos nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang blun po 'ga' zhig mngon zhen gyis lung khas len pa de la ltos nas /
translated: However, in dependence on some fools who accept scripture due to manifest clinging,

original: khas blangs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yongs su rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yongs su rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: the reason of acceptance is fully understood.‚Äù

original: bden te / gal te khas blangs par yod par gyur na ni khas blangs pa la tshad mar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: bden te / gal te khas blangs par yod par gyur na ni khas blangs pa la tshad mar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: That is true, but if acceptance existed, then acceptance would be a valid means of cognition.

original: rtogs pa'i dus su ni de nyid gdon mi za bar gtang bar @4a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus su ni de nyid gdon mi za bar gtang bar @4a * //
translated: But at the time of understanding, that is definitely abandoned.

original: bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is an action,

original: lung de zhes smos te /
analyzed: lung de zhes smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat scripture.‚Äù

original: dgag par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten du 'gyur ba'i lung de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgag par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten du 'gyur ba'i lung de la gnod par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: That scripture which is the basis of the phenomenon that is to be refuted is undermined,

original: dgag par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la dmigs nas sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de la gnod par byed pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa de'i phyir gnod mi za bar 'di tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la dmigs nas sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de la gnod par byed pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa de'i phyir gnod mi za bar 'di tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: because it is refuted. When one observes another, and states a reason that proves it, at that time, that is, when one states a proof that undermines it, it is not valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa de bas na lung de grub pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa de bas na lung de grub pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Since it is not valid knowledge, whatever is established by that scripture is not established.

original: rgyu de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir lung de las grub par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir lung de las grub par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: For that reason, because it is not valid knowledge, how could one be established by that scripture?

original: 'di snyam du rgol ba la ni lung de las ma grub kyang /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rgol ba la ni lung de las ma grub kyang /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúAlthough that scripture is not established for the opponent,

original: phyir rgol ba 'ga' zhig dgag par bya ba'i chos kyi rten du gyur pa'i lung de dang ldan pa'i rgol ba de la ni lung des grub pa ni grub pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba 'ga' zhig dgag par bya ba'i chos kyi rten du gyur pa'i lung de dang ldan pa'i rgol ba de la ni lung des grub pa ni grub pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Some opponents say, ‚ÄúThe respondent who possesses scripture, which is the basis of the phenomenon to be refuted, has established that scripture.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of that statement.

original: gal te yang lung de rgol ba la ma grub pa de lta yin na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang lung de rgol ba la ma grub pa de lta yin na yang /
translated: Even though that scripture is not established for the respondent,

original: de gang la grub pa de gal te phyir rgol ba yin na /
analyzed: de gang la grub pa de gal te phyir rgol ba yin na /
translated: if it is established for someone, and if that person is the opponent,

original: de'i tshe de la lung las grub par byed pa rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la lung las grub par byed pa rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag nyid yin pas na /
translated: then at that time, since it is a part of the proof that is established by scripture,

original: de lta bu'i lung rab tu grub pa'i phyir rgol ba la brten nas de'i lung grags pa'i sgrub par byed pa nye bar 'god pa la ni 'ga' yang med pa yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lung rab tu grub pa'i phyir rgol ba la brten nas de'i lung grags pa'i sgrub par byed pa nye bar 'god pa la ni 'ga' yang med pa yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: because that scripture is well established, there is no one who, in dependence on the respondent, would set forth a proof that is renowned to him.

original: gang gi lung gang yin zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang gi lung gang yin zhes smos so //
translated: If you suspect that, then ‚ÄúWhose scripture?‚Äù is stated.

original: 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is what is thought:

original: khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa ma gtogs par ni lung 'ga' zhig kyang su dang yang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa ma gtogs par ni lung 'ga' zhig kyang su dang yang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the relationship of assertion, no scripture is related to anything at all.

original: khas blangs pa yang gal te rmongs pa'i phyir sngar byas zin pa de ltar na yang gang gi tshe gzhan dang lhan cig yongs su brtag pa byed pa 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe nyid lung de la yid brtan pa med pas khas blangs pa btang ba yin
analyzed: khas blangs pa yang gal te rmongs pa'i phyir sngar byas zin pa de ltar na yang gang gi tshe gzhan dang lhan cig yongs su brtag pa byed pa 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe nyid lung de la yid brtan pa med pas khas blangs pa btang ba yin
translated: And if you assert that the scripture is valid because it was composed by a reliable person, then when you want to investigate whether or not the scripture is valid, you must first ascertain the reliability of the person.

original: no // des na ji ltar lung de rgol ba lam grub pa bzhin du phyir rgol ba la yang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: no // des na ji ltar lung de rgol ba lam grub pa bzhin du phyir rgol ba la yang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But if you do not ascertain the reliability of the person, then you cannot ascertain the validity of the scripture.üîΩAnd if you do ascertain the reliability of the person, then you have already ascertained the validity of the scripture, so what is the point of investigating it?

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe lung de la rab tu grags pa'i bde ba la sogs pa sems gzhan gyis 'gog pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe lung de la rab tu grags pa'i bde ba la sogs pa sems gzhan gyis 'gog pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when the existence of pleasure and so on is refuted by another mind that is renowned in the world,

original: tshad mas gnod pa lung de nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa lung de nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could the scripture itself be harmed by a valid cognition?

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: khas blangs pa'i lung gzhan gyis @4b sun 'byin pa bzod pa nyid de khas blangs pa btang pa yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i lung gzhan gyis @4b sun 'byin pa bzod pa nyid de khas blangs pa btang pa yin te /
translated: It is to accept the refutation of one's own position by the scriptures of the other party and to abandon one's own position.üîΩ

original: the tshom med na ni lung de sun 'byin pa la rang gtod bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom med na ni lung de sun 'byin pa la rang gtod bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs acceptance of the scripture is relinquished, because if he has no doubt, he cannot be refuted by the scripture.

original: gang la the tshom yod pa de ni tshad mar khas blangs pa btang ba yin /
analyzed: gang la the tshom yod pa de ni tshad mar khas blangs pa btang ba yin /
translated: If he has doubt, he relinquishes his acceptance of the scripture as valid.

original: des na mngon zhen che ba'i phyir gang gis rtogs par 'dod pas khas blangs pa ma btang bar des kyang sun 'byin pa nyams par bzod pas na gtang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon zhen che ba'i phyir gang gis rtogs par 'dod pas khas blangs pa ma btang bar des kyang sun 'byin pa nyams par bzod pas na gtang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of his great attachment, he should relinquish his acceptance of the scripture, since he cannot bear the refutation of what he wishes to understand.

original: khas blangs pa ma gtogs pa'i lung gis 'brel pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khas blangs pa ma gtogs pa'i lung gis 'brel pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the connection of the scripture with the opponent‚Äôs acceptance,

original: bshad pa / reng bu zhes bya ba ni yan lag bzhin du lung gi 'brel pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / reng bu zhes bya ba ni yan lag bzhin du lung gi 'brel pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: we say: The scripture is like a corpse, devoid of the connection of scripture.

original: yon tan dang nyes pa de dag ma mthong zhes bya ba 'dis ni khas len pa'i rgyu med pa brjod pa yin te //
analyzed: yon tan dang nyes pa de dag ma mthong zhes bya ba 'dis ni khas len pa'i rgyu med pa brjod pa yin te //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe does not see those good qualities and faults‚Äù indicates that there is no reason for acceptance.

original: yon tan dang / nyes pa mthong ba nyid kyis lung 'ga' zhig blang ba dang 'ga' zhig spong bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yon tan dang / nyes pa mthong ba nyid kyis lung 'ga' zhig blang ba dang 'ga' zhig spong bar bya ba yin no //
translated: and by seeing its good qualities and faults, one should accept some scriptures and reject others.

original: rmongs pa de ni rang nyid kyis mthong bar mi nus pas gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rmongs pa de ni rang nyid kyis mthong bar mi nus pas gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba yin la /
translated: But since the fool is unable to see this himself, he must be taught by another.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyis bstan pa bdag nyid khas len par byed pa de'i tshe kho na rang gi 'dod pas byas pa'i khas blangs pa 'dor ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gyis bstan pa bdag nyid khas len par byed pa de'i tshe kho na rang gi 'dod pas byas pa'i khas blangs pa 'dor ba yin no //
translated: And when he accepts the teaching of another, he is abandoning the position he himself had previously accepted.

original: de lta bu'i gdon 'di sus bgos te rnam par phye /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gdon 'di sus bgos te rnam par phye /
translated: Who has set up this demon and divided it?

original: sus kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sus kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that no one has.

original: mi bzad pa'i gdon dang 'dra bar yang dka' ba'i phyir lung nyid mi bzad pa'i phyir gdon yin no //
analyzed: mi bzad pa'i gdon dang 'dra bar yang dka' ba'i phyir lung nyid mi bzad pa'i phyir gdon yin no //
translated: Because it is difficult to remove, like an invincible demon, scripture itself is an invincible demon.

original: kyi ma'i sgra ni rjes su brtse ba ste /
analyzed: kyi ma'i sgra ni rjes su brtse ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalas‚Äù expresses pity.

original: grub mtha'i gdon mi bzad pas btab pa'i skyes bu ni brtse bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: grub mtha'i gdon mi bzad pas btab pa'i skyes bu ni brtse bar bya ba yin te /
translated: A person who is seized by the invincible demon of philosophical positions is to be pitied.

original: rigs pas bsgrub par mi nus pas bslus pa ni skyes bu'i don las nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas bsgrub par mi nus pas bslus pa ni skyes bu'i don las nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to prove by reasoning, one is deceived and falls away from the goal of a human being.

original: gzhan yang lung de nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can du lung de las brjod pa gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba sems pa med pa khas len par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang lung de nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can du lung de las brjod pa gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba sems pa med pa khas len par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could one accept the absence of mind, which contradicts the statement in that very scripture that pleasure and so on are mental?

original: 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the contradiction?

original: bshad pa / 'gal ba'i chos de khas blangs na ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gal ba'i chos de khas blangs na ste /
translated: We say: If one accepts that mental state,

original: 'dis ni dus kyi khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dus kyi khyad par bstan te /
translated: This shows the time.

original: gzhan khas blangs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: gzhan khas blangs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: At the time of accepting the other.

original: 'dis ni khas blangs pa dor ba'i dus gsum bstan pa yin no //üîΩgal te rmongs pas des sngar lung tshad mar khas blangs pa de lta na yang yongs su brtags @5a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni khas blangs pa dor ba'i dus gsum bstan pa yin no // gal te rmongs pas des sngar lung tshad mar khas blangs pa de lta na yang yongs su brtags @5a * //
translated: This shows the three times of giving up the acceptance.

original: par 'dod pa gtang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: par 'dod pa gtang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: If one accepts the authority of scripture out of confusion, then even though one accepts it, one should give up the desire to investigate.

original: gal te mngon zhen dam pas na de'i tshe ma btang yang sun 'byin pa thos pa'i dus su ni nges par btang dgos te /
analyzed: gal te mngon zhen dam pas na de'i tshe ma btang yang sun 'byin pa thos pa'i dus su ni nges par btang dgos te /
translated: If one is strongly attached to it, then even though one does not give it up, one must definitely give it up when one hears the refutation.

original: tshad mas gnod ba lung nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes ji skad bshad ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod ba lung nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes ji skad bshad ba bzhin no //
translated: How could scripture be harmed by valid cognition?

original: gal te de'i tshe yang ma btang na de lta na yang 'gal ba khas blang bar bya ba'i dus su ni lung gdon mi za bar gtang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe yang ma btang na de lta na yang 'gal ba khas blang bar bya ba'i dus su ni lung gdon mi za bar gtang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: If you do not abandon scripture at that time, then at the time of accepting a contradiction, you must certainly abandon scripture.

original: de tshad ma yin pa ma spangs par ni de dang 'gal ba'i don khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tshad ma yin pa ma spangs par ni de dang 'gal ba'i don khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because you cannot accept a meaning that contradicts valid cognition without abandoning the valid cognition.

original: des na dus der lung spangs pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: des na dus der lung spangs pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, at that time, scripture becomes a part of what is to be abandoned.

original: btang ba'i yan lag nges kyang rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang ba'i yan lag nges kyang rtogs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is a part of what is to be abandoned, it is not suitable to be understood.

original: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe lung spangs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba de nyid kyi tshe tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe lung spangs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba de nyid kyi tshe tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: Because at the time when scripture becomes a part of what is to be abandoned, it is not valid cognition.

original: tshad ma ma yin pas na de las rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pas na de las rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is not valid cognition, it is not a source of knowledge.

original: ji ltar 'gag pa la phyogs pa'i sa bon ni myu gu skyed bde bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gag pa la phyogs pa'i sa bon ni myu gu skyed bde bzhin du /
translated: Just as a seed that is about to cease produces a sprout,

original: rtags ma grub par gyur pas ni bsgrub bya rtogs par ni mi byed do //üîΩgang gi phyir rtags kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don med na med par nges pa nyid bsgrub bya rtogs par byed pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: rtags ma grub par gyur pas ni bsgrub bya rtogs par ni mi byed do // gang gi phyir rtags kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don med na med par nges pa nyid bsgrub bya rtogs par byed pa yin pa des na /
translated: But when the evidence is not established, it does not cause the object to be established to be known.üîΩBecause when the object to be established by the evidence is absent, the evidence is ascertained as absent, and that itself causes the object to be established to be known.

original: gang gi tshe rtags de med par nges pa de nyid kyi tshe de'i rang bzhin nges ba'i shugs kyis thob ba'i bsgrub bya nges pa ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtags de med par nges pa de nyid kyi tshe de'i rang bzhin nges ba'i shugs kyis thob ba'i bsgrub bya nges pa ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the evidence is ascertained as absent, at that very time the object to be established, which is obtained by the force of ascertaining its nature, is ascertained as absent.

original: des na khas blangs pa byas kyang dpyad pa'i dus su ni gang las grub par 'gyur ba lung las tshad ma nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na khas blangs pa byas kyang dpyad pa'i dus su ni gang las grub par 'gyur ba lung las tshad ma nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if one accepts scripture, at the time of analysis, scripture is not a valid means of knowledge, because it is not established from anything else.

original: gzhan yang gang gi phyir rgol ba des khas blangs pas de lung du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi phyir rgol ba des khas blangs pas de lung du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, because it is accepted by the proponent, it becomes scripture.

original: lung de las kyang sgrub par byed pa'i chos rnam par gnas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: lung de las kyang sgrub par byed pa'i chos rnam par gnas pa yin zhing /
translated: And from that scripture, the property to be established is established.

original: de las ni dngos po 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir dngos bo de legs par gas pa yin no zhes bzhad gang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las ni dngos po 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir dngos bo de legs par gas pa yin no zhes bzhad gang du byed pa'o //
translated: Since it is from that that the establishment of the entity is, the entity is well established.üîΩThat which is established from the acceptance of the proof is like a non-existent.

original: sgrub par byed pa khas blangs pa las grub pa gang yin pa de ni med pa dang 'dra ba yin no zhes pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa khas blangs pa las grub pa gang yin pa de ni med pa dang 'dra ba yin no zhes pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This is what is shown.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to ‚Äúdue to the desire of a person,‚Äù

original: gal te khas blangs pa las lung du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa las lung du 'gyur zhing /
translated: if a scripture were to arise from an acceptance,

original: de las grub par byed pa'i chos 'grub pa de'i phyir skyes bu'i 'dod pas gtan tshigs su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de las grub par byed pa'i chos 'grub pa de'i phyir skyes bu'i 'dod pas gtan tshigs su 'gyur zhing /
translated: and if from that the property of the probandum were to be established, then due to the desire of a person, the reason would arise.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu lung khas mi len pa de'i tshe ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu lung khas mi len pa de'i tshe ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But when a person is not accepted as a scripture, then it is a fallacious reason.

original: @5b skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gtan tshigs dang der snang ba nyid rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @5b skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gtan tshigs dang der snang ba nyid rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, due to the reason of the desire of a person, the reason and its appearance are posited.

original: de'i phyir da ni dngos pa'i gnas lugs la gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ma yin pa ci yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ni dngos pa'i gnas lugs la gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ma yin pa ci yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, now there is nothing at all that is a reason or is not a reason in the reality of things,

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the desire of a person can also be otherwise.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa gzhan yang bsags pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa gzhan yang bsags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù means another fault is added.

original: 'di snyam du skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du skyes bu'i 'dod pa ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du yin te /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúThe desire of a person is just as it is in reality.

original: des na 'dod pas gtan tshigs sam gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po nyid yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: des na 'dod pas gtan tshigs sam gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po nyid yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, that which becomes a reason or is not a reason due to desire is just reality.‚Äù

original: bshad pa / 'dod pa de ni dngos po la 'jug par nges pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dod pa de ni dngos po la 'jug par nges pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Because that desire does not definitely engage with reality.

original: 'dod pa ni dngos po la 'jug ba nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni dngos po la 'jug ba nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Desire does not definitely engage with reality.

original: 'on kyang dngos po la ma ltos pa nyid yin pas de'i dbang gis dngos bo rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po la ma ltos pa nyid yin pas de'i dbang gis dngos bo rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, since it does not depend on reality, it does not cause things to be established.

original: des na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the assertion of others is not a proof,

original: dngos po la gtan tshigs dang der snang ba dag med par 'gyur ba ra thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la gtan tshigs dang der snang ba dag med par 'gyur ba ra thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the reason and the appearance of that would not exist in the thing.

original: gzhan yang dngos po med kyang rtogs pas sprul ba sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por thal ba'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po med kyang rtogs pas sprul ba sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por thal ba'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that the assertion of others is not a proof because it follows that the thing to be established would be a nonexistent thing that is established by a realization,

original: yod pa'i don ni zhes don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i don ni zhes don bshad pa yin no //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is explained.

original: rtogs pa ste nges pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ste nges pa la ltos nas so //
translated: In dependence on realization, that is, ascertainment.

original: rtags ni sgron ma bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis go bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags ni sgron ma bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis go bar byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A reason is not a means of understanding through being suitable like a lamp,

original: 'on kyang yod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba med na ni mi 'byung bar nges pa nyid na /
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba med na ni mi 'byung bar nges pa nyid na /
translated: but rather, when the mere nonexistence of the existent object to be established is ascertained,

original: dngos po'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: it is a means of establishing a thing.

original: rtogs pa tsam gyis byas pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa gang las gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed pas grub par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam gyis byas pa sgrub par byed pa yin pa gang las gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed pas grub par 'gyur ba /
translated: But it is not the case that the mere realization of that which is nonexistent is established by the mere assertion of others.

original: med pa rtogs pa tsam gyis gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa rtogs pa tsam gyis gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mere realization of that which is nonexistent is not established.

original: rtogs pa tsam gyis byas pa de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no//
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam gyis byas pa de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no//
translated: That which is done by the mere realization is not established.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa ni don rtogs pa'i thabs yin la /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa ni don rtogs pa'i thabs yin la /
translated: If the means of realizing the object is the establishment,

original: rtogs pa'i thabs kyang spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir yod pa'ang med pa'i thabs kyis kyang bsgrub bya yod pa'i don rtogs par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i thabs kyang spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir yod pa'ang med pa'i thabs kyis kyang bsgrub bya yod pa'i don rtogs par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: and the means of realizing the object is to be abandoned, then would not the existent object be realized by the means of the nonexistent?

original: 'dir yang gal te skye ba dang ldan pa 'am mi rtag pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin @6a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te skye ba dang ldan pa 'am mi rtag pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin @6a * //
translated: Here, if arising or impermanence does not exist,

original: gyi ; 'on kyang de las rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid do snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gyi ; 'on kyang de las rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid do snyam du dogs na /
translated: but that which is to be realized from it exists,

original: yod do zhes smos so //
analyzed: yod do zhes smos so //
translated: then it is said to exist.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: yod kyang dngos po ma yin pa rtogs pas sgro btags pas byas pa ni med pa gtan yod pa ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig las yod par zhen pa gang yin pa de dang khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod kyang dngos po ma yin pa rtogs pas sgro btags pas byas pa ni med pa gtan yod pa ma yin pa'i don rtogs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig las yod par zhen pa gang yin pa de dang khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But since it is understood that it is not a thing, it is not a case of superimposition. There is no difference between the object conceived as existent due to some cause of error and the object conceived as existent due to a cause of error.

original: de las bye brag med pa yin no //üîΩ'khrul pa'i rgyu las de ltar rtogs pa skye ba gang yin pa de'i yul ji ltar the tshom yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de las bye brag med pa yin no // 'khrul pa'i rgyu las de ltar rtogs pa skye ba gang yin pa de'i yul ji ltar the tshom yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: There is no distinction between them.üîΩJust as the object conceived due to a cause of error arises, so too the object conceived as existent due to a cause of error is also like that.

original: yod pa'i don la dngos po ma yin pa byas pa yang yul la the tshom du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i don la dngos po ma yin pa byas pa yang yul la the tshom du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Just as the object conceived due to a cause of error is a doubt, so too the object conceived as existent due to a cause of error is also like that.

original: khyad par med pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: khyad par med pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this lack of distinction, it is said:

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a valid cognition.

original: don mngon du 'dzin pa mngon sum tshad ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: don mngon du 'dzin pa mngon sum tshad ma yin pa'am /
translated: Direct perception is a valid cognition that apprehends an object directly.

original: med na mi 'byung ba mthon ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyis yongs su rtogs pa /üîΩrjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin gyis /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba mthon ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyis yongs su rtogs pa /üîΩrjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin gyis /
translated: Inference is a valid cognition that is preceded by the non-erroneous apprehension of the pervasion.

original: shes pa gang zhig mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: Any cognition that is not direct perception,

original: med na mi 'byung ba mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yang ma yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yang ma yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: and is not preceded by the perception of the invariable concomitance of the reason with the property to be established, is not a valid cognition,

original: med pa 'khrul pas byas pa'i shes pa dang khyad par med do //
analyzed: med pa 'khrul pas byas pa'i shes pa dang khyad par med do //
translated: because it is not different from a cognition that is produced by a nonexistent object.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i khyad par snang ba mi dmigs pa las lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang 'brel ba'i rtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan ni med do zhes kho bo cag gis bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i khyad par snang ba mi dmigs pa las lkog tu gyur pa'i don dang 'brel ba'i rtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan ni med do zhes kho bo cag gis bshad zin to //
translated: Moreover, we have already explained that, apart from the non-perception of what appears, there is no other means of knowing a hidden object, such as the effect, nature, or non-apprehension.

original: rtags de dngos po'i gnas lugs la grub pa'i mtshan de grub pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: rtags de dngos po'i gnas lugs la grub pa'i mtshan de grub pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the reason is established as the nature of the property to be established in reality,

original: gzhan du ji ltar bdag nyid la ma grub pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du ji ltar bdag nyid la ma grub pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: how can it be said to be not established with regard to the other?

original: gal te gzhan ni gtan tshi gas gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam na /üîΩgzhan gyis na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gtan tshi gas gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam na /üîΩgzhan gyis na zhes smos so //
translated: If you think that the other is to be understood by another reason,üîΩthen it would be endless.

original: gal te de rigs pa la mi ltos pa zhig yin na de la gtan tshigs brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te de rigs pa la mi ltos pa zhig yin na de la gtan tshigs brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is not dependent on reasoning, then what is the point of stating a reason?

original: 'on te gang gi phyir khyed tshad ma nyid kyis rtogs par byed 'dod pas na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gi phyir khyed tshad ma nyid kyis rtogs par byed 'dod pas na /
translated: Moreover, if you wish to understand it by means of valid cognition,

original: gzhan yang rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhig yin na /
translated: then you are a follower of reasoning.

original: de bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa gzhan gyis ji ltar rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa gzhan gyis ji ltar rtogs par byed /
translated: How can you understand what is to be proven by another‚Äôs error?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the assertion of others is not a proof,

original: rtags gsum du ma 'dus pa'i @6b phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags gsum du ma 'dus pa'i @6b phyir ro //
translated: because it is not included in the three types of reasons.

original: gal te gzhan gyis khas blangs pa rtags ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis khas blangs pa rtags ma yin na /
translated: If the assertion of others is not a reason,

original: khyod dang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis ji ltar gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i chos kyis chos gzhan thal bar sgrub par byed ce na /
analyzed: khyod dang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis ji ltar gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i chos kyis chos gzhan thal bar sgrub par byed ce na /
translated: then how is it that you and the earlier masters state that one property is proven by the property of another?

original: gzhan gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes smos so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúby another‚Äù is made.

original: thal bar bsgrub pa la ni khyad par bya ba'i chos gzhan gyis 'dod par mthong nas mi 'dod kyang khyad par byed pa'i chos grub par thal bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: thal bar bsgrub pa la ni khyad par bya ba'i chos gzhan gyis 'dod par mthong nas mi 'dod kyang khyad par byed pa'i chos grub par thal bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: In a reductio, one sees that the other party accepts the predicate of the probandum, and then, although one does not accept it, one states the reductio in which the predicate of the probandum is established.

original: khyab par bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med par mi 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med par mi 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that which is pervaded cannot occur without the pervader.

original: dper na spyi la sogs pa du ma la yod par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: dper na spyi la sogs pa du ma la yod par 'dod pa na /
translated: For example, when one asserts that something such as a universal exists in many things,

original: mi 'dod kyang du ma nyid du thal ba 'am /
analyzed: mi 'dod kyang du ma nyid du thal ba 'am /
translated: one does not accept that it is many,

original: bdag la sogs pa yod pa nyid yin na skad cig ma nyid du thal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa yod pa nyid yin na skad cig ma nyid du thal ba bzhin no //
translated: just as one does not accept that if such things as the self existed, it would follow that they are momentary.

original: chos can ma grub pa'i phyir du ma la yod pa la sogs pa khyab par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa des na khyab par byed pa'i chos su thal bar gal 'gyur /
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa'i phyir du ma la yod pa la sogs pa khyab par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa des na khyab par byed pa'i chos su thal bar gal 'gyur /
translated: Since the pervaded property, such as existing in many things, is not established because the subject is not established, how could it follow that the pervader is not established?

original: tshad ma med pa ni brjod par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma med pa ni brjod par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: It is not tenable to say that there is no valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'di khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba med par brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba med par brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the pervader does not exist, one wishes to state that that which is pervaded does not exist.

original: khyab par byed pa med pa de ni spyi la sogs pa med pa la yang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med pa de ni spyi la sogs pa med pa la yang grub pa nyid do //
translated: And the absence of the pervader is also established in the absence of universals, etc.

original: de'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'dir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'dir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because it causes one to understand the desired meaning, that is stated here as the root reason.

original: gzhan gyi spyi la sogs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir nye bar bkod pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ba sdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi spyi la sogs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir nye bar bkod pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ba sdus pa'i don to //
translated: But that which is stated for the sake of establishing the other‚Äôs universals, etc., is not the root reason. This is the meaning of the summary.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is the consequence‚Äù is connected to what is to be explained.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na ;
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba zhig ce na ;
translated: What kind of consequence is it?

original: dper na zhes smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù it is said.

original: 'di ci lta ba bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ci lta ba bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that there are other consequences like this one.

original: yul la sogs pa'i khyad par dang 'brel pa rdzas gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i khyad par dang 'brel pa rdzas gang la yod pa ste /
translated: It is a substance that is related to the distinctions of place, etc.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa dang 'brel ba gcig las gzhan pa'i rdzas de dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa dang 'brel ba gcig las gzhan pa'i rdzas de dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A substance that is related to a particular place, etc. is not different from that substance,

original: 'brel ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not related to it. This is the conclusion.

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs de dag nyid gzhan las khyad par du gyur pas khyad par te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs de dag nyid gzhan las khyad par du gyur pas khyad par te /
translated: The particular is that which is distinguished from others by a particular place, time, and condition.

original: de dag tu nges pa'i rdzas gcig dang lhan cig tu spyi 'dres pa ste /üîΩrdzas yul la sogs par nges pa'i @7a * //
analyzed: de dag tu nges pa'i rdzas gcig dang lhan cig tu spyi 'dres pa ste / rdzas yul la sogs par nges pa'i @7a * //
translated: The universal is mixed with a substance that is determined in those places, etc.

original: phyir 'dres pa yang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir 'dres pa yang nges pa yin no //
translated: Because the substance is determined in a particular place, etc., the mixture is also determined.

original: 'dres pa des rnam par ma bcad cing khyad par du ma byas pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gang yin pa des stong pa ste dben pa 'am /
analyzed: 'dres pa des rnam par ma bcad cing khyad par du ma byas pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gang yin pa des stong pa ste dben pa 'am /
translated: That which is empty of any other nature that is not distinguished or differentiated by that mixture,

original: yang na de stong zhing med pa ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de stong zhing med pa ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: is devoid of it, or it does not exist.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ni nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ni nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the reason is: because the nature that is determined is not different from the nature that is related to the manifestation.

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir gzhan dang mi ldan ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir gzhan dang mi ldan ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is not associated with another because of being empty of intrinsic reality?

original: gcig po ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gcig po ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe one . . .‚Äù

original: yul gzhan la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa dang 'brel ba gcig ni yul gzhan dang 'brel pa gzhan dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur gyi du ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa dang 'brel ba gcig ni yul gzhan dang 'brel pa gzhan dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur gyi du ma ni ma yin no //
translated: The one that is related to a distinction made by another object, etc., is not associated with another that is related to another object, but not the many.

original: du ma la yod pa gang yin pa ste 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba'i don ston par byed de du ma la yod par 'dod pa'i gcig po gang yin pa de la thal ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ma la yod pa gang yin pa ste 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba'i don ston par byed de du ma la yod par 'dod pa'i gcig po gang yin pa de la thal ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which exists in the many is what is meant. This shows the meaning of the reductio. The meaning is that the one that is asserted to exist in the many is subject to this reductio.

original: gcig po rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin mod gzhan dang mi ldan par go ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gcig po rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin mod gzhan dang mi ldan par go ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But the one is empty of intrinsic reality, so how can it be understood to be not associated with another?

original: bshad pa / de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni gcig gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni gcig gi rang bzhin no //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that way . . .‚Äù The intrinsic reality of the one.

original: rdzas gang dag la yul la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa de dag dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: rdzas gang dag la yul la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa de dag dang ldan par ro //
translated: It is associated with those things that have distinctions of place, etc.

original: yul tha dad pa dang ldan pa ni du ma'i bdag nyid can khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa dang ldan pa ni du ma'i bdag nyid can khyab pa yin no //
translated: The possessor of different objects is the pervader of the many.

original: de la gcig nyid ni khyab par byed pa du ma'i dngos po nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gcig nyid ni khyab par byed pa du ma'i dngos po nyid dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: There, singularity is incompatible with the nature of the pervader of the many.

original: khyab par byed pa rdzas du ma dang ldan pa yang 'gal ba dngos po la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa rdzas du ma dang ldan pa yang 'gal ba dngos po la yod pa yin te /
translated: The possessor of many pervading substances is also incompatible with the existence of things.

original: nges na 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nges na 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: If so, it is because of incompatibility.

original: des na 'dir khyab par byed pa du ma nyid med bas khyab par bya ba du ma la yod pa nyid med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir khyab par byed pa du ma nyid med bas khyab par bya ba du ma la yod pa nyid med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, since there is no pervader of the many, the existence of the pervaded of the many is stated to be non-existent.

original: khyab pa gang las she na /
analyzed: khyab pa gang las she na /
translated: From what pervasion?

original: brjod pa / yul la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi tha dad pa'i du ma la yod pa'i yul la sogs pa tha dad na yod par 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: brjod pa / yul la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi tha dad pa'i du ma la yod pa'i yul la sogs pa tha dad na yod par 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: It is said: The existence of the many that exists in the different objects, etc. is when the different objects, etc. exist.

original: yul du ma la yod pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir du ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul du ma la yod pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir du ma nyid yin no //
translated: The existence in the many objects is the many itself because it possesses incompatible properties.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig yongs su gcad pa ni gang zhig rnam par gcod pa de dag ni rnam par gcad par bya ba dngos por yod na phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig yongs su gcad pa ni gang zhig rnam par gcod pa de dag ni rnam par gcad par bya ba dngos por yod na phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Thus, that which is an exclusion is mutually different from that which is an inclusion.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig @7b med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig @7b med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were not so, then there would be no single entity.

original: tha dad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not different,

original: sngon po dang / sngon po ma yin pa bzhin dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang / sngon po ma yin pa bzhin dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin no //
translated: like blue and not-blue, like entity and non-entity.üîΩEven when something is an exclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc., it is an inclusion in dependence on another object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on another object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on another object, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig yul la sogs pa'i khyad par la brten par yongs su gcod pa na yang de yang rang bzhin nyams pa yul de la mi brten pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rnam par gcod pa yin no //üîΩgang zhig yul gang med pa la mi 'khrul bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin de ni yul des ma byas pa'i phyir na rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yul la sogs pa'i khyad par la brten par yongs su gcod pa na yang de yang rang bzhin nyams pa yul de la mi brten pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rnam par gcod pa yin no //üîΩgang zhig yul gang med pa la mi 'khrul bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin de ni yul des ma byas pa'i phyir na rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: That which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc., is an inclusion in dependence on a particular object, etc.üîΩThat which is an exclusion in dependence on another object, etc.,

original: des na de yongs su spangs nas mngon par 'dod pa'i yul brten pa nyid yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de yongs su spangs nas mngon par 'dod pa'i yul brten pa nyid yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having completely eliminated that, it determines the object that is the basis of the desire.

original: yul gcig gang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yang yul gzhan med pa la mi 'khrul bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gcig gang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yang yul gzhan med pa la mi 'khrul bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Even though the object is related to one thing, it is not mistaken in abiding in the absence of another object.

original: de'i yul ni yul gzhan spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni yul gzhan spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its object abides, having eliminated another object.

original: des na yul gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid ni de yongs su spangs nas rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yul gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid ni de yongs su spangs nas rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation to another object is eliminated, having completely eliminated that.

original: de'i phyir de'i yu dang gzhan gyi yul can dag ni yul de la brten pa dang mi brten pa nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yu dang gzhan gyi yul can dag ni yul de la brten pa dang mi brten pa nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of that and the object of another are contradictory in relation to that object, because of the basis and the nonbasis.

original: de'i phyir de'i yul can nyid ma bkag par /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yul can nyid ma bkag par /
translated: Therefore, without refuting the object of that,

original: de'i yul can yang yin la gzhan gyi yul can yang yin no zhes gnyi ga ltar sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can yang yin la gzhan gyi yul can yang yin no zhes gnyi ga ltar sgrub pa yin no //
translated: both are established, because it is the object of that and it is the object of another.

original: gcig nyid sgrub pa dang 'gag ba ni 'gal ba yin gyi du mar gyur pa dag ni gnyi ga ltar yang sgrub pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid sgrub pa dang 'gag ba ni 'gal ba yin gyi du mar gyur pa dag ni gnyi ga ltar yang sgrub pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
translated: The refutation of the assertion that the establishment of oneness and the establishment of manyness are contradictory, but that the cessation of oneness and the cessation of manyness are not contradictory, is as follows:

original: yul gcig na gnas pa nyid ni yul gzhan na gnas pa yongs su spangs nas gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig na gnas pa nyid ni yul gzhan na gnas pa yongs su spangs nas gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because abiding in one place is abiding after completely abandoning abiding in another place.

original: de bzhin du gnas skabs gzhan dang 'brel pa la yang 'gal bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas skabs gzhan dang 'brel pa la yang 'gal bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, you should understand that the connection with another state is contradictory.

original: dus gzhan dang 'brel ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med ba dag gis 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: dus gzhan dang 'brel ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med ba dag gis 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: The connection with another time is contradictory because of the existence and nonexistence of things.

original: yul la sogs pas byas pa'i 'gal ba ston pa na yul la sogs pa'i khyad par smos pa byas pa yin te /
analyzed: yul la sogs pas byas pa'i 'gal ba ston pa na yul la sogs pa'i khyad par smos pa byas pa yin te /
