translated: When demonstrating the contradiction that is made by the object and so on, the qualification of the object and so on is stated.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rang bzhin tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rang bzhin tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would simply say, ‚ÄúBecause there is no difference in their intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: yul tha dad pa la sogs pa la yod pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas khyab la /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa la sogs pa la yod pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas khyab la /
translated: That which exists in a different object and so on is pervaded by possessing contradictory qualities.

original: de yang du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma'i bdag nyid kyis kyang khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma'i bdag nyid kyis kyang khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since it is many, it would also be pervaded by the nature of many.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'di @8a * //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'di @8a * //
translated: This non-observation of the pervader

original: ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir thal ba bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'di nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ni grub pa yin pa'i phyir thal ba bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'di nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: is established. Therefore, the reason that reverses the consequence should be understood from this very [reason].

original: 'ga' zhig yul la sogs pa du ma yod pa de ni du ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yul la sogs pa du ma yod pa de ni du ma nyid yin la /
translated: If something exists as many in terms of place and so forth, it is many.

original: spyi yang de lta yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid du 'gyur na du ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thal ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: spyi yang de lta yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid du 'gyur na du ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thal ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Since universals are also like that, they would be many. The reversal of the consequence is that [universals] are not many.

original: du ma med pa tsam nyid ni spyi med pa yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: du ma med pa tsam nyid ni spyi med pa yang grub pa yin no //
translated: The mere absence of many is also established as the absence of universals.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de med bas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir 'di la gzhi gdon mi za ba ra 'dod ba ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de med bas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir 'di la gzhi gdon mi za ba ra 'dod ba ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: For that very reason, it is explained that because of the absence of that [universal], it does not engage in that [particular], so it is not necessarily accepted as a basis.

original: gzhan gyis kun brtags pas thal bar sgrub pa gang yin pa ni rang rgyud du bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun brtags pas thal bar sgrub pa gang yin pa ni rang rgyud du bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is established as a consequence by the imputation of others should not be taken as an autonomous [reason].

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on kyang thal ba bzlog pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir ro // 'on kyang thal ba bzlog pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason is not established.üîΩBut in order to show that the reductio is final,

original: don gyis rtogs par bya ba'i thal ba bzlog ba ni dper brjod par byas la /
analyzed: don gyis rtogs par bya ba'i thal ba bzlog ba ni dper brjod par byas la /
translated: the reductio is stated by implication,

original: dngos su dper brjod par bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba ni rtogs par byas pa yin no //üîΩthal bar 'gyur ba'i dgos pa bshad pa ni thal bar 'gyur ba de ni khyab par bya ba'i chos gcig du ma la 'jug pa nyid khas blangs na /
analyzed: dngos su dper brjod par bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba ni rtogs par byas pa yin no // thal bar 'gyur ba'i dgos pa bshad pa ni thal bar 'gyur ba de ni khyab par bya ba'i chos gcig du ma la 'jug pa nyid khas blangs na /
translated: and the reductio that is actually stated is understood by implication.

original: khyab par byed pa gzhan du ma nyid khas blangs pa bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa gzhan du ma nyid khas blangs pa bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: The explanation of the purpose of the reductio is this: The reductio is stated in order to show that if one accepts that the predicate of the proposition, which is the pervasion, is instantiated in many things, then one must accept that the pervader is also instantiated in many things.

original: khyab par byed pa des khas mi len na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos gnyi ga ldog par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bzlog pa'i don to //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa des khas mi len na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos gnyi ga ldog par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bzlog pa'i don to //
translated: If one does not accept the pervader, then one must reject both the pervaded and the pervader. This is the meaning of the reductio.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, this is not a reason that is a reductio.

original: de lta ma yin na du ma la yod pa'i phyir spyin gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin bzlog pa ni sgrub par byed par 'gyur gyi ldog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na du ma la yod pa'i phyir spyin gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin bzlog pa ni sgrub par byed par 'gyur gyi ldog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, since it exists in the many, the reversal of the nature ‚Äúit is not one‚Äù would be the proof, but it would not be the reversal.

original: des na chos gcig khas blangs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'di ni don ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na chos gcig khas blangs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'di ni don ma 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this scripture, ‚ÄúIf one accepts one phenomenon,‚Äù and so on, would be meaningless.

original: 'di la thal bar 'gyur ba'i don ni sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la thal bar 'gyur ba'i don ni sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Here, the meaning of the reductio is the proof.

original: bzlog pa ni ldog par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ldog par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The reversal is said to be the reversal.

original: gang dag rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa ni gcig nyid mtshon pa yin par bsams nas khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par byed pa de'i ltar na yang gzhung 'di'i don shin tu mi 'grig go //
analyzed: gang dag rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa ni gcig nyid mtshon pa yin par bsams nas khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par byed pa de'i ltar na yang gzhung 'di'i don shin tu mi 'grig go //
translated: Those who think that the emptiness of one thing by another is the exemplification of one and make the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion, in that case, too, the meaning of this scripture is not at all correct.

original: de'i ltar na yang du ma la yod pa nyid yin na ni gcig nyid ma yin no zhes gcig dang 'gal pa du mas khyab par bya ba du ma la yod pa nyid dmigs pa ni thal ba las bzlog pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i ltar na yang du ma la yod pa nyid yin na ni gcig nyid ma yin no zhes gcig dang 'gal pa du mas khyab par bya ba du ma la yod pa nyid dmigs pa ni thal ba las bzlog pa yin na /
translated: In that case, if something exists in many things, it is not one. The pervasion of many things by the contradictory of one is the observation of the existence of many things, which is the opposite of the reductio.

original: da @8b la ni gang gis gzhung 'di legs par 'grig par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: da @8b la ni gang gis gzhung 'di legs par 'grig par 'gyur ba /
translated: Now, how can this passage be interpreted so that it fits well with the text?

original: bshad pa / khyab par bya ba chos gnyi ga sgrub pa la dgag pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / khyab par bya ba chos gnyi ga sgrub pa la dgag pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Reply: There is no negation in the proof of both the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa thal ba las bzlog pa ni 'di gzhung la snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa thal ba las bzlog pa ni 'di gzhung la snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nonobservation of the pervader, which is the opposite of the reductio, does appear in this passage.

original: yang ji ltar sgrub par dang dgag pa'i chos dag 'khrul pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sgrub par dang dgag pa'i chos dag 'khrul pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can the property of the probandum and the property of the negation be unmistaken?

original: bshad pa / rnam par dbye ba ni tha dad par gnas ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / rnam par dbye ba ni tha dad par gnas ba ste /
translated: Reply: The division is the separate existence.

original: khyab par byed pa gcig las khyab par bya ba so sor gnas bzod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa gcig las khyab par bya ba so sor gnas bzod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the pervaded is not able to exist separately from the pervader.

original: ci'i phyir de lta yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta yin zhe na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: bshad pa / khyab par bya ba de ni khyab par byed pa'i chos gzhan du 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / khyab par bya ba de ni khyab par byed pa'i chos gzhan du 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Because that which is pervaded is related to another phenomenon that pervades it.

original: dngos su zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: ‚Äú Directly‚Äù means by nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: It is characterized by being the same nature or arising from that.

original: gang zhig gang la ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa zhes bya ba de ji ltar gzhan du gnas pa yin /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa zhes bya ba de ji ltar gzhan du gnas pa yin /
translated: How could that which is related to something by nature exist as another?

original: de skad brjod pas ni 'brel ba ma grub pas ni thal bar 'gyur ba ni 'khrul pa bzlog pa yang mi 'grub po zhes bshad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de skad brjod pas ni 'brel ba ma grub pas ni thal bar 'gyur ba ni 'khrul pa bzlog pa yang mi 'grub po zhes bshad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: By saying that, it is explained that because the relation is not established, the consequence is not established, and the refutation of error is also not established.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni gal te chos 'di thal bar sgrub na'o //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni gal te chos 'di thal bar sgrub na'o //
translated: Now, if this phenomenon is established as a consequence,üîΩHere, if one asserts that a generality exists in many, if one establishes the consequence that many would be accepted, then since it would be established that many is impossible in one, how could this be?

original: 'dir yang spyi du ma la yod bar khas len na du ma nyid khas blangs pa'i don du thal bar sgrub na du ma nyid gcig la mi srid pa gang yin pa de sgrub par 'gyur bas 'di ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhes gzhan dag dogs pa la
analyzed: 'dir yang spyi du ma la yod bar khas len na du ma nyid khas blangs pa'i don du thal bar sgrub na du ma nyid gcig la mi srid pa gang yin pa de sgrub par 'gyur bas 'di ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhes gzhan dag dogs pa la
translated: Others suspect this.

original: / bshad pa /
analyzed: / bshad pa /
translated: The explanation:

original: gcig la du ma mi srid pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gcig la du ma mi srid pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it impossible for one to be many,

original: gang zhig gcig la mi srid pa'i du ma nyid des khyab pa yul la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rdzas la yod pa zhes bya ba'i chos de yang spyi la sogs pa gcig po de la mi srid de /
analyzed: gang zhig gcig la mi srid pa'i du ma nyid des khyab pa yul la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rdzas la yod pa zhes bya ba'i chos de yang spyi la sogs pa gcig po de la mi srid de /
translated: but also that which is impossible for one, namely, being many, is pervaded by the property of existing in a substance that is a different object, and so on. That property is also impossible for that one, such as the universal.

original: de'i phyir khyab par bya ba yul du man gnas pa de khas len na gzhan du ma nyid de gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par bya ba yul du man gnas pa de khas len na gzhan du ma nyid de gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, if you accept that the object that is pervaded, namely, being many, exists, then it is impossible to reverse the entailment that it is necessarily many.

original: gal te yang chos gnyis ldog par bstan pa'i don du 'dod pa yin pa de ltar na yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / du ma nyid du dam bcas pa gang yin pa de la yang khas blangs pa gcig nyid kyis gnod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yang chos gnyis ldog par bstan pa'i don du 'dod pa yin pa de ltar na yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / du ma nyid du dam bcas pa gang yin pa de la yang khas blangs pa gcig nyid kyis gnod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you assert that the purpose of teaching the reversal of the two properties is to show that the reason is not established, and that the thesis that it is many is undermined by the very acceptance of one,

original: sogs pa smos pas ni mang po dag la rnam pa gcig tu shes pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni mang po dag la rnam pa gcig tu shes pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: then, since the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is used, it is seen that there is a single aspect in the cognition of many.

original: gcig nyid rjes su @9a * //
analyzed: gcig nyid rjes su @9a * //
translated: The one is the object ofüîΩcontemplation.üîΩ

original: dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: dpag pa yin te /
translated: It is inferred that it is one.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa gnod pa dang / yan lag can gyi rdzas rags pa nyid ni mngon sum du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa gnod pa dang / yan lag can gyi rdzas rags pa nyid ni mngon sum du grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the inference is contradicted, and the grossness of the substance that is the whole is established by direct perception.

original: des na mngon sum gyi gnod pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi gnod pa gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction with direct perception is accepted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrgol ba de rang ste bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa gzhan du ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rgol ba de rang ste bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa gzhan du ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba khas len par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba khas len par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opponent himself accepts the contradiction, and he remains in the contradiction.

original: sangs rgyas pa ni spyi med par smra ba la gnas te /üîΩthal ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pas de'i tshe gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs du ma la yod pa zhes bya ba ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ni spyi med par smra ba la gnas te / thal ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pas de'i tshe gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs du ma la yod pa zhes bya ba ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Buddhist remains in the assertion that there is no universal.üîΩWhen the proof of the reductio is stated, then the reason, ‚Äúexisting in many,‚Äù is not established because the basis is not established.

original: sngar thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs grub na de'i 'og tu thal ba las bzlog par bya bar nus kyi ma grub na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs grub na de'i 'og tu thal ba las bzlog par bya bar nus kyi ma grub na ni ma yin no //
translated: If the reason of the reductio is established, then the reversal of the reductio can be done after that, but if it is not established, it cannot.

original: de bzhin du du ma la yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa na spyir smra ba la brten par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du du ma la yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa na spyir smra ba la brten par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, when one apprehends something as existing in many things, one is speaking in terms of a universal.

original: de la yang spyi ni gcig yin pas na du ma la yod pa'i phyir du ma nyid yin par dam bcas pa la /üîΩgcig nyid du khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang spyi ni gcig yin pas na du ma la yod pa'i phyir du ma nyid yin par dam bcas pa la / gcig nyid du khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: And in that case, since the universal is one, the assertion that it exists in many things is undermined by the fact that it is accepted as being one.

original: des na de ltar khas len pa gzhan du gnas pa spyi med par smra ba la ni gtan tshigs ma grub ba yin la /
analyzed: des na de ltar khas len pa gzhan du gnas pa spyi med par smra ba la ni gtan tshigs ma grub ba yin la /
translated: Thus, for those who accept the universal in this way, the reason is not established for those who maintain that the universal does not exist.

original: gcig nyid du smra bas gnod pa ni khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid du smra bas gnod pa ni khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: And for those who maintain that the universal is one, the assertion is undermined by the fact that it is accepted as being many.üîΩTherefore, it is said that the reason is not unestablished for those who maintain that the universal does not exist in a different way from that accepted by the opponent.

original: de las khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang spangs pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: de las khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang spangs pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
translated: And it is not the case that both are rejected because the assertion is rejected in a different way from that accepted by the opponent.

original: lung gi don brtags pa'i dus na lung 'ga' yang khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gi don brtags pa'i dus na lung 'ga' yang khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For when the meaning of the scriptures is examined, no scripture is accepted at all.

original: yang dag par rtogs par byed pa 'di bye brag pa'i lung brtags te bor nas yang de brtags pa la grub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs par byed pa 'di bye brag pa'i lung brtags te bor nas yang de brtags pa la grub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the Vai≈õe·π£ika scriptures are examined and rejected as a means of correct understanding. But it is not that the Vai≈õe·π£ika scriptures are established as a means of correct understanding.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not necessary.

original: nges par ma brtags pa'i lung gzhan la yongs su dag pa'i don yod par srid kyang /
analyzed: nges par ma brtags pa'i lung gzhan la yongs su dag pa'i don yod par srid kyang /
translated: Although it is possible that another scripture that has not been examined has a pure meaning,

original: gang gis khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas par 'gyur ba sangs rgyas pa'i lung ni rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas par 'gyur ba sangs rgyas pa'i lung ni rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: the Buddhist scriptures are not imagined to be otherwise, since they are accepted by those who do not remain in contradiction.

original: gal te 'gal ba khas blangs pa la mi gnas na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba khas blangs pa la mi gnas na /
translated: If one does not remain in contradiction when accepting a contradiction,

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis don gang rtogs pa de las gzhan yang rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni zhes smos so //

original: gang gi phyir de nyid de'i khas len pa'i dus yin pa de'i phyir khas len pa'i dus der gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i rigs pa'i stobs kyis gcig khas blangs na nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i don ci snyed pa de mtha' dag khas blang par bya'i 'ga' zhig
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid de'i khas len pa'i dus yin pa de'i phyir khas len pa'i dus der gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i rigs pa'i stobs kyis gcig khas blangs na nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i don ci snyed pa de mtha' dag khas blang par bya'i 'ga' zhig
translated: One should not accept some

original: ni ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: ni ma yin pa 'am /
translated: but not others.

original: gcig dor na thams cad kyang btang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gcig dor na thams cad kyang btang ba nyid do //
translated: If one rejects one, then one must reject all.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: khas len pa'i dus su rtogs pa dang ldan pas rigs pas yongs su brtags nas khas blang bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: khas len pa'i dus su rtogs pa dang ldan pas rigs pas yongs su brtags nas khas blang bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: When one accepts something, one should do so after investigating it with reasoning, having gained understanding.

original: tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not do so merely with words.

original: khyab par bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: That which is pervaded cannot occur without the pervader.

original: des na 'di sa de nyid rigs pas rtogs na de la 'khrul pa med pa can gzhan yang rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di sa de nyid rigs pas rtogs na de la 'khrul pa med pa can gzhan yang rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one understands that by reasoning, then one will also understand the other things that are not in error with respect to that.

original: de bas na bstan pa'i rtogs pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa'i rtogs pa de nyid ni /
translated: Thus, that very understanding of the teaching

original: gnyis pa rtogs pa de 'dra ba de 'phen par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa rtogs pa de 'dra ba de 'phen par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The second, the realization of that sort, is the impelling cause.

original: don bla lhag rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don bla lhag rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the realization of the object, the superior, is not.

original: des na khas blangs pa gzhan du na gnas pa las ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na khas blangs pa gzhan du na gnas pa las ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the thesis is not established because it is different from the proof.

original: spyi de nyid khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi de nyid khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal itself is the thesis.

original: khas blangs pas gnod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pas gnod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the thesis contradicted by the thesis,

original: da rung chos gzhan khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da rung chos gzhan khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other property that is the thesis.

original: de ltar na gzhan du khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan du khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ma grub pa la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because there is no other thesis, the thesis is not unestablished, etc.

original: gzhan yang khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas kyang ma grub pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas kyang ma grub pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, even if the thesis is different from the proof, it is not unestablished, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos gnyis 'brel par brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gnyis 'brel par brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two properties are expressed in relation.

original: gal te du ma la yod pa nyid de lta yin na du ma nyid 'di yang 'gyur ba 'am du ma nyid ma yin na ni gnyi ga yang mi @10a * //
analyzed: gal te du ma la yod pa nyid de lta yin na du ma nyid 'di yang 'gyur ba 'am du ma nyid ma yin na ni gnyi ga yang mi @10a * //
translated: If the existence of the universal in the many is so, then this would be the many, or if it is not the many, then both are not established.

original: 'gyur ro zhes de ltar chos nyid mi 'khrul bar rab tu ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes de ltar chos nyid mi 'khrul bar rab tu ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that reality is not erroneous.

original: don ni 'di yin to /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin to /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: gang gis ma grub pa'am /üîΩkhas blangs pas gnod par 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pe 'am /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ga' yang nges ba nyid du mi brjod kyi /

original: thal ba'i gtan tshigs ni nges par 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thal ba'i gtan tshigs ni nges par 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: One does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩOne does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩOne does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩOne does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩOne does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩOne does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩOne does not state any property to be established that is not established for oneself or that is undermined by one‚Äôs acceptance.

analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel ba ston pa tsam du zad do //üîΩde ni the tshom za ba la yang nus pa yin no //
translated: One does not state any property to

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub par skyon du 'gyur zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig gis dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub par skyon du 'gyur zhe na / bshad pa / nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtha' gcig gis dngos po ste /
translated: But if the reason that is stated as a reductio is not established, then there is a fault.

original: sgrub par byed pa 'am bsgrub par bya ba dag der yongs su 'dzi na ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'am bsgrub par bya ba dag der yongs su 'dzi na ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: ‚ÄúIf you assert that it is certain‚Äù means that if you assert that the reason and the predicate of the probandum are things that are limited to one of the two, then there would be a fault, such as the reason not being established.

original: 'o na ji ltar thal ba las bzlog pa gcig tu nges par 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar thal ba las bzlog pa gcig tu nges par 'dzin ce na /
translated: But how can you apprehend the opposite of the reductio as certain?

original: bshad pa / gtan tshigs yod na ni ste grub na ni des par yongs su bzung na yang skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gtan tshigs yod na ni ste grub na ni des par yongs su bzung na yang skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: We respond: If the reason is established, that is, if it is proven, then even if you apprehend it as certain, there is no fault.

original: du ma med pa nyid ni spyi la sogs pa dngos po med pa la yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: du ma med pa nyid ni spyi la sogs pa dngos po med pa la yang grub pa yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of a plurality is established even in the case of nonthings, such as universals.

original: bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs grub na skyon med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs grub na skyon med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there no fault if the reason that is the opposite of the reductio is established,

original: 'on kyang thal ba'i gtan tshigs la yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thal ba'i gtan tshigs la yang yin no //
translated: but also the reason that is the reductio is established.

original: dper na rtag par smra ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa'i yod pas sgra mi rtag par thal bar grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtag par smra ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa'i yod pas sgra mi rtag par thal bar grub pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is established that sound is impermanent because of the existence that is accepted by the proponents of permanence.

original: gang gi phyir khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas kyang bzlog pa dang thal ba 'ba' zhig la nges par yongs su bzung ba skyon du mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khas blangs pa gzhan du gnas kyang bzlog pa dang thal ba 'ba' zhig la nges par yongs su bzung ba skyon du mi 'gyur ba /
translated: Because even if the acceptance is otherwise, the reversal and the mere consequence are definitely accepted, there is no fault.

original: ji ltar na gcig nyid la sogs pa khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba sgrub par nus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig nyid la sogs pa khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba sgrub par nus she na /
translated: How can one prove the contradiction with the acceptance of oneness and so on?üîΩIt is explained:

original: bshad pa / rigs pas 'dod pa ni gdon mi za bar yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rigs pas 'dod pa ni gdon mi za bar yin te /
translated: The acceptance by reasoning is definitely so,

original: de mi 'dzin na ni gzung bar rung ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'dzin na ni gzung bar rung ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that is not apprehended, there is no other suitable apprehension.

original: lung yang rigs pas 'thad pas na @10b gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du gzhan yang gzung bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: lung yang rigs pas 'thad pas na @10b gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du gzhan yang gzung bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: Also, the scripture is accepted by reasoning, so that which is to be apprehended is just like that.

original: gal te gang du khas blangs pa dang mi 'gal ba de rigs pas gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang du khas blangs pa dang mi 'gal ba de rigs pas gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If it is argued that that which is not contradictory with the acceptance is to be apprehended by reasoning,

original: khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas ni rigs pa la gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas ni rigs pa la gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but the contradiction with the acceptance harms the reasoning,üîΩthen it is replied:

original: khas blangs pas zhes smos te /
analyzed: khas blangs pas zhes smos te /
translated: The text says by accepting it.üîΩüîΩ

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi skabs su bshad par bya'o //
translated: The phrase by accepting is to be explained in the section on the characteristics of a position.

original: gal te gang gis gtan tshigs grub pa ste bzung bar rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gang gis gtan tshigs grub pa ste bzung bar rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the reason is established, that is, if it is apprehended, is it not proper?

original: ji ltar na ma grub pa khas blangs pa tsam gyis du ma la yod pa nyid kyis du ma nyid gdon mi za bar khas blangs par bya bar bshad ce na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na ma grub pa khas blangs pa tsam gyis du ma la yod pa nyid kyis du ma nyid gdon mi za bar khas blangs par bya bar bshad ce na ;
translated: How is it that by merely accepting the nonestablished, the existence in the many is explained as necessarily accepted, because of the many?

original: gang gi don gyi chos kyis khas len pa na des gdon mi za ba kho na gzhan khas blangs pa de ni rigs pa kho nas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi don gyi chos kyis khas len pa na des gdon mi za ba kho na gzhan khas blangs pa de ni rigs pa kho nas byas pa yin no //
translated: When one accepts a property of the object, then by that very fact, one necessarily accepts the other. That is done by reason alone.

original: ji ltar khyab par bya ba mthong na gzhan du mi 'thad pas khyab par byed pa khas blangs bar bya ba de bzhin du tshad ma med par yod pa nyid du khas blangs pas khyab par byed pa gdon mi za bar khas blangs par 'gyur ba yin no
analyzed: ji ltar khyab par bya ba mthong na gzhan du mi 'thad pas khyab par byed pa khas blangs bar bya ba de bzhin du tshad ma med par yod pa nyid du khas blangs pas khyab par byed pa gdon mi za bar khas blangs par 'gyur ba yin no
translated: Just as when one sees the pervasion, because it is not tenable otherwise, one accepts the pervader, in the same way, by accepting existence without a valid cognition, one necessarily accepts the pervader.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning.

original: gal te gtan tshigs grub na nges par mtha' gcig tu 'dzin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs grub na nges par mtha' gcig tu 'dzin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pas /
translated: If the reason is established, then one must definitely hold to one position or the other.

original: nges pa'i yan lag ma yin pa 'brel pa bstan par byas pa 'am /
analyzed: nges pa'i yan lag ma yin pa 'brel pa bstan par byas pa 'am /
translated: So what is the point of teaching a connection that is not a part of the ascertainment?

original: gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: What would the opponent do?

original: rgol ba nges par yan la ga nyid smra na tshig la rna gtad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgol ba nges par yan la ga nyid smra na tshig la rna gtad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If one speaks with the intention of definitely ascertaining the opponent, then one should pay attention to the words.

original: gtan tshigs med kyang zhes smos te rtsa ba ni rtsom par 'gyur ba dang rtsom pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med kyang zhes smos te rtsa ba ni rtsom par 'gyur ba dang rtsom pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: Even though there is no reason, the root is the composition and the reason for the composition.

original: gang gi don du thal bar byed pa ni rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi don du thal bar byed pa ni rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The root is that for the sake of which one makes a consequence.

original: thal ba byed pas ni gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig nges par byed 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: thal ba byed pas ni gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig nges par byed 'dod pa yin no //
translated: By making a consequence, one definitely wishes to make the opponent ascertain something.

original: nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yang gtan tshigs grub pa yin pa'i phyir gang zhig der grub pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yang gtan tshigs grub pa yin pa'i phyir gang zhig der grub pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: The reason for this certainty is that the proof is established. Therefore, whatever is the reason that proves that is the specific proof of the relation between the pervaded and the pervader.

original: gang zhig du ma la yod pa de ni du ma nyid do zhes khyab par rab tu ston pa tsam yin yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'phen pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa yin no //üîΩthal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas kyang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'phen pa yin pa des na 'di ni @11a * //
analyzed: gang zhig du ma la yod pa de ni du ma nyid do zhes khyab par rab tu ston pa tsam yin yang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'phen pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa yin no // thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas kyang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'phen pa yin pa des na 'di ni @11a * //
translated: Even if it is merely shown that whatever exists in the many is plurality, it is a proof because it implies a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan yin no //
translated: A valid cognition that contradicts by way of consequence is also implied. Therefore, this is another type of proof.

original: de la 'dir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs thal ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs thal ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: In this case, the original reason is the opposite of the consequence.

original: kha cig tu ni thal ba 'am thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs kyang rtsa bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni thal ba 'am thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs kyang rtsa bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In some cases, even a consequence or a reason that is the opposite of a consequence is not the original reason,

original: ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established.

original: dper na kha cig na re gal te spyi gcig yin na gcig yin pa'i phyir du ma la yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dper na kha cig na re gal te spyi gcig yin na gcig yin pa'i phyir du ma la yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: For example, some say: If there is one universal, it would not exist in many because it is one.

original: du ma la yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: du ma la yod pa yang yin te /
translated: But it does exist in many.üîΩTherefore, it is not one.üîΩIn this case, the reason is not established because the pervasion by the contradictory observation of the reverse and the contradictory observation of the pervader are not established.

original: de'i phyir gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la thal bar 'gyur ba khyab bar byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / bzlog pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa gnyi ga ma grub pa dang ; de bzhin du gal te spyi rang bzhin gzhan gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni yul la sogs ba gcig pu can gcig pu zhig dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la thal bar 'gyur ba khyab bar byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / bzlog pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa gnyi ga ma grub pa dang ; de bzhin du gal te spyi rang bzhin gzhan gyis dben pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni yul la sogs ba gcig pu can gcig pu zhig dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Similarly, if a universal is a nature that is devoid of another nature, it would be related to a single object and so on.üîΩBut it is related to many that possess different objects and so on. Therefore it is a nature of many.

original: yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can du ma dang 'brel ba yin pa de'i phyir du ma'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs gnyi ga ma grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can du ma dang 'brel ba yin pa de'i phyir du ma'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs gnyi ga ma grub pa bzhin no //
translated: In this case, the reason is not established by nature.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rigs la thal ba dang / de las bzlog pa gnyi gas du ma la yod pa nyid du ma nyid kyis khyab pa rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rigs la thal ba dang / de las bzlog pa gnyi gas du ma la yod pa nyid du ma nyid kyis khyab pa rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the pervasion of the many by the many is established by both the reductio and the contrapositive.

original: khyab pa grub na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs gzhan 'jug pa yin gyi thal ba'i gtan tshigs sam bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dag gis gtan tshigs grub pa kho nas 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa khas blangs
analyzed: khyab pa grub na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs gzhan 'jug pa yin gyi thal ba'i gtan tshigs sam bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa dag gis gtan tshigs grub pa kho nas 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dgos pa khas blangs
translated: When the pervasion is established, the root reason, called ‚Äúnonobservation of a pervader,‚Äù is engaged. It is not the case that the establishment of the root reason is accomplished by the nonestablished reason of a reductio or a reason of contraposition.

original: pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The contrapositive of the probandum is not established,

original: gtan tshigs la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason is not a valid cognition.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag mi brjod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag mi brjod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the part of the proof is not stated,

original: rnam pa 'dis kyang rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub bar byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis kyang rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub bar byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this form also projects the valid cognition that establishes the relation of the pervasion between the root reason and the probandum.

original: gal te grangs can gyi sbyor ba ni 'dir yang gtan tshigs skye ba can nam mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir thal ba bzlog pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa dang 'gog pa grangs can gyis 'dod pa yin no zhe na
analyzed: gal te grangs can gyi sbyor ba ni 'dir yang gtan tshigs skye ba can nam mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir thal ba bzlog pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa dang 'gog pa grangs can gyis 'dod pa yin no zhe na
translated: If you say that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs syllogism is: ‚ÄúThe subject, sound, is impermanent because of having production,‚Äù then the reason, having production, is not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya. Therefore, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs assertion that the reverse of the reductio is accepted is not correct.

original: / de ltar byed ba ni su yang med do //
analyzed: / de ltar byed ba ni su yang med do //
translated: No one does it that way.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni grangs can gyis ni sems pa can du mi 'dod la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni grangs can gyis ni sems pa can du mi 'dod la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not assert that pleasure and so on are conscious.

original: @11b sangs rgyas pa ni skye ba can dang mi rtag par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: @11b sangs rgyas pa ni skye ba can dang mi rtag par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: The Buddhist asserts that they are produced and impermanent.

original: de ltar byed pa de su yin /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa de su yin /
translated: Who does it that way?

original: 'dod kyang de ltar byed bar nus pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod kyang de ltar byed bar nus pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Even if one wanted to, one could not do it that way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bshad pa / thal ba dang bzlog pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de dag go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / thal ba dang bzlog pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de dag go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof of the reductio and the reverse of the reductio are not established.

original: gal te thal ba'i gtan tshigs dgag pa la go bar byed pa mi 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thal ba'i gtan tshigs dgag pa la go bar byed pa mi 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt the reason of the reductio a negation?‚Äù

original: bden te / rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa sgrub par byed ba ni 'dod pa kho na yin pas de la go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod ba yin no //
analyzed: bden te / rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa sgrub par byed ba ni 'dod pa kho na yin pas de la go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod ba yin no //
translated: That is true, but the proof of the pervasion of the original reason is only asserted, so it is said that it is not a means of cognition.

original: go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid gang las she na /
translated: From what is it not a means of cognition?

original: sems pa can dang skye ba can dang mi rtag pa de gnyis 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa can dang skye ba can dang mi rtag pa de gnyis 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that the two, being conscious and being impermanent, are contradictory.

original: gal te sems pa can dang de 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems pa can dang de 'gal ba yin na /
translated: If being conscious is contradictory to that,

original: de ltan ni de dag sems ba med pas khyab par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltan ni de dag sems ba med pas khyab par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: then it would follow that they are necessarily unconscious, but not otherwise.

original: 'o na 'gal ba ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'gal ba ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
translated: Well, why is it not established that they are contradictory?

original: bshad pa / cig shos nye ba las sngar rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang la yod pa de rgyun rjes su 'brel par 'byung ba las bltar rung ba'i me gcig yod pas med pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / cig shos nye ba las sngar rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang la yod pa de rgyun rjes su 'brel par 'byung ba las bltar rung ba'i me gcig yod pas med pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: It is said: If something has a cause that is not incomplete prior to the presence of the other, then it is seen that fire arises in relation to the continuity of that cause. Because one fire exists, the other does not. Therefore they are contradictory.

original: phan tshun spangs pa ste rnam par gcad pas gnas pa mtshan nyid de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i ngo bos 'gal bar grub pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa ste rnam par gcad pas gnas pa mtshan nyid de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i ngo bos 'gal bar grub pa yin te /
translated: The nature of the defining characteristic is the mutual exclusion of the two, and it is established that the nature of that is contradictory.

original: 'gal ba 'di dag ni le'u gnyis par rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di dag ni le'u gnyis par rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: These contradictions have been explained in detail in Chapter Two.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis dang sems pa yod pa la ni 'gal ba 'di rnam pa gnyi ga yang grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis dang sems pa yod pa la ni 'gal ba 'di rnam pa gnyi ga yang grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In the case of the two reasons and the existence of intention, neither of these two types of contradiction is established.

original: de'i phyir thal ba dang bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs dag go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ba dang bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs dag go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reductio and the reverse of the reason are not understood.

original: 'o na khyed ji ltar go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed ji ltar go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how do you understand it?

original: gcig la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gcig la ni zhes smos so //
translated: It is said ‚Äúin one.‚Äù

original: ji skad bshad pa'i 'dres pas rnam par ma bcad pa des stong pa nyid kyi phyir yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can gyi rdzas gang yin pa de dag dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i 'dres pas rnam par ma bcad pa des stong pa nyid kyi phyir yul la sogs pa tha dad pa can gyi rdzas gang yin pa de dag dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is empty of the unclarity of the mixture explained above, there is no possession of those substances that have different objects and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin gzhan de med pa dang de yod pa ni phan tshun rnam par bcad pas gnas pa'i rang bzhin de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan de med pa dang de yod pa ni phan tshun rnam par bcad pas gnas pa'i rang bzhin de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of that nature and the presence of that nature are mutually exclusive, because they are contradictory.

original: yul la sogs pa du ma can dang ldan pa ni snga ma bzhin du du ma nyid @12a * //üîΩkyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa du ma can dang ldan pa ni snga ma bzhin du du ma nyid @12a * // kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: The possessor of many objects, etc., is pervaded by plurality, as before.

original: gcig nyid ni du ma med pa yin la du ma nyid kyang du ma la yod pa la gnas pa kho na'i phyir thal ba'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid ni du ma med pa yin la du ma nyid kyang du ma la yod pa la gnas pa kho na'i phyir thal ba'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Since singularity is the absence of plurality, and plurality is only present in the manifold, the reductio argument is understood.

original: de go bar byed pa nyid yin pa na yang bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs kyang go bar byed pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur bas yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: de go bar byed pa nyid yin pa na yang bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs kyang go bar byed pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur bas yang ma bshad do //
translated: And when that is understood, the reversed argument is also stated to be understood, so it is not explained again.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i don 'di nyid sngon gyi slob dpon gyis thal bar 'gyur ba rnams la yod par ston par byed do //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i don 'di nyid sngon gyi slob dpon gyis thal bar 'gyur ba rnams la yod par ston par byed do //
translated: This very meaning of the reductio was shown by the earlier masters to exist in the reductio arguments.

original: 'dis yan lag can 'gog par byed pas na dgag pa ni gzhung ngo //
analyzed: 'dis yan lag can 'gog par byed pas na dgag pa ni gzhung ngo //
translated: Since this refutes the whole, the negation is the text.

original: de la sogs pa spyi'i 'gog pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa spyi'i 'gog pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
translated: and so on, in the treatises that generally refute such things as arising,

original: de rnams su'o //
analyzed: de rnams su'o //
translated: in those treatises.

original: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba gcig du ma la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba gcig du ma la yod pa'o //
translated: Such a kind is said to exist in the one and the many.

original: ci ste khas len na ni bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste khas len na ni bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you accept that, then it is undermined by the treatises.

original: khas mi len na ni gzhi med pa'i phyir gang gi tshe 'gog ce na /
analyzed: khas mi len na ni gzhi med pa'i phyir gang gi tshe 'gog ce na /
translated: But if you do not accept that, then since it would be groundless, when would you refute it?

original: grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan dpyad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan dpyad pa'i skabs su bab pa'i tshe /
translated: When the occasion arises to analyze the reason for accepting tenets,

original: khas len pa'i dus su 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khas len pa'i dus su 'gog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: at that time of accepting, it is refuted. This is the meaning.

original: de lta ma yin te de med par 'gyur na khas blangs nas rnam par dpyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te de med par 'gyur na khas blangs nas rnam par dpyod par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if it did not exist, then having accepted it, you would analyze it,

original: bstan bcos las grub pa'i yan lag can 'dzin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: bstan bcos las grub pa'i yan lag can 'dzin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because the treatise would apprehend the existent whole.

original: de yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yod pa na dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir de yod pa na dgag pa yin no //
translated: But since that is untenable, when it exists, it is refuted.

original: gal te de khas len pa'i dus su der bshad pa'i don bzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de khas len pa'i dus su der bshad pa'i don bzung ba yin gyi /
translated: If you accept that, then at the time of accepting, you would apprehend the meaning explained there.

original: de'i don dgag pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don dgag pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that the meaning of that is refuted.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir du ma la yod pa nyid khas blangs pa ni gcig nyid btang ba med na med pa yin pa de'i phyir chos gnyi ga yod pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir du ma la yod pa nyid khas blangs pa ni gcig nyid btang ba med na med pa yin pa de'i phyir chos gnyi ga yod pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Because the assertion that something exists in the many is not tenable without relinquishing its being one, therefore both properties are refuted.

original: dgag pa 'di 'dra ba de'i khas blangs pa'i sgo kho na nas yin pa des na khas blangs pa'i dus su 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgcig khas blangs pa 'am /
analyzed: dgag pa 'di 'dra ba de'i khas blangs pa'i sgo kho na nas yin pa des na khas blangs pa'i dus su 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gcig khas blangs pa 'am /
translated: This kind of refutation is made only on the basis of the opponent‚Äôs assertion. Therefore it is said that the refutation occurs at the time of the opponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: gzhan btang ba nyid bstan bcos med par ga la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan btang ba nyid bstan bcos med par ga la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that the assertion of one or the relinquishing of another is not a treatise?üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gcig nyid dang du ma la yod pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gcig nyid dang du ma la yod pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to be both one and many.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: chos 'di gnyis mi mthun par ni dngos po nyid kyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di gnyis mi mthun par ni dngos po nyid kyis grub pa yin no //
translated: These two properties are established as incompatible by their very nature.

original: bstan bcos khas len pa'i dus su ni gcig khas len pa dang gzhan btang ba @12b dag gis rjes su rtogs par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos khas len pa'i dus su ni gcig khas len pa dang gzhan btang ba @12b dag gis rjes su rtogs par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: At the time of asserting a treatise, one should understand that the assertion of one and the relinquishing of another are made.

original: de dag bstan bcos las grags ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos las grags ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not known from the treatises.

original: rang gi sgra'i rnam par gcad bar bya ba bshad nas /
analyzed: rang gi sgra'i rnam par gcad bar bya ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the exclusion of the word itself,

original: don gyi sgra'i rnam par gcad par bya ba bshad pa'i phyir don med pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: don gyi sgra'i rnam par gcad par bya ba bshad pa'i phyir don med pa zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe non-existent object,‚Äù in order to explain the exclusion of the object of the word.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rtogs pas sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pas sgro btags pa'o //
translated: It is a superimposition by conception.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba ni de dag gi spyi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba ni de dag gi spyi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of the universal of those is any one of the similar and dissimilar instances.

original: yang ji ltar phyogs dang mthun phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus ba rtogs pas sgra brtags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar phyogs dang mthun phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus ba rtogs pas sgra brtags pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it understood that the superimposition by conception is included in the similar and dissimilar instances?

original: 'dir zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa la sgra dang bum pa dag gam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa la sgra dang bum pa dag gam /
translated: Because in the proof of impermanence, sound and pot,

original: rtag pa sgrub pa la sgra dang nam mkha' dag gis gang yang rung ba'i yan lag gi nye ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa sgrub pa la sgra dang nam mkha' dag gis gang yang rung ba'i yan lag gi nye ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: or in the proof of permanence, sound and space, whatever is the case of the proximity of one of the parts does not exist in reality.

original: 'o na ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: Well, then, what is it like?

original: smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pas byas pa yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pas byas pa yin te zhes smos so //
translated: The speaker makes it so by his desire to speak.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: brjod par 'dod pas de med na brjod par 'dod pa nye ba nyid dang cig shos nye ba ma yin pa'i nye ba dang bskal pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pas de med na brjod par 'dod pa nye ba nyid dang cig shos nye ba ma yin pa'i nye ba dang bskal pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in the absence of that desire to speak, there is no proximity or remoteness of the desire to speak, nor is there any proximity or remoteness of the other.

original: re zhig ji srid du mi rtag pa sgrub par 'dod pa de srid du bum pa ni sgra dang nye ba yin te /
analyzed: re zhig ji srid du mi rtag pa sgrub par 'dod pa de srid du bum pa ni sgra dang nye ba yin te /
translated: As long as one desires to establish impermanence, a pot is proximate to sound,

original: spyi gcig gi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: spyi gcig gi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is a part of the same universal.

original: nam mkha' ni bskal pa yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni bskal pa yin te /
translated: Space is remote,

original: ci de las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci de las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is something external to that.

original: gang gi tshe mi 'dod pa de'i tshe ni nye ba dang bskal pa de dag ldog bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi 'dod pa de'i tshe ni nye ba dang bskal pa de dag ldog bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one no longer desires that, then proximity and remoteness are eliminated.

original: 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'di snyam du /
translated: One might think this:

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yang ldog pa'i chos yin no snyam na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yang ldog pa'i chos yin no snyam na /
translated: The nature of things is also a phenomenon that is eliminated.

original: bshad pa / nye ba dang bskal pa dag dngos po'i rang bzhin yin na ni phyi nas brtags pa'i yul gzhan brjod par 'dod par 'gyur bas bum pa ni bskal par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bshad pa / nye ba dang bskal pa dag dngos po'i rang bzhin yin na ni phyi nas brtags pa'i yul gzhan brjod par 'dod par 'gyur bas bum pa ni bskal par 'gyur la /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: If proximity and distance were the intrinsic reality of things, then later, when one wishes to speak of another object that is examined, the pot would be distant and

original: nam mkha' ni nye bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i gzhan du 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni nye bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i gzhan du 'gyur ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: space would be near. But it is illogical for them to become different in that way.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog pa yin du zin kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyis ni de ldog par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog pa yin du zin kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyis ni de ldog par mi 'thad de /
translated: Even if the intrinsic reality of things were to cease, it would not be tenable that it ceases due to mere desire to speak.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the intrinsic reality of things is not related to the desire to speak.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe gnyis dus gcig tu phan tshun 'gal ba'i rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid @13a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe gnyis dus gcig tu phan tshun 'gal ba'i rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid @13a * //
translated: Moreover, when two things are established as mutually exclusive at the same time, such as permanence and impermanence,

original: sgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe bum pa de nyid nye ba dang bskal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe bum pa de nyid nye ba dang bskal bar 'gyur la /
translated: then at that time the pot would be both near and distant,

original: nam mkha' yang 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: and space would also change.

original: dngos po gcig la cig car yon tan 'gal ba nye ba dang mi nye ba dag bsdu ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la cig car yon tan 'gal ba nye ba dang mi nye ba dag bsdu ba mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to include in one thing incompatible qualities, such as being near and not being near.

original: de'i phyir nye ba dang bskal ba ni brjod par 'dod pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye ba dang bskal ba ni brjod par 'dod pas byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, being near and being distant are done by the desire to express.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sgrub par byed pa'i ngag ni byed pa po'i 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la rag las ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sgrub par byed pa'i ngag ni byed pa po'i 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la rag las ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When the words of such a proof statement are done by the mere desire of the agent, then they are not dependent on the nature of things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po ni de ltar 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pas mi 'jug pa'i phyir te mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni de ltar 'dod pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pas mi 'jug pa'i phyir te mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things do not engage in accordance with mere desire, that is, they do not exist in that way.

original: dngos po'i 'dod pas mi 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'dod pas mi 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin te /
translated: That things do not engage in accordance with desire is established by direct perception.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni su yang dbul por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni su yang dbul por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, no one would be poor.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pas sbyar ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la sogs pa de las ni phyi rol gyi dngos po des pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pas sbyar ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la sogs pa de las ni phyi rol gyi dngos po des pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the position that the external object is not established by the evidence of the object of desire, etc., is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin dag nye ba dang bskal par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin dag nye ba dang bskal par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the object is not established as either near or far.

original: grub na ni dngos po grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub na ni dngos po grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established, the object would be established.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example,

original: gong bu'i khyad par 'ga' zhig tu rva can nyid la 'khrul pa med pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos mthun pa mthong nas so //
analyzed: gong bu'i khyad par 'ga' zhig tu rva can nyid la 'khrul pa med pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi chos mthun pa mthong nas so //
translated: having seen a similarity of nature in some particular mass, such as hornness, without error,üîΩthis mass,

original: gong bu 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //üîΩrva can yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gong bu 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no // rva can yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: is hornless,

original: ba lang dang ba me na gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ba lang dang ba me na gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: because it is either a cow or a camel.

original: de la chos mtshungs pa can gyi khyad par ba lang dang ba men gyi phyogs gcig nyid ni dngos po yin par mngon sum nyid du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chos mtshungs pa can gyi khyad par ba lang dang ba men gyi phyogs gcig nyid ni dngos po yin par mngon sum nyid du grub pa yin te /
translated: The difference between the similar properties, the one horn of a cow and a ram, is established by direct perception as an entity.

original: des na rva can nyid grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rva can nyid grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the horn is established.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la /üîΩrjod par 'dod pa brjod par 'dod pas yul du byas pa nyid ni grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la / rjod par 'dod pa brjod par 'dod pas yul du byas pa nyid ni grub pa yin te /
translated: But if,

original: gang yang rung ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyi bye brag go //
translated: the object of desire is established as the object of desire, not just anything. This is the difference between the two.

original: brjod par 'dod pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam zhig yod pa las grub po //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam zhig yod pa las grub po //
translated: The nature of the object of desire is established from the mere existence of the object of desire.

original: dngos po la grub pa'i gtan tshigs la ni @13b brjod par 'dod pa la gnas par grub bas tha mi dad par lhag par zhe na pa'i sgo nas phyi rol gyi dngos po grub pa yin na /üîΩ'dir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la grub pa'i gtan tshigs la ni @13b brjod par 'dod pa la gnas par grub bas tha mi dad par lhag par zhe na pa'i sgo nas phyi rol gyi dngos po grub pa yin na / 'dir ni ma yin no //
translated: In the case of an established reason, the object of desire is established as the object of desire, and the external object is established by way of the non-difference of the object of desire.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: But that is not the case here.üîΩThat is explained as

original: don gyis stong pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don gyis stong pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: empty of object.

original: gtan tshigs de las phyi rol gyi don grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de las phyi rol gyi don grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The object is not established by that reason.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin brjod par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin brjod par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that you want to express things as they are?

original: de ji ltar ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: How is that not established?

original: dngos po la 'jug par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la 'jug par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty in engaging with things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: Thus is stated.

original: de ltar ni blta bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni blta bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to see thus.

original: mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to see.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it contradicts direct perception.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang la de'i brjod par 'dod pa yod pa der dngos po yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: gang la de'i brjod par 'dod pa yod pa der dngos po yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: It is this: ‚ÄúWhere there is a desire to express it, there is an existent thing.‚Äù

original: nus pa ma yin pas na 'dod pa la dngos po yod pas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa dngos po la 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa ma yin pas na 'dod pa la dngos po yod pas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa dngos po la 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not possible, the pervasion that where there is a desire there is an existent thing is not established. Therefore, desire is mistaken with respect to things.

original: brjod par 'dod pa nyid bsal ba 'dis ni ngas khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / lung las mthong ba dag gtan tshigs ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa nyid bsal ba 'dis ni ngas khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / lung las mthong ba dag gtan tshigs ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This refutation of what is desired to be expressed shows that what I accept is not a reason, as in the statement, ‚ÄúI accept that,‚Äù and that what is seen in the scriptures is not a reason.

original: 'dod pas byas ba bsal mod /
analyzed: 'dod pas byas ba bsal mod /
translated: Although what is done by desire is refuted,

original: lung las grub pa go ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: lung las grub pa go ci ltar zhe na /
translated: how is what is established by the scriptures refuted?

original: tshig ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: tshig ni zhes smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe words . . .‚Äù

original: tshig gi bdag nyid kyi lung ni 'dod pa la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: tshig gi bdag nyid kyi lung ni 'dod pa la rag las pa yin la /
translated: The scriptures that have the nature of words are dependent on desire.

original: 'dod pa yang dngos po dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang dngos po dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsal ba yin no //
translated: And because desire is not related to things, it is refuted.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba rtogs pas sgro btags pa'i chos dang lung de dag ni de dag nyid kyi byed pa po'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa dang / dngos po 'ang 'dod pa med par gzhan du yod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtogs pa dang lung des byas pa ni phyi rol la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba rtogs pas sgro btags pa'i chos dang lung de dag ni de dag nyid kyi byed pa po'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa dang / dngos po 'ang 'dod pa med par gzhan du yod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rtogs pa dang lung des byas pa ni phyi rol la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúrealized‚Äù and ‚Äúscripture‚Äù refer to the phenomena that are imputed by realization. Those are only related to the desire of their creator. And things exist elsewhere without desire. Therefore, what is done by realization and scripture is mistaken with regard to external reality.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba yang rang gis mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba yang rang gis mthong ba yin la /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the probandum also seen?

original: sgrub par byed pa yang yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: And isn‚Äôt the proof also seen?

original: de ji ltar rang gis mthong ba'i sgras sgrub par byed pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rang gis mthong ba'i sgras sgrub par byed pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that only the proof by the words that are seen is apprehended?üîΩResponse: The proof is the statement of the triply characterized reason by the meaning.üîΩThe statement of the position is not the proof.üîΩThe statement of the position is not the proof.

analyzed: bshad pa / don gyis ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa sgrub par byed pa yin la /

analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs dang gtan tshigs brjod pa dag don la dngos su nus ba med de /
translated: The statement of the position is not the proof.üîΩThe statement of the

original: don gyis don rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //üîΩde na de dag rang nyid las te /
analyzed: don gyis don rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro // de na de dag rang nyid las te /
translated: Because the meaning of the words is the cause for understanding the meaning.üîΩThere, they are not established by themselves,

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //

translated: The explanation of the understanding of the meaning by means of the meaning is that it is by means of the meaning,

original: brjod pas ni ma yin te /

translated: not by means of the expression,

original: 'brel pas nges pa mi 'khrul ba de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pas nges pa mi 'khrul ba de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no certainty that is not mistaken with regard to the relation.

original: des na brjod pa ni rang nyid de rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na brjod pa ni rang nyid de rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the expression is not that which establishes, because it does not establish the meaning by its own nature, by itself.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'di sgrub par byed pa yin na ni de'i phyir de las nges par 'gyur ba yin na ;
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'di sgrub par byed pa yin na ni de'i phyir de las nges par 'gyur ba yin na ;
translated: Moreover, if this is that which establishes, then it would be ascertained from that.

original: phyogs kyi tshig las ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don la the tshom zab mthong gis nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshig las ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don la the tshom zab mthong gis nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But from the words of the thesis, one does not see the ascertainment of the meaning of the thesis.

original: na'i sgras ni sgrub par byed pa me yin pa phyogs kyi tshig gtan tshigs kyi tshig las khyab par bya ba yod pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: na'i sgras ni sgrub par byed pa me yin pa phyogs kyi tshig gtan tshigs kyi tshig las khyab par bya ba yod pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The suffix ‚Äúti‚Äù in the word ‚Äúanumeya‚Äù indicates that the proof is fire, and the word ‚Äúpak·π£a‚Äù indicates that the probandum is present.

original: bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir brgyud pas kyang rtogs par byed pa'i nus pa med de /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir brgyud pas kyang rtogs par byed pa'i nus pa med de /
translated: But the word ‚Äúpak·π£a‚Äù does not have the power to convey the probandum indirectly, because it is not mentioned.

original: de'i phyir na phyogs kyi tshig ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na phyogs kyi tshig ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúpak·π£a‚Äù is not the proof.

original: gtan tshigs brjod pas ni nus pa ston par byed pa yin pas dran pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod pas ni nus pa ston par byed pa yin pas dran pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhetu‚Äù indicates the power to convey the probandum, and thus it is the cause of memory.

original: des na rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the inference.

original: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir brgyud pas kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir brgyud pas kyang zhes smos te /
translated: In order to clarify this point, the word ‚Äúparamparye·πáa‚Äù is used.

original: the tshom du gyur pa'i bsgrub par bya ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa'i bsgrub par bya ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum, which is in doubt, is mentioned.

original: gal te de tsam gyis nges na ni gtan tshigs med kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de tsam gyis nges na ni gtan tshigs med kyang 'gyur te /
translated: If the probandum is ascertained by just that, then it would be so even without the reason,

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshig yod kyang de nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshig yod kyang de nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word ‚Äúhetu‚Äù is mentioned, even though it does not exist.

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshigs ni mi 'khrul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshigs ni mi 'khrul ba'i phyir /
translated: The reason is nonerroneous.

original: nus pa bsgrub par bya ba'i las gzhan du 'gyur ba rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nus pa bsgrub par bya ba'i las gzhan du 'gyur ba rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The statement of the other, the probandum, is the statement of the power.

original: de'i phyir nye bar brtags nas sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar brtags nas sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proof is by way of imputation.

original: sgrab par byed pa dran pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshig la sgrub par byed pa nyid du gdags so //
analyzed: sgrab par byed pa dran pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshig la sgrub par byed pa nyid du gdags so //
translated: The word is designated as the proof because it is the cause of the memory of the proof.
