translated: In the same way, that conceptual cognition is not based on the ear, etc., because it exists even when those do not exist.

original: de'i phyir dbang po la brten pa ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po la brten pa ma yin no // de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa bzhin du yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not based on the sense faculties.üîΩThe word ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates the three reasons.

original: de bzhin du de lta ni ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de lta ni ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is used in the sense of ‚Äúnot so,‚Äù in the sense of ‚Äúin that way.‚Äù

original: lus dang bum pa de gnyis gcig dang de ltar zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan nyid du khas len pa yin nam /
analyzed: lus dang bum pa de gnyis gcig dang de ltar zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan nyid du khas len pa yin nam /
translated: Do you accept that the body and the pot are one, and that they are different things?

original: bum pa dang lus dag lus gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan du gyur pa zhes de ltar spyir te /
analyzed: bum pa dang lus dag lus gang yang rung ba'i don gzhan du gyur pa zhes de ltar spyir te /
translated: The pot and the body are different things, in the sense of being different objects.

original: spyi dang ldan pa'i don gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgrub byar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa'i don gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgrub byar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving a universal‚Äù is established as the object of a different nature.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni don gzhan gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni don gzhan gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the nature of another object.

original: lus de lta bu ni dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med par dogs pas rang nyid kyis khas ma blangs pa dang / bum pa yang bum pa las tha dad pa'i don gyi ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir khas ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus de lta bu ni dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med par dogs pas rang nyid kyis khas ma blangs pa dang / bum pa yang bum pa las tha dad pa'i don gyi ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir khas ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: Since such a body is not found in the example, it is not accepted by the opponent himself, and since a pot is not accepted as the nature of an object that is different from a pot, it is not accepted by us.

original: de'i phyir spyi dang ldan pa'i bsgrub bya yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi dang ldan pa'i bsgrub bya yang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for the probandum to possess a universal.

original: mi srid pa de nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mi srid pa de nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to make this impossibility clear by means of an example, he says:

original: 'jig rten 'di lta bu'i ngag gi don srid pa yod dam zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di lta bu'i ngag gi don srid pa yod dam zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIs it possible for a statement in the world to have such a meaning?‚Äù

original: mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not possible. This is the meaning.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag las zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag las zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúDevadatta and Yajnadatta . . .‚Äù

original: 'di la lha spyin du rtogs pa'i zan sbyin par bya ba ni zan spyin par bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: 'di la lha spyin du rtogs pa'i zan sbyin par bya ba ni zan spyin par bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Here, the rice to be given to Devadatta is a particular rice to be given.

original: de bzhin du mchod sbyin du @21a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod sbyin du @21a * //
translated: Similarly, the rice to be given to Yajnadatta is a particular rice to be given.

original: rtogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also a realization.

original: zan sbyin par bya ba 'di nyid spyir gyur pa gang yang rung ba'i sgra'i don gyi yul yang mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: zan sbyin par bya ba 'di nyid spyir gyur pa gang yang rung ba'i sgra'i don gyi yul yang mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: It is not possible that the meaning of the word ‚Äúfood‚Äù in general is the object of this very giving of food.

original: 'di snyam du don 'di ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don 'di ni mi 'gal te /
translated: If you think that this meaning is not contradictory,

original: gang gi phyir lha sbyin la ma yin zhing mchod sbyin la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni sgrub pa tsam zlog par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha sbyin la ma yin zhing mchod sbyin la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni sgrub pa tsam zlog par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: because the words ‚Äúnot to Devadatta‚Äù and ‚Äúnot to Yaj√±adatta‚Äù do not negate the mere establishment of the object,

original: 'on kyang nges pa zlog pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa zlog pa'i don du yin no //
translated: but rather have the purpose of negating a determination,

original: nges pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: nges pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to demonstrate that determination, it is said,

original: lha sbyin 'ba' zhig la ma yin no zhes de ltar nges par bzlog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin 'ba' zhig la ma yin no zhes de ltar nges par bzlog par bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is to be negated in that way, as ‚Äònot to Devadatta alone.‚Äô‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: sgrub ba dang dgag pa dag gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub ba dang dgag pa dag gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because establishment and negation are contradictory in one place,

original: gang yang rung ba'i yul la zan sbyin par bsgrub pa na dgag pa ni nges pa'i yul can nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i yul la zan sbyin par bsgrub pa na dgag pa ni nges pa'i yul can nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: when the establishment of the giving of food to some object is negated, the negation has a determined object.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang yang rung ba smos pa nyid kyis nges par thal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba smos pa nyid kyis nges par thal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere mention of ‚Äúany‚Äù does not entail the definite.

original: nges par thal na ni de'i bzlog pa'i phyir brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: nges par thal na ni de'i bzlog pa'i phyir brjod pa yin na /
translated: If it did entail the definite, then the statement would be for the purpose of refuting that.

original: rnam par brtag pa'i don can gang yang rung ba'i sgra bkod pa nyid kyis thal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa'i don can gang yang rung ba'i sgra bkod pa nyid kyis thal ba med pa yin no //
translated: But there is no entailment of the definite by the mere mention of the word ‚Äúany‚Äù which has the sense of a hypothetical.

original: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba'i sgra nye bar bzung na nges par thal ba med pa de'i phyir gnyi ga yongs su 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba'i sgra nye bar bzung na nges par thal ba med pa de'i phyir gnyi ga yongs su 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Because the mere mention of ‚Äúany‚Äù does not entail the definite, therefore it is not only the case that both are included,

original: gcig yongs su 'dzan pa na gang yang rung ba smos pa 'di don 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig yongs su 'dzan pa na gang yang rung ba smos pa 'di don 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: but also when one is included, the mention of ‚Äúany‚Äù is tenable.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: gcig yongs su bzung ba mi 'gal ba yin par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gcig yongs su bzung ba mi 'gal ba yin par 'gyur na'o //
translated: When the inclusion of one is not contradictory.

original: 'gal na ni don mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gal na ni don mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is contradictory, then the meaning is untenable.

original: mi 'gal na don 'thad pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'gal na don 'thad pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: If it is not contradictory, then the tenability of the meaning is explained.

original: dper na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúIf a Brahmin were to eat meat, he could eat any meat whatsoever.‚Äù

original: gcig za yang gang yang rung ba za'o zhes brjod pa la ni gang yang rung ba smos par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig za yang gang yang rung ba za'o zhes brjod pa la ni gang yang rung ba smos par nus pa yin no //
translated: But when one says, ‚ÄúEat whatever you like,‚Äù it is possible to say ‚Äúwhatever you like.‚Äù

original: gal te skabs su bab pa gnyis las gcig la mi srid na gnyi ga'i yul can gang yang rung ba'i sgra mi 'thad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skabs su bab pa gnyis las gcig la mi srid na gnyi ga'i yul can gang yang rung ba'i sgra mi 'thad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one of the two alternatives is impossible, is it not the case that the word ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù is not tenable?

original: bshad pa / gang yang rung ba'i sgra 'di'i yul ni rnam par brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang yang rung ba'i sgra 'di'i yul ni rnam par brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: The object of the word ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù is a conceptual distinction.

original: gang yang rung ba la zan sbyin par sgrub pas ni rnam bar brtag pa'i don go bar 'gyur gyi nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la zan sbyin par sgrub pas ni rnam bar brtag pa'i don go bar 'gyur gyi nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When one proves that food is to be given to ‚Äúwhatever person,‚Äù the meaning of ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù is understood to be a conceptual distinction, but not a definite one.

original: des na gcig mi srid kyang sgrub pa de'i yul ni gnyis pa yin par 'dzin to //
analyzed: des na gcig mi srid kyang sgrub pa de'i yul ni gnyis pa yin par 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, even though one of the two is impossible, the object of the proof is taken to be the second.

original: gang yang rung ba sgra nye bar bkod pa na gang la de mi srid pa de nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i don ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba sgra nye bar bkod pa na gang la de mi srid pa de nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i don ni ma yin gyi /
translated: When the word ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù is used, it is not the case that the object of the proof is that to which it is impossible.

original: @21b 'on kyang de nyid gcig la bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: @21b 'on kyang de nyid gcig la bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: Rather, it is the proof of that very thing.

original: nges na gang la srid pa de nyid gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: nges na gang la srid pa de nyid gzung ba yin no //
translated: If it is certain, then only that which is possible is apprehended.üîΩIn the same way, in the case of the object, only that which is possible is to be apprehended.

original: de bzhin du don la yang gang srid pa de kho na gzung bar bya ba yin no zhas sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba de la bum pa kho na'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du don la yang gang srid pa de kho na gzung bar bya ba yin no zhas sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa / gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba de la bum pa kho na'am /
translated: In order to show this, he says:üîΩIn that application which is accompanied by the second, it is not maintained that only the pot,

original: lus kho nas zhes nges par ni mi 'dod de //
analyzed: lus kho nas zhes nges par ni mi 'dod de //
translated: or only the body, is certain.

original: des na gang yang rung ba'i sgra sbyar ba ni gang srid pa de khon gzung bar bya'o zhes bya bar gyur na /
analyzed: des na gang yang rung ba'i sgra sbyar ba ni gang srid pa de khon gzung bar bya'o zhes bya bar gyur na /
translated: Therefore, when the word ‚Äúany‚Äù is applied, it comes to mean that only that which is possible is to be apprehended.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyi gcig kyang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyi gcig kyang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: But, as explained earlier, even one is not possible.

original: des na gang yang rung ba'i sgra la nus pa med pas de la ltos pa gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi spyi yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gang yang rung ba'i sgra la nus pa med pas de la ltos pa gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi spyi yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the word ‚Äúany‚Äù is powerless, the generality which depends on it, being accompanied by the second, is also not to be established.

original: gang yang rung ba smos pa yang gang gi tshe sgrub pa'i yul srid par bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba smos pa yang gang gi tshe sgrub pa'i yul srid par bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mention of ‚Äúany‚Äù is for the purpose of showing the possibility of the object of the proof.

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gang yang rung ba la zan sbyin par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba zan sbyin pa sgrub pa'i yul gang yang rung ba srid do zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gang yang rung ba la zan sbyin par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba zan sbyin pa sgrub pa'i yul gang yang rung ba srid do zhes bya ba'i don yin pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: It is possible that either Devadatta or Yaj√±adatta will eat the food.

original: gcig zan za bar srid kyang gang yang rung ba'i sgra nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig zan za bar srid kyang gang yang rung ba'i sgra nus pa yin no //
translated: When the meaning is that it is possible that either one will be the object of the establishment of eating food, then the word ‚Äúeither‚Äù is capable of establishing the object of eating food.

original: gnyi ga la za ba grub par srid pa la ni /üîΩnges pa med par za ba sgrub pa na /
analyzed: gnyi ga la za ba grub par srid pa la ni / nges pa med par za ba sgrub pa na /
translated: When it is possible that both will be established as eaters,üîΩthen the word ‚Äúeither‚Äù is capable of establishing the object of eating food,

original: gang yang rung ba'i sgra gzan za bar bsgrub pa'i yul ma nges par bstan pa la 'jug pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i sgra gzan za bar bsgrub pa'i yul ma nges par bstan pa la 'jug pa yin pas /
translated: because it is applied to the demonstration of the indeterminacy of the object of the establishment of eating food.

original: de'i tshe ni gnyi ga la zan za ba'i sgrub pa srid pa na nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gnyi ga la zan za ba'i sgrub pa srid pa na nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is possible that both will be established as eaters, then the word ‚Äúeither‚Äù is capable of establishing the object of eating food.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyor ba la don dang skabs la sogs pa las shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyor ba la don dang skabs la sogs pa las shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: This analysis should be understood from the context of worldly usage, such as the meaning of the word ‚Äúeither.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la /
translated: Here, in the case of the usage of ‚Äúaccompanied by,‚Äù

original: rtsig pa ni bum pas gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: rtsig pa ni bum pas gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: a wall is accompanied by a pot.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bum pa ni lus kyi yin par rgol ba 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bum pa ni lus kyi yin par rgol ba 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The property to be established, the pot, is the body‚Äôs.

original: des na gnyi ga yang don gzhan du gyur par khas blang ngo //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga yang don gzhan du gyur par khas blang ngo //
translated: Thus, both are accepted as being different objects.

original: don gzhan nyid de ni nges pa med par gang yang rung ba zhig yin par rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid de ni nges pa med par gang yang rung ba zhig yin par rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: That they are different objects is understood to be uncertain, that is, either one or the other.

original: dpe'i chos can la ni bum pa yin la /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can la ni bum pa yin la /
translated: In the example, the subject is the pot;

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can la ni lus yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can la ni lus yin no //
translated: in the property to be established, the subject is the body.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga srid pa las nges pa med par gnyis pa nyid bsgrub pa la ni skyon sngar brjod zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga srid pa las nges pa med par gnyis pa nyid bsgrub pa la ni skyon sngar brjod zin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since both are possible, the uncertainty of the proof of the second is the fault already mentioned.

original: de lta ni mi 'dod kyang gang yang rung ba'i sgra bsgrub pa'i yul srid par ston pa'i don yin par @22a * //
analyzed: de lta ni mi 'dod kyang gang yang rung ba'i sgra bsgrub pa'i yul srid par ston pa'i don yin par @22a * //
translated: Even though this is not accepted, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is used to show that it is possible that the object of the proof is

original: khas blangs nas bum pa'am lus kyang rung ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas bum pa'am lus kyang rung ste /
translated: either a pot or a body.

original: gnyis pa ni mi srid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mi srid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the second is impossible.

original: de lta na yang khyad par du 'phags pa ni 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par du 'phags pa ni 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: Even so, the following is said to be the superior explanation.

original: khyod kyis ni gnyi ga don gzhan du 'dod bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni gnyi ga don gzhan du 'dod bar bya ba yin na /
translated: You maintain that both are different objects.

original: gnyi ga mi srid pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga mi srid pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it impossible for both to exist,

original: gcig kyang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig kyang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: but it is also impossible for either to exist.

original: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba smos pa ni srid pa ston pa la grags pa'i don yin par 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba smos pa ni srid pa ston pa la grags pa'i don yin par 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is seen to have the meaning of ‚Äúif it is the case that‚Äù in some places, it is used to show possibility.

original: gnyis pa nyid sgrub ba mi 'thad pa'i yang phyir spyi la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa nyid sgrub ba mi 'thad pa'i yang phyir spyi la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: And because it is not tenable to establish duality, the universal does not exist.

original: don gnyis dngos po gcig la 'brel ba nyid du sgrub pa de ni /
analyzed: don gnyis dngos po gcig la 'brel ba nyid du sgrub pa de ni /
translated: The establishment of the relation of the two objects to a single entity

original: 'di yin nam yang na de yin zhes rnam par brtag pa dang / 'di yang yin la 'di yang yin no zhes bsdu bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di yin nam yang na de yin zhes rnam par brtag pa dang / 'di yang yin la 'di yang yin no zhes bsdu bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: is either an investigation of whether it is this or that, or it is a combination of this and that.

original: 'di gnyi ga mi 'thad pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga mi 'thad pa yin na ni /
translated: If neither of these two is tenable,

original: mi shes pa shes par byed pa'i sgrub par ma 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa shes par byed pa'i sgrub par ma 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the establishment of the relation of the two objects to a single entity is not tenable.

original: lus sam yang na bum pa gnyis pa nyid ni ma yin la /
analyzed: lus sam yang na bum pa gnyis pa nyid ni ma yin la /
translated: The body is not a second vase.

original: lus dang bum pa gnyis pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus dang bum pa gnyis pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the same as the pot,

original: lus rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bum pa bum pa las don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bum pa bum pa las don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for the body to be without a universal and for the pot to be a different object from the pot.

original: sgrub pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa yin te /
translated: There is another way of proving that a universal does not exist.

original: de'i phyir tshig gi tshul te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi tshul te /
translated: Therefore, the method of argument is as follows:

original: ngag ni brjod par bya bas srog tu gyur pa brjod par bya bas stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ngag ni brjod par bya bas srog tu gyur pa brjod par bya bas stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Speech is empty of the expressed, because it is speech.

original: de'i phyir spyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a universal is not to be established.

original: sgrub pa mi srid pa'i phyir spyi la brten pa bkag pa 'dis ni'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa mi srid pa'i phyir spyi la brten pa bkag pa 'dis ni'o //
translated: By this refutation of the basis of a universal, because establishment is impossible,

original: sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin la /
translated: the subject, sound, is not a homogeneous case,

original: phyogs sam yang na mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs sam yang na mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it a heterogeneous case.

original: des na sgra gcig po ni bsdu ba dang rnam par brtag pa'i sgo nas phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs su bsgrub pa ma yin pas sgra la de dag gang yang rung ba nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra gcig po ni bsdu ba dang rnam par brtag pa'i sgo nas phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs su bsgrub pa ma yin pas sgra la de dag gang yang rung ba nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the single word is not established as the similar position by way of inclusion or by way of analysis, either one of those is eliminated in the word.

original: gnyi gang yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs su'o //
analyzed: gnyi gang yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs su'o //
translated: Either one of the two is the similar position.üîΩIf existence is not contradictory,

original: srid pa mi 'gal na zhes bya ba ni chos can gcig la'o //
analyzed: srid pa mi 'gal na zhes bya ba ni chos can gcig la'o //
translated: in one basis.üîΩIn that way,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gnyis las gang yang rung ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gnyis las gang yang rung ba nyid du'o //
translated: either one of the two is established.

original: de ltar 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni grub par 'gyur gyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni grub par 'gyur gyi'o //
translated: That is the way it is.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: srid pa @22b 'gal na ni gang yang rung ba nyid de sgra la ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: srid pa @22b 'gal na ni gang yang rung ba nyid de sgra la ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: if existence were contradictory, either one of the two would not be established in the word.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni phyogs khon yin gyi gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni phyogs khon yin gyi gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is just the position, not either one of the two.

original: phyogs yin na ji ltar gang yang rung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs yin na ji ltar gang yang rung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the position, how is it not either one of the two?

original: rnam par brtag par dang gcig tu so sor nges pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rnam par brtag par dang gcig tu so sor nges pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to be both ascertained and imagined.

original: gang gi phyir nges pa ni gnyis pa med ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par brtag pa ni gnyis pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gcig la yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar 'gal ba'i phyir rnam par brtag pa dang nges pa ni 'gal ba yin no //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar sgrub pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba nyid bsal bas sgra la ma grub par zhar la bstan nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa ni gnyis pa med ba yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par brtag pa ni gnyis pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gcig la yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar 'gal ba'i phyir rnam par brtag pa dang nges pa ni 'gal ba yin no // de'i phyir de ltar sgrub pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba nyid bsal bas sgra la ma grub par zhar la bstan nas /
translated: Because ascertainment is the absence of a second, and because imagination is the presence of a second, and because it is contradictory for something to both exist and not exist in one thing, imagination and ascertainment are contradictory.

original: dkyus ma'i gnyis pa dang bcas pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩdon rnams la spyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin du sgras shes par byas kyang /
analyzed: dkyus ma'i gnyis pa dang bcas pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa / don rnams la spyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin du sgras shes par byas kyang /
translated: Thus, because it is impossible to establish it in that way, and because of contradiction, either the similar or the dissimilar positions are refuted. Having taught this as a digression, in order to refute the second of the main points, he says:üîΩAlthough a word makes known a general object without distinction,

original: shugs kyi khyad par sgra'i don du gnas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir yang /
analyzed: shugs kyi khyad par sgra'i don du gnas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir yang /
translated: because of the power of the word, the distinction is the meaning of the word.

original: lus nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi bum pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi bum pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The body itself is realized, not the pot.

original: bum pa ni bum pa nyid las don gzhan gyi ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa ni bum pa nyid las don gzhan gyi ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the pot is a different entity from the pot itself.

original: lus nyid don gzhan du gyur par bsgrub par bya ba yin par dam bcas pa'i tshig las nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lus nyid don gzhan du gyur par bsgrub par bya ba yin par dam bcas pa'i tshig las nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is definitely the case that the body itself is the probandum that is to be established as a different object, because of the words of the thesis.

original: bum pa ni ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni shugs yin no //
analyzed: bum pa ni ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni shugs yin no //
translated: But the pot is not, because of the force.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: spyi la brten pa na mi 'thad pa dang / 'dod pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: spyi la brten pa na mi 'thad pa dang / 'dod pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it untenable and unacceptable to rely on universals,

original: 'on kyang sgra'i don nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra'i don nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: but also the meaning of the word itself is not.

original: 'di ltar shugs la sogs pa dag ni sgra'i nus pa sad pa'i rgyur 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar shugs la sogs pa dag ni sgra'i nus pa sad pa'i rgyur 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: In this way, it is asserted that force and so on are the causes that awaken the power of the word,

original: sgra'i don rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not what posit the meaning of the word.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyi'i sgra rnams kyi khyad par rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyi'i sgra rnams kyi khyad par rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi zhes so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said that universals are not the cause that posits the particulars.

original: khyad par rnam par gnas pa nyid dpe'i sgo nas bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par rnam par gnas pa nyid dpe'i sgo nas bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: In particular, the meaning of ‚Äúabiding‚Äù is explained by way of example:

original: 'ga' zhig gi sgra 'di ni spyi'i ming yin pas spyir brjod par gyur pa na /üîΩshing la sogs pa yang brjod par dogs par 'gyur ba yin na gzhi mthun ba 'ongs pa'i sgra sbyar ba'i phyir 'ong @23a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi sgra 'di ni spyi'i ming yin pas spyir brjod par gyur pa na / shing la sogs pa yang brjod par dogs par 'gyur ba yin na gzhi mthun ba 'ongs pa'i sgra sbyar ba'i phyir 'ong @23a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúsome‚Äù is a general term, and when a general term is used,üîΩthere is the possibility that trees and so on will be referred to.

original: ba'i bya ba'i nus ba dang ldan pa la 'jug par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: ba'i bya ba'i nus ba dang ldan pa la 'jug par rtogs kyi /
translated: However, since the word ‚Äúcome‚Äù is used in the phrase ‚Äúcome to a common locus,‚Äù it is understood to refer to that which is capable of the action of coming.

original: 'ong ba med pa'i ri 'am shing la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa'i ri 'am shing la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not refer to a mountain or tree that does not come.

original: 'di snyam du gal te khyad par gyi sgras zin na spyi'i sgra'i don bye brag la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te khyad par gyi sgras zin na spyi'i sgra'i don bye brag la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: If you think that when a specific term is used, the meaning of a general term is applied to the specific,

original: dper na dza med aag ne'i bur ma zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: dper na dza med aag ne'i bur ma zhes bya ba lta bu yin te /
translated: it is like the term ‚Äúson of Agnƒ´dhra without a j.‚Äù

original: ra ma'i sgra spyi'i don tsam dza mad aag ne'i bu'i sgra'i dang sbrel bas na khyad par la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: ra ma'i sgra spyi'i don tsam dza mad aag ne'i bu'i sgra'i dang sbrel bas na khyad par la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no snyam pa la /
translated: The term ‚Äúson‚Äù refers to the mere meaning of a general term, and since it is connected to the term ‚Äúson of Agnƒ´dhra,‚Äù it comes to refer to a specific person.

original: khyad par gyi sgra nye bar byas ba zhes smos so //üîΩgang gi phyir dza mad aag ne'i bu dang 'dra ba'i khyad par gyi sgra nye bar byas ba nyid gcig pu ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra nye bar byas ba zhes smos so // gang gi phyir dza mad aag ne'i bu dang 'dra ba'i khyad par gyi sgra nye bar byas ba nyid gcig pu ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is added to emphasize the point.üîΩFor the word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is added to emphasize the point that the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù does not refer to the distinction between the general and specific terms.

original: spyi rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams kyi khyad par rnam par 'jog pa rjod par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams kyi khyad par rnam par 'jog pa rjod par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not the reason why the general terms are said to be the basis for the distinction between the general and specific terms.

original: 'o na rgyu gzhan gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gzhan gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'on kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúhowever‚Äù is used to introduce the reason.

original: skabs ni sgra med pa'i rtsom pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: skabs ni sgra med pa'i rtsom pa tsam nyid de /
translated: The context is the mere composition of the words without meaning.

original: dper na ri dags shor ba'i skabs dang / zas za ba'i skabs na /
analyzed: dper na ri dags shor ba'i skabs dang / zas za ba'i skabs na /
translated: For example, in the context of hunting deer and eating food,

original: sen dha ba'i sgra tsha'i khyad bar dang / rta'i khyad par la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sen dha ba'i sgra tsha'i khyad bar dang / rta'i khyad par la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: the word ‚Äúsandha‚Äù is the reason for the distinction of the letter ‚Äút‚Äù and the distinction of the word ‚Äúhorse‚Äù.

original: shugs ni sgra'i don la brten pa ste /
analyzed: shugs ni sgra'i don la brten pa ste /
translated: The force is based on the meaning of the word.

original: dper na 'ongs pa'i sgra'i shugs kyis 'ga' zhig gi sgra khyad par la 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ongs pa'i sgra'i shugs kyis 'ga' zhig gi sgra khyad par la 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the force of the word ‚Äúcomes‚Äù is the reason for the distinction of the word ‚Äúsome‚Äù.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni be'u dang bcas pa'i drus ma zhes ldan pa dang / be'u med pa'i dus ma zhes bral ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni be'u dang bcas pa'i drus ma zhes ldan pa dang / be'u med pa'i dus ma zhes bral ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the cow with the calf as the possessor and the cow without the calf as the non-possessor.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: These are the examples of the basis of distinction.

original: de'i phyir shugs kyis kyang sgra khyad par la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shugs kyis kyang sgra khyad par la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is also used figuratively to refer to the basis of distinction.

original: de'i phyir 'dir khyad par lus su gyur pa'i gnyis pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir khyad par lus su gyur pa'i gnyis pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in this case, the second property is to be established as the basis of distinction, not as a universal.

original: de ltar gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba bkag nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the application of the second property as the basis of distinction,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to summarize his point, he says:

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i spyi khyad par la brten pas don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i spyi khyad par la brten pas don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the universal of any object is not a different object from the basis of distinction,

original: lus sam bum pa gnyis don gzhan du gyur pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus sam bum pa gnyis don gzhan du gyur pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that the body and the pot are different objects.

original: dpe ni bum pa don gzhan yin la /
analyzed: dpe ni bum pa don gzhan yin la /
translated: The example is the pot, which is a different object.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can la ni lus yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can la ni lus yin te /
translated: The subject of the probandum is the body.

original: des na don gzhan ni khyad par kho na yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don gzhan ni khyad par kho na yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the different object is only the basis of distinction, not the universal.

original: khyad par can de ni chos can gnyi ga khyab ba'i don gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni don gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can de ni chos can gnyi ga khyab ba'i don gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni don gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is said is ‚Äúsome that become different objects.‚Äù

original: gcig kyang zhes bya ba bum pa de ni bum pa las @23b don gzhan gyi ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir dang / lus kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir don gzhan gyi ngo bor khas ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig kyang zhes bya ba bum pa de ni bum pa las @23b don gzhan gyi ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir dang / lus kyang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir don gzhan gyi ngo bor khas ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: Also, since it is contradictory for that vase to be an entity that is different from the vase, and since the body is not a subsequent entity, it is not accepted that it is an entity that is a different object.

original: da ni mngon par 'dod ba'i sbyor ba dang / gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba mtshungs par bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: da ni mngon par 'dod ba'i sbyor ba dang / gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba mtshungs par bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Now, in order to prove that the desired syllogism and the syllogism that possesses a second are similar, it is said:

original: sgra dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis rtog pa na gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: sgra dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis rtog pa na gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba la brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: When one conceives of the difference between sound and a vase, all that is expressed in the syllogism that possesses a second is similar to impermanence.

original: 'di ltar gang yang rung ba zhig gi gnyis pa dang bcas par bsgrub na sgrub par byed pa don med pa'i phyir lus don gzhan du gyur pa bsgrub bya yin gyi bum pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang yang rung ba zhig gi gnyis pa dang bcas par bsgrub na sgrub par byed pa don med pa'i phyir lus don gzhan du gyur pa bsgrub bya yin gyi bum pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if one is proving that something has a second, the probandum is the body that is different from the object of proof, not the pot.

original: de'i phyir lus dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis gnyis pa nyid kyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin par de bsal ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis gnyis pa nyid kyi spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin par de bsal ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the universal of having a second is to be proven by the difference between the body and the pot.

original: lus su gyur pa'i gnyis pa nyid de yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: lus su gyur pa'i gnyis pa nyid de yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: And that second that is the body is not concomitant.

original: de bzhin du bum pas gnyis pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pas gnyis pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the pot is not to be proven as a second because of contradiction.

original: lus kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The body is not.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not concomitant.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: In the same way, if the universal is to be proven here, then sound is not to be proven as impermanent because the proof would be fruitless.

original: de la ni rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de la ni rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: And there is no concomitance there.

original: de bzhin du sgra la brten pa yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la brten pa yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, sound is not the object to be established,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no concomitance.

original: bum pa la brten pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la brten pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the pot the object to be established,

original: sgra la 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes thams cad mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sgra la 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes thams cad mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: because there is a contradiction with sound.

original: lan gdab pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: lan gdab pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: In order to respond to this, he says, ‚Äúnot the object to be established.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grub pa ste shes pas na'o //
analyzed: grub pa ste shes pas na'o //
translated: Because it is established by cognition.

original: de zhes bya ba mi rtag pa dang ldan par grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba mi rtag pa dang ldan par grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is established as possessing impermanence.

original: rtog ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtog ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is imagined.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: re zhig dngos po mi gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni grub pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po mi gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni grub pa yin no //
translated: First, impermanence, which is the non-enduring of things, is established.

original: bum pa dang sgra'i khyad par ni sgras zin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa dang sgra'i khyad par ni sgras zin pa ma yin la /
translated: The distinction between pot and sound is not directly stated,

original: rgol ba 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgol ba 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not asserted by the opponent.

original: de'i phyir spyi mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, impermanence in general is what is to be established.

original: de la ni sgra dang bum pa'i khyad par gyi rtog pa dang skyon 'god pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de la ni sgra dang bum pa'i khyad par gyi rtog pa dang skyon 'god pa mi 'thad do //
translated: So it is not tenable to imagine a distinction between sound and pot in that, and to set forth a fault.

original: lus dang bum pas khyad par du gyur pa'i gnyis dang bcas pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin par ni sgras zin pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang bum pas khyad par du gyur pa'i gnyis dang bcas pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin par ni sgras zin pa yin te /
translated: The subject is the pot qualified by the body, and the predicate is the property of having two parts.

original: des na @24a * //üîΩlus dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis rtog pa dang skyon nye bar 'god pa yin no //
analyzed: des na @24a * // lus dang bum pa'i khyad par gyis rtog pa dang skyon nye bar 'god pa yin no //
translated: Therefore,üîΩthe fault of the reason being unestablished is not committed.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid khyad par med pa nye bar 'god pa yin na ni khyad par la brten pa'i skyon gyis brtsad par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid khyad par med pa nye bar 'god pa yin na ni khyad par la brten pa'i skyon gyis brtsad par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the property of having two parts were stated without qualification, like impermanence, then the fault of the reason being unestablished would be committed.

original: de lta na yang gnyis pa nyid ni lus dang bum pa dag la thun mong du nye bar bkod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na yang gnyis pa nyid ni lus dang bum pa dag la thun mong du nye bar bkod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But even so, the property of having two parts is not stated in common with respect to the body and the pot.

original: gal te khyod du bum pa nyid du nges pa dang / lus nyid du rtog pa yin na ni kho bos kyang mi rtag pa nyid khyad par la nges par rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod du bum pa nyid du nges pa dang / lus nyid du rtog pa yin na ni kho bos kyang mi rtag pa nyid khyad par la nges par rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that the pot is ascertained as a pot and the body is ascertained as a body, then we also ascertain impermanence with respect to the qualified property.

original: de yang mi mtshungs te /
analyzed: de yang mi mtshungs te /
translated: That is not similar.

original: de la gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid lus dang bum pa'i thun mong bar ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnyis pa dang bcas pa nyid lus dang bum pa'i thun mong bar ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How could the state of having two parts be common to the body and the pot?

original: gal te lus sam bum pa srid pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te lus sam bum pa srid pa yin na'o //
translated: If the body and the pot exist.

original: gang gi tshe lus dang bum pa srid pa ma yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar thun mong du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus dang bum pa srid pa ma yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar thun mong du 'gyur /
translated: But when the body and the pot do not exist, how could they be common?

original: des na gnyis pa nyid kyi khyad par mi srid pas na spyi nyid ma grub par bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyis pa nyid kyi khyad par mi srid pas na spyi nyid ma grub par bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the distinction of having two parts is impossible, the universal itself is not established.

original: 'dir ni de ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par mi srid pas mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi ma grub par bstan par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par mi srid pas mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi ma grub par bstan par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, one cannot demonstrate that the universal of impermanence is not established because the distinction of impermanence is impossible.

original: gang byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes khyab pa sgrub pa mi rtag pa nyid bsal ba thams cad kyi mtha' thug par ston par byed pas /
analyzed: gang byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes khyab pa sgrub pa mi rtag pa nyid bsal ba thams cad kyi mtha' thug par ston par byed pas /
translated: Because the universal of impermanence, which proves the pervasion that whatever is produced is impermanent, is taught to be the limit of the refutation of all that is impermanent.

original: khyad par mi srid pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par mi srid pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The possibility of a distinction is refuted.

original: gal te khyad par yongs su gzung na ni de mi srid par bstan pas /
analyzed: gal te khyad par yongs su gzung na ni de mi srid par bstan pas /
translated: If a distinction is accepted, then since the impossibility of that is demonstrated,

original: spyi nyid ma grub par bstan par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: spyi nyid ma grub par bstan par nus pa yin la /
translated: It is possible to show that the universal itself is not established.

original: sgra med par yang khyad par gzung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sgra med par yang khyad par gzung bar 'gyur na /
translated: And if the qualifier were apprehended without the word,

original: de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: it would be just as it is not.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par ni sgras zin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par ni sgras zin pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the qualifier impermanence is not expressed by the word,

original: rgol bas 'dod pa yang ma yin zhing de yongs su gzung bas mi rtag pa nyid khyad par med par ma grub par byed nus pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par med pa mi rtag pa nyid grub pa yin la /
analyzed: rgol bas 'dod pa yang ma yin zhing de yongs su gzung bas mi rtag pa nyid khyad par med par ma grub par byed nus pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par med pa mi rtag pa nyid grub pa yin la /
translated: and it is not what the proponent wishes to express, and it is not possible to establish the nondifference of impermanence without the qualifier being apprehended, so the nondifference of impermanence is established.

original: de grub pas sgra de dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: de grub pas sgra de dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba yin no ;
translated: And since that is established, the probandum is established as possessing that sound.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yang med do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yang med do //
translated: Nor is there the fault of the absence of pervasion.

original: dam bcas pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no application of the thesis.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that what is already established is being established,

original: ma 'brel pa rnam par bcas par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa rnam par bcas par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the unassociated is not established as being established.

original: gal te ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid khyad par med par grub pa de bzhin du gnyis pa @24b nyid tsam grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid khyad par med par grub pa de bzhin du gnyis pa @24b nyid tsam grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúJust as impermanence is established without distinction, so too is duality itself established,‚Äù

original: de bzhin du zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes smos te /
translated: then the response is, ‚ÄúSo too, . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid grub ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid grub ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as impermanence is not established,

original: gal te lus dang bum pa dag las 'ga' zhig don gzhan du gyur par khas len pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te lus dang bum pa dag las 'ga' zhig don gzhan du gyur par khas len pa yin na ni /
translated: if you accept that something is different from both the body and the pot,

original: spyi dang ldan pa'i don gzhan nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur ba yin na gnyi ga la yang don gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir spyi bsgrub bya ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa'i don gzhan nyid bsgrub byar 'gyur ba yin na gnyi ga la yang don gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir spyi bsgrub bya ma yin no //
translated: then the difference in meaning that is associated with the universal would be the object to be established. But since neither has a difference in meaning, the universal is not the object to be established.

original: gnyis pa nyid ni khyad par ma bzung ba gnyi ga'i thun mong yin na /
analyzed: gnyis pa nyid ni khyad par ma bzung ba gnyi ga'i thun mong yin na /
translated: If duality is a common attribute of both, without specifying a particular instance,

original: rten med par ni gnyis ba nyid tsam du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rten med par ni gnyis ba nyid tsam du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: then duality itself would be without a basis.

original: de ni gcig la yang ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni gcig la yang ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is not established even in one.

original: 'dod pa bsgrub bya nyid du brjod pa 'dis ni chos dang chos can dag gi khyad par du byas pa'i chos dang chos can dag ste /üîΩchos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'gog par snang ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub bya nyid du brjod pa 'dis ni chos dang chos can dag gi khyad par du byas pa'i chos dang chos can dag ste / chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'gog par snang ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: This statement that desire is the object to be accomplished shows that the subject qualified by the predicate is refuted by the reason of being produced.

original: chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can 'gog pa dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can 'gog pa dper brjod pa ni /
translated: This is an example of the refutation of the subject qualified by the predicate.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is not qualified by impermanence.‚Äù

original: sgra gang la mi rtag pa'i sgra yod pa de ni mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sgra gang la mi rtag pa'i sgra yod pa de ni mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ste /
translated: That sound which has impermanent sound is qualified by impermanent sound.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has another impermanent sound.

original: de 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The probandum is that it is not like that.

original: chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos 'gog pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: chos can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos 'gog pa ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the refutation of the subject qualified by the predicate is

original: sgra'i mi rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i mi rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSound is not qualified by impermanence.‚Äù

original: sgra gzhan gyi mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sgra gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra gzhan gyi mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sgra gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The statement Whatever is impermanent in another sound is not another sound is also the thesis.

original: gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason is because it is produced,

original: bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: like a pot.

original: 'di ji ltar go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does this prove the thesis?

original: brjod pa / thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa / thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: Because everything is established in its own nature.

original: byas pa'am yod pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gzhan gyis de dang ldan pa ma yin pa med pa'i phyir byas pa nyid dam yod pa nyid kyis sgra gzhan mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa dang / sgra gzhan gyi mi rtag pa dang ldan pa 'gog par nus kyang /
analyzed: byas pa'am yod pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gzhan gyis de dang ldan pa ma yin pa med pa'i phyir byas pa nyid dam yod pa nyid kyis sgra gzhan mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa dang / sgra gzhan gyi mi rtag pa dang ldan pa 'gog par nus kyang /
translated: Whatever is produced or exists is not without the possession of its own nature, so sound is established as impermanent by its production or existence, and the possession of impermanence by another sound is refuted.

original: sgra gzhan dang ldan pa nyid dam /
analyzed: sgra gzhan dang ldan pa nyid dam /
translated: But the possession of another sound

original: de'i mi rtag pa dang ldan pa nyid ni bsgrub byar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i mi rtag pa dang ldan pa nyid ni bsgrub byar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: or the possession of its impermanence is not accepted as the thesis.

original: des na de 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhes smra bas byas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs spong ba gang @25a * //
analyzed: des na de 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhes smra bas byas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs spong ba gang @25a * //
translated: Therefore, the reason that refutes that is contradictory.

original: yin pa de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: yin pa de bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason that is stated is refuted.

original: bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu byas bas 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu byas bas 'gal ba yin na /
translated: If it is contradictory because the probandum is reversed,

original: 'di ni bsgrub bya ma yin pas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub bya ma yin pas bsal ba yin no //
translated: then it is refuted because it is not the probandum.

original: de bkag na mi rtag pa nyid gsha' ma yang bkag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de bkag na mi rtag pa nyid gsha' ma yang bkag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt impermanence also refuted when that is refuted?‚Äù

original: bkag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bkag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not refuted.

original: sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can la spyi 'ba' zhig bkag par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba'i chos can la spyi 'ba' zhig bkag par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Only the universal is refuted in regard to the subject called ‚Äúsound.‚Äù

original: chos tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere property is not.

original: chos tsam ma bkag na chos can la spyi de 'gog pa 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: chos tsam ma bkag na chos can la spyi de 'gog pa 'gal ba med de /
translated: If the mere property is not refuted, there is no contradiction in refuting that universal in regard to the subject.

original: de'i phyir de skad du smra ba des bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de skad du smra ba des bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is refuted by that statement.

original: spyi bkag na chos tsam bkag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: spyi bkag na chos tsam bkag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the universal is refuted, how is the mere property refuted?

original: sgra mi rtag pa yin gyis zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa yin gyis zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because the sound is qualified by impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag ba'i sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag ba'i sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not the case that the sound is qualified by impermanence, because the sound is not related to another impermanence.

original: des na chos can gzhan dang 'brel pa bkag kyang mi rtag pa'i khyad par can gyi sgra bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na chos can gzhan dang 'brel pa bkag kyang mi rtag pa'i khyad par can gyi sgra bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the relation to another subject is refuted, the sound qualified by impermanence is not refuted.

original: rgol ba sgra mi rtag par sgrub par 'dod pa yin yang sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan par ni bsgrub bar mi 'dod do zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rgol ba sgra mi rtag par sgrub par 'dod pa yin yang sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan par ni bsgrub bar mi 'dod do zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Even though the disputant wishes to prove that sound is impermanent, he does not wish to prove that sound is related to the sound of impermanence.

original: de ltar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ste /
translated: This is the situation.

original: mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang 'brel bar 'dod na ni sgra mi rtag par 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang 'brel bar 'dod na ni sgra mi rtag par 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to relate the sound of impermanence to another, one will not wish to relate sound to impermanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / sgra gzhir gyur pa la mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / sgra gzhir gyur pa la mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: It is explained: Because it is the cause of proving that the sound is related to another sound of impermanence.

original: sgra mi rtag pa tsam du mi sgrub bas sgra mi rtag par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa tsam du mi sgrub bas sgra mi rtag par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that sound is not established as impermanent, because it does not establish sound as merely impermanent.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it established?

original: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra dang ldan pa zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that sound is endowed with the sound of impermanent sound.

original: gal te gtan tshigs go bar byed nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs go bar byed nus pa yin na /
translated: If the reason is able to make one understand,

original: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang ldan par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang ldan par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is established that sound is endowed with the sound of impermanent sound.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i chos tsam gang yin pa de'i spyi bkag kyang mi ldog pa dang / gang bkag pas 'dod pa la gnod bar 'gyur ba mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang ldan pa de yang 'dod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i chos tsam gang yin pa de'i spyi bkag kyang mi ldog pa dang / gang bkag pas 'dod pa la gnod bar 'gyur ba mi rtag pa'i sgra gzhan dang ldan pa de yang 'dod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Because the mere general property of the object of desire is not refuted, and because the refutation of that which is desired is not harmed by the refutation of sound endowed with the sound of impermanent sound, therefore there is no harm at all to the desired object of the reason.

original: de bzhin du sgra mi rtag pa dang ldan pa zhes chos can gyi khyad par gyi 'gog pa la yang 'dod pa la gnod pa med par spyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra mi rtag pa dang ldan pa zhes chos can gyi khyad par gyi 'gog pa la yang 'dod pa la gnod pa med par spyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the refutation of the qualification of the subject, saying ‚Äúsound is endowed with impermanent sound,‚Äù should be applied without harming the desired object.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba gang gi phyir sgra'i @25b rang bzhin mi rtag bar bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid ni ma yin pa dang / sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid bkag kyang sgra'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ldog pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba gang gi phyir sgra'i @25b rang bzhin mi rtag bar bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid ni ma yin pa dang / sgra gzhan dang 'brel ba nyid bkag kyang sgra'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ldog pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the nature of sound is what is to be proven, and because the mere relation of sound to another is not, and because even though the mere relation of sound to another is refuted, impermanence which is the nature of sound is not refuted,

original: chos 'ba' zhig khon chos can la sgrub bar byed pas bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: chos 'ba' zhig khon chos can la sgrub bar byed pas bsgrub pa'am /
translated: then the mere property is what is proven in relation to the subject.

original: 'gal bas phyin ci log tu bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal bas phyin ci log tu bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proof is not a case of the opposite being done due to contradiction.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni spyi yin la /
translated: The object of the proof is a universal.

original: phyin ci log tu bya ba yang bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bya ba yang bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid ma yin nam /
translated: And is not the opposite that is done also that very object of the proof?

original: de ji ltar chos 'ba' zhig de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar chos 'ba' zhig de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could the mere property be that?

original: de ltar na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes smos te /
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù

original: rnam pa de'i sgo nas mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa bsgrub ba'i phyir 'dod ba spyi'i grub pa byas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa de'i sgo nas mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa bsgrub ba'i phyir 'dod ba spyi'i grub pa byas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because the mere property is not the object of the proof, the mere property is not the object of the opposite that is done.

original: skabs su bab pa'i chos ma 'brel ba rnam par bcad ba dgag pa'i phyir gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i chos ma 'brel ba rnam par bcad ba dgag pa'i phyir gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But if you do, you will be contradicting your own position.

original: chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu byed ba la sogs pa'i 'gal bas mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu byed ba la sogs pa'i 'gal bas mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: And because of the contradiction of seeing the specific property of the subject, etc.,

original: phyin ci log tu byed pa nyid ni 'gal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu byed pa nyid ni 'gal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not the case that the contradiction is in the reversal of the property.

original: 'gal ba ni thams cad du zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni thams cad du zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalways‚Äù is used because the contradiction is always in the reversal of the property.

original: gang gi phyir chos can gyi khyad par gyi 'gal ba la sogs ba thams cad du /üîΩ'dod pa ni spyi de phyin ci log tu byed pa kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos can gyi khyad par gyi 'gal ba la sogs ba thams cad du / 'dod pa ni spyi de phyin ci log tu byed pa kho na'i phyir te /
translated: Because the contradiction of the specific property of the subject, etc., is always in the reversal of the property,üîΩthe property is accepted as being always in the reversal of the property.

original: 'gog pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The contradiction is in the reversal of the property because it is the negation of the property.

original: de'i phyir na spyi phyin ci log tu byed pa kho na 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na spyi phyin ci log tu byed pa kho na 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction is in the reversal of the property.

original: 'o na ji ltar chos can gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i 'gal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos can gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i 'gal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can there be a contradiction in the specific property of the subject, etc.?

original: bshad pa / spyi phyin ci log pa de ni res 'ga' chos kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: bshad pa / spyi phyin ci log pa de ni res 'ga' chos kyi sgo nas te /
translated: It is said: That reversal of the property is sometimes by way of the property itself.

original: chos bzlog pa'i sgo nas byed pa de'i tshe chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos bzlog pa'i sgo nas byed pa de'i tshe chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba zhes brjod do //
translated: When it is done by way of the negation of the property, it is called ‚Äúcontradictory to the intrinsic nature of the property.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe yang de spyi bzlog pa ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de spyi bzlog pa ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: And at that time, the negation of the universal is certainly present.

original: gang gi tshe chos can bzlog pa'i sgo nas spyi zlog bar byed pa de'i tshe ni chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos can bzlog pa'i sgo nas spyi zlog bar byed pa de'i tshe ni chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: When the universal is negated by way of the negation of the subject, then it is contradictory to the intrinsic nature of the subject.

original: skabs su bab pa'i 'dod pa nyid phyin ci log tu byed ba na /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i 'dod pa nyid phyin ci log tu byed ba na /
translated: When the very desire that is appropriate is made into a fallacy,

original: sgra nye bar bkod pa'i rang gi chos can gyi khyad par dang 'gal ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra nye bar bkod pa'i rang gi chos can gyi khyad par dang 'gal ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: it is called ‚Äúcontradictory to the particular of the subject that is adduced.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos sam chos can bkag pas spyi bzlog par 'gyur ba des 'gal bar tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos sam chos can bkag pas spyi bzlog par 'gyur ba des 'gal bar tha snyad du byed do //
translated: In every way, the universal is negated by the negation of the property or of the subject, and so it is called ‚Äúcontradictory.‚Äù

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba ni dper na sgra rtag ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba ni dper na sgra rtag ste /
translated: Contradictory to the intrinsic nature of the property is, for example, ‚ÄúSound is permanent,

original: byas pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba @26a * //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba @26a * //
translated: because it is produced, like space.‚Äù

original: la ; byas pa nyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: la ; byas pa nyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúbeing produced‚Äù is an example.

original: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel ba ni dper na nam mkha' yod par smra ba'i nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin te ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel ba ni dper na nam mkha' yod par smra ba'i nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin te ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The connection with the intrinsic reality of the subject is, for example, like the following: ‚ÄúSpace, which is asserted to exist, is permanent because it is not created.‚Äù

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la mthong ba 'dis ni chos can nam mkha' yang med par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la mthong ba 'dis ni chos can nam mkha' yang med par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: This perception of non-existent things such as the horn of a rabbit establishes that the subject, space, is also non-existent.üîΩThese are the subjects of non-composite objects that are for the benefit of others.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don dag ni gzhan gyi don du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul can gzhan gyi don byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don dag ni gzhan gyi don du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of non-composite objects is for the benefit of others.

original: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: This is contradictory to the distinction of the subject and predicate.

original: gal te rgol bas 'dod pa'i chos gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgol bas 'dod pa'i chos gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the property that the opponent asserts is the probandum,

original: 'o na ji ltar rang nyid smos she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rang nyid smos she na /
translated: then why is it stated by oneself?

original: rang nyid kyi sgra ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgra ni zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is stated.

original: ni'i sgra ni yang gi sgra'i don la yin te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni yang gi sgra'i don la yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa smos pa yin yang rang nyid kyi sgra la bstan par bya ba'i khyad par yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa smos pa yin yang rang nyid kyi sgra la bstan par bya ba'i khyad par yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although the term ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is mentioned, the term ‚Äúitself‚Äù has a special meaning.

original: khyad par de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The special meaning is explained:

original: chos can gcig la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos can gcig la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äúwith regard to a single subject.‚Äù

original: chos du ma ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / byas pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i yon tan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos du ma ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / byas pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i yon tan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The many properties are impermanence, being produced, being a quality of space, and so on.

original: rang nyid kyi sgra'i don ni bdag nyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgra'i don ni bdag nyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúitself‚Äù is ‚Äúitself alone.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos byed pas 'dod pa'i chos gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni bsgrub bya ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas 'dod pa'i chos gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni bsgrub bya ma yin gyi /
translated: The treatise author does not assert that all properties are the object of affirmation;

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kho na'i'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kho na'i'o //
translated: rather, it is only itself.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i dus su ni bstan bcos khas blangs par bya ba ma yin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i dus su ni bstan bcos khas blangs par bya ba ma yin pa kho na yin la /
translated: Even if one accepts the treatise, in the context of debate, one should not accept the treatise.

original: khas blangs par gyur kyang bdag nyid 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir rang nyid kyi sgra byas pa yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs par gyur kyang bdag nyid 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir rang nyid kyi sgra byas pa yin no //
translated: Even though one has accepted, one should accomplish only what one desires, not something else. In order to make this point understood, the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra yod pa der rgol bar 'dod pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa'i 'dod pa thams cad bzlog tu zin kyang rang gis mdzad pa'i 'grel par rang nyid kyi sgras dogs pa'i gnas srid ba zlog par byed pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra yod pa der rgol bar 'dod pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa'i 'dod pa thams cad bzlog tu zin kyang rang gis mdzad pa'i 'grel par rang nyid kyi sgras dogs pa'i gnas srid ba zlog par byed pa yin par bshad do //
translated: In the commentary composed by himself, he explains that the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used to eliminate the possibility of doubt that all desires other than the one that is desired by the one who wishes to argue exist.

original: mdo mdzad pas kyang don 'di nyid dam bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdo mdzad pas kyang don 'di nyid dam bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The author of the s≈´tra also asserts this very point.

original: 'brel ba'i gzhung ston pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba ni ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i gzhung ston pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba ni ste /
translated: The text that teaches the connection is ‚Äúitself.‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyi sgras ni khas blangs pa ston @26b par byed pa'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgras ni khas blangs pa ston @26b par byed pa'o zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates the acceptance.

original: ci'i phyir dogs pa srid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dogs pa srid ce na /
translated: Why is there a possibility of doubt?

original: bshad pa / bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Because of accepting the treatise.

original: de la mthong ba ni bstan bcos la mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba ni bstan bcos la mthong ba ste /
translated: Here, seeing refers to seeing in the treatise.

original: bstan bcos byed pas chos gang 'dod pa de khas blangs pa yang yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas chos gang 'dod pa de khas blangs pa yang yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, whatever phenomena the author of the treatise wishes would be accepted.

original: des na ji ltar chos gcig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes dogs pa srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar chos gcig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes dogs pa srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as one phenomenon is to be established, so too are others.

original: des na gal te log par rtogs par 'gyur kyang dogs pa srid pas rang nyid smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te log par rtogs par 'gyur kyang dogs pa srid pas rang nyid smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if there is a possibility of misunderstanding, he mentions himself.

original: log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba nyid de des na de bzlog pa'i phyir yang rang nyid smos pa yin no //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba nyid de des na de bzlog pa'i phyir yang rang nyid smos pa yin no //
translated: Also, seeing is misunderstanding, and therefore he mentions himself in order to stop that.

original: kha cig na re bstan bcos las mthong na ni bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bstan bcos las mthong na ni bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say: If it is seen in the treatise, it is to be established.
