analyzed: mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa ni bsgrub bya ma yin no //
translated: That which is mixed with the undesirable is not the probandum.

original: 'dod pa 'ba' zhig pa nyid bsgrub bya yin gyi mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'ba' zhig pa nyid bsgrub bya yin gyi mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Only that which is desired is the probandum, not that which is mixed with the undesirable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la gnod na yang gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la gnod na yang gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: For that very reason, even if it is harmed, the fault of contradicting the reason does not arise,

original: phyogs la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no ;
analyzed: phyogs la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no ;
translated: and there is no fault of the treatise contradicting the position. This is the meaning expressed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba las ma 'das par ci ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin pa bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las ma 'das par ci ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin pa bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not beyond what is to be established, and because there is no contradiction in how it is to be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid bkag na skyon yin gyi gzhan dang 'dres pa bkag pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid bkag na skyon yin gyi gzhan dang 'dres pa bkag pas ni ma yin te /
translated: If what is to be established is refuted, there is a fault, but not if a mixture of other things is refuted,

original: 'dres pa bkag kyang skabs su bab pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'dres pa bkag kyang skabs su bab pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because even if a mixture is refuted, there is no contradiction in what is at hand.

original: mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i dper brjod pa ni /
translated: An example of a mixture of what is not wanted is

original: mi 'dod pa nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang lhan cig don gcig la 'du ba nyid gang yin pa de gang la yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang lhan cig don gcig la 'du ba nyid gang yin pa de gang la yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dus pa yin te /
translated: impermanence, which has the unwanted quality of being mixed with what is not wanted, namely, the quality of being a single entity with the quality of space.

original: de med pa yang sgrub par byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de med pa yang sgrub par byed pa bzhin te /
translated: That impermanence is a mixture of what is not wanted is like the proof of its nonexistence,

original: brten pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: brten pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: because there is no quality that has the nature of being supported, as has been explained many times.

original: gang zhig rang nyid kyi sgra'i zhar la rjes su dpag pa'i dus su med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la brten par bya ba ma yin par bshad pa 'di nyid kyis skabs su rtogs pa ma yin pa phyogs su ston par byed paüîΩbsal ba @39a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rang nyid kyi sgra'i zhar la rjes su dpag pa'i dus su med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la brten par bya ba ma yin par bshad pa 'di nyid kyis skabs su rtogs pa ma yin pa phyogs su ston par byed pa bsal ba @39a * //
translated: This very statement shows that it is not the case that it is not understood in the context.

original: yin no // skabs su rtogs pa ma yin pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: yin no // skabs su rtogs pa ma yin pa bshad pa ni /
translated: It is explained that it is not understood in the context.üîΩFor example, when one wishes to know whether sound is impermanent or permanent, sound is established by mere experience.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'am rtag pa yin zhes nyams su myong ba tsam gyis grub pa'i sgra la 'jig rten na grags pa'i bstan pa'am 'jig pa shes par 'dod pa yin la /üîΩshes par 'dod pa yang skabs yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa'am rtag pa yin zhes nyams su myong ba tsam gyis grub pa'i sgra la 'jig rten na grags pa'i bstan pa'am 'jig pa shes par 'dod pa yin la / shes par 'dod pa yang skabs yin no //
translated: And it is known in the world that sound is impermanent.üîΩWhen one wishes to know whether sound is impermanent, it is the context.

original: mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig po'i skabs der sgra las tha dad par nyan pa'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba sgra nyid ces bya ba'i spyi de dang ldan pa gcig la 'du ba de gang la yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de dang sgra ldan pa yin no
analyzed: mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig po'i skabs der sgra las tha dad par nyan pa'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba sgra nyid ces bya ba'i spyi de dang ldan pa gcig la 'du ba de gang la yod pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de dang sgra ldan pa yin no
translated: In that context, one who possesses the universal that is the sound itself, which is apprehended by the ear sense faculty separate from sound, is one who possesses impermanence.

original: zhes khyad par dang bcas pa'i spyi rtag pa nyid de dang 'dra ba'i skabs ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes khyad par dang bcas pa'i spyi rtag pa nyid de dang 'dra ba'i skabs ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, the universal of impermanence is not a permanent entity, and the occasion of the universal is not like that.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i mi rtag pa nyid bye brag pa'i 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i mi rtag pa nyid bye brag pa'i 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the impermanence of that kind accepted by the Vaise~ika?

original: de ci ltar skabs ma yin pa phyogs su byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar skabs ma yin pa phyogs su byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can that be taken as a subject that is not accepted by the opponent?

original: bstan bcos la brten pa'am zhes smos te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pa'am zhes smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúbecause it is based on the treatise.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las grags pa'i chos la sogs pa chos can du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las grags pa'i chos la sogs pa chos can du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the subject is taken to be the phenomena and so on that are renowned in the treatise,

original: gnyi ga yang bstan bcos la brten pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bstan bcos la brten pa yin pa'am /
translated: both the subject and the reason are based on the treatise.

original: phyir rgol ba bstan bcos las grags pa mi rtag pa nyid de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba yin na ni /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba bstan bcos las grags pa mi rtag pa nyid de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba yin na ni /
translated: If the opponent is someone who seeks to understand the impermanence that is renowned in the treatise,

original: bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i don de phyogs su byed par rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i don de phyogs su byed par rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is appropriate to take as the subject something that is renowned in the treatise.

original: phyir rgol ba de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba ni khyed kyi mi rtag pa nyid ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes 'dri ba las shes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba ni khyed kyi mi rtag pa nyid ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes 'dri ba las shes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The opponent who seeks to understand this should understand it from the question, ‚ÄúWhat is your impermanence like?‚ÄùüîΩOtherwise,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos la brten pa'am /üîΩde rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos la brten pa'am / de rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid ma yin na /
translated: if he does not rely on the treatise or seek to understand it,

original: bstan bcos kyi don yongs su 'dzin pa ma 'brel ba'i don brjod pa ni skabs su ma kho ba med pa'i phyir rna gtang par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don yongs su 'dzin pa ma 'brel ba'i don brjod pa ni skabs su ma kho ba med pa'i phyir rna gtang par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he would not be interested in the treatise, since it would be meaningless to state something irrelevant to the meaning of the treatise.

original: de'i phyir rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i chos can la mi brten pa'i phyir bstan bcos la mi brten par 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yongs su rtog pa na
analyzed: de'i phyir rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i chos can la mi brten pa'i phyir bstan bcos la mi brten par 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yongs su rtog pa na
translated: Therefore, since neither the opponent nor the proponent rely on a treatise, they should imagine some impermanence, etc., that is renowned in the world, not relying on a phenomenon renowned in a treatise.

original: skabs ma yin pa rab tu ma grags pa nyid phyogs su byed pa'i go skabs ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs ma yin pa rab tu ma grags pa nyid phyogs su byed pa'i go skabs ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is no opportunity for them to take as their subject something that is not renowned in the world.

original: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rgol ba don du gnyer ba'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid skabs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba don du gnyer ba'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid skabs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs desire is not what is relevant in the present context.

original: gzhan gyis rna blags par 'os pa ma yin pas bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sgrub par byed pa'i skabs sems @39b pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rna blags par 'os pa ma yin pas bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sgrub par byed pa'i skabs sems @39b pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the thesis, since it is not worthy of being stated to the other party, and because the proponent‚Äôs desire is relevant, since it is the thesis.

original: phyir rgol bas shes par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni skabs yin te /
analyzed: phyir rgol bas shes par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni skabs yin te /
translated: What the opponent wishes to understand is relevant,

original: rna gtad bar bya ba nyid kyis bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna gtad bar bya ba nyid kyis bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the thesis, since it is worthy of being stated to the other party.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga bstan bcos la brten pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga bstan bcos la brten pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if both parties rely on a treatise,

original: bstan bcos kyi don skabs su bab par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don skabs su bab par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: then the meaning of the treatise becomes relevant in the present context.

original: rgol ba 'ba' zhig brten bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba 'ba' zhig brten bas ni ma yin no //
translated: But if only the opponent relies on a treatise, then it is not relevant.

original: da ni pha rol po dag phyir rgol ba spyi rtogs pa don du gnyar na khyad par rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag phyir rgol ba spyi rtogs pa don du gnyar na khyad par rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that if the opponent seeks to understand the general meaning, then he must seek to understand the specific meaning,üîΩthe root text says:

original: gal te khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you say that the specific is the means of positing the general, then the specific would be established when the general is established.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir khyad par gyis spyi 'phen par byed pa de'i phyir khyad par de grub na 'dod pa'i spyi nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par gyis spyi 'phen par byed pa de'i phyir khyad par de grub na 'dod pa'i spyi nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If you say that the specific is the means of positing the general, then when the specific is established, the general that is desired would be established.

original: khyad par grub pas spyi grub na yang spyir mi rtag pa nyid tsam shes par 'dod pa ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i khyad par yang shes par 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs na bshad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par grub pas spyi grub na yang spyir mi rtag pa nyid tsam shes par 'dod pa ni mi 'dod pa dang 'dres pa'i khyad par yang shes par 'dod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs na bshad pa ma yin te /
translated: But if the general is established by the establishment of the specific, then one who desires to know mere impermanence in general would also desire to know the specific mixed with the non-desired.

original: rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa don du gnyer ba nyid ni skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dkyus ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa don du gnyer ba nyid ni skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dkyus ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not explained because the desire of the cognizer is the relevant point.

original: rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa ni ci sgra rtag gam 'on te mi rtag ces bya ba skabs kyi ngag las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa ni ci sgra rtag gam 'on te mi rtag ces bya ba skabs kyi ngag las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The desire of the cognizer is to be inferred from the words of the context, such as ‚ÄúIs sound permanent or impermanent?‚Äù

original: skabs yin par gzung gi khyad par gyis yul can gyi sgra ni med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs yin par gzung gi khyad par gyis yul can gyi sgra ni med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù does not exist in the context of the opponent‚Äôs thesis.

original: ci ltar rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa skabs ma yin pa'i khyad par gyis yul can du rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar brtag par bya ba yin /
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa skabs ma yin pa'i khyad par gyis yul can du rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar brtag par bya ba yin /
translated: In what way is the subject to be imagined in some way by the desire of the one who understands, in the context of the opponent‚Äôs thesis?

original: gang gi phyir skabs ma yin rgol ba 'dod pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa'i skabs kyis rgol ba'i bsgrub bya'i chos su 'dod pa de rtogs pa yin no zhes /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skabs ma yin rgol ba 'dod pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa'i skabs kyis rgol ba'i bsgrub bya'i chos su 'dod pa de rtogs pa yin no zhes /
translated: Because the opponent‚Äôs desire is not in the context of the one who understands, the one who understands does not understand the property to be proven that is desired by the opponent.üîΩWe say: Because of the desire of some context,

original: gnas skabs 'ga' yis 'dod 'gyur dang // de ni de yis rtogs bya'ang yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs kho bo cag gis brjod do //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'ga' yis 'dod 'gyur dang // de ni de yis rtogs bya'ang yin // zhes bya ba la sogs kho bo cag gis brjod do //
translated: that is to be understood by that.

original: gal te skabs ma yin pa yang rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa yin na ni rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir skabs 'ga' zhig gis rgol ba'i bsgrub bya chos su 'dod pa rtogs par mi 'thad do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te skabs ma yin pa yang rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa yin na ni rtogs pa po'i 'dod pa bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir skabs 'ga' zhig gis rgol ba'i bsgrub bya chos su 'dod pa rtogs par mi 'thad do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: If the context of the opponent‚Äôs desire is not understood, then because the desire of the one who understands is the property to be proven, it is not tenable that the property to be proven that is desired by the opponent is understood by the one who understands.

original: gal te yang skabs ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par 'dod par skabs su bab pa'i tshig mi rtogs pa de ltar na yang dngos po las nges pa yin no //üîΩspyi ni don byed pa na khyad par gyi @40a * //
analyzed: gal te yang skabs ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par 'dod par skabs su bab pa'i tshig mi rtogs pa de ltar na yang dngos po las nges pa yin no // spyi ni don byed pa na khyad par gyi @40a * //
translated: Even if it is not the right time to accept the distinction, and so one does not understand the words that are appropriate to the occasion, still one must accept the thing.

original: mthar thug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mthar thug pa bzhin no //
translated: When one acts for the sake of the universal, it is as if one were acting for the sake of the particular.

original: dper na shing nyid shing sha pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing nyid shing sha pa la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one acts for the sake of tree, one acts for the sake of the particular trees, such as shala and so on.

original: des na spyi don du gnyer na khyad par don du gnyer ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na spyi don du gnyer na khyad par don du gnyer ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, when one acts for the sake of the universal, one acts for the sake of the particular.

original: spyi don du gnyer ba ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: spyi don du gnyer ba ni zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhen one acts for the sake of the universal,‚Äù

original: spyi don du gnyer ba ni so sor nges pa nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par des don du gnyer bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi don du gnyer ba ni so sor nges pa nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par des don du gnyer bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: one does not necessarily act for the sake of the particular, which is the individual.

original: 'di ltar spyi don du gnyer ba nyid ni khyad par med pa don du gnyer ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi don du gnyer ba nyid ni khyad par med pa don du gnyer ba yin la /
translated: For, when one acts for the sake of the universal, one acts for the sake of the non-particular.

original: khyad par don du gnyer ba nyid ni de dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par don du gnyer ba nyid ni de dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: When one acts for the sake of the particular, one acts for the sake of the opposite of that.

original: shing tsam don du gnyer ba nyid ni shing sha pa don du gnyer ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: shing tsam don du gnyer ba nyid ni shing sha pa don du gnyer ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: But the desire for a tree is not the desire for a particular tree, a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: 'on kyang nges pa med pa kho na don du gnyer ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa med pa kho na don du gnyer ba yin no //
translated: Rather, it is the desire for the indefinite.

original: ma nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba byed pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir de ni nges pa'i yul don du gnyer bar 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba byed pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir de ni nges pa'i yul don du gnyer bar 'gal ba yin la /
translated: Because the desire is for the performance of the indefinite object to be accomplished, it is contradictory that it is the desire for a definite object.

original: spyi don du gnyer ba ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi don du gnyer ba ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the desire for the universal,

original: de gnyis ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because those two are contradictory.

original: rtogs pa po 'dod pa skabs yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi khyad par gzhan las rtsod pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa po 'dod pa skabs yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi khyad par gzhan las rtsod pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Not only that, but there is no dispute about the other particularities, because the desire of the cognizer is the topic.

original: gang gi phyir spyi ni du ma'i yul can yin pas de la yang khyad par 'ga' zhig la rtogs pa po rtsod pa med pa yang srid par de'i phyir spyi rtogs pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi ni du ma'i yul can yin pas de la yang khyad par 'ga' zhig la rtogs pa po rtsod pa med pa yang srid par de'i phyir spyi rtogs pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Because the universal has many objects, it is possible that the cognizer has no dispute about some particularity. Therefore, it is not the desire to cognize the universal,

original: de grub pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that it is established.

original: gzhan yang grub pa'i don gyis 'ga' zhig don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang grub pa'i don gyis 'ga' zhig don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, some would strive for the goal by means of the established doctrine.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i khyad par ni bstan bcos las grub pa yin na bstan bcos kyi sgo nas ni rtsod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i khyad par ni bstan bcos las grub pa yin na bstan bcos kyi sgo nas ni rtsod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the distinction were like this, it would be established by the treatise, but it is not a dispute on the basis of the treatise,

original: rtsod pa'i dus de'i tshe bstan bcos de 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i dus de'i tshe bstan bcos de 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the dispute, the treatise is not related.

original: yongs su brtags nas khas len pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma gnyis kyi yul spyod pa la ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos ni rtsod pa'i dus su med na med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su brtags nas khas len pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma gnyis kyi yul spyod pa la ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos ni rtsod pa'i dus su med na med pa ma yin no //
translated: The treatise is not absent when absent at the time of the dispute, because it is accepted after thorough examination, and because it does not depend on the domain of the two valid cognitions.

original: des na bstan bcos las grub pa ni ma grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na bstan bcos las grub pa ni ma grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is established by the treatise is not established at all.

original: 'o na ni 'jig rten na grags pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig rten na grags pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then it would be known in the world.üîΩIt is said:

original: bshad pa / rnam pa de lta bu bstan bcos las grub pa'i chos ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / rnam pa de lta bu bstan bcos las grub pa'i chos ni /
translated: The doctrine established by the treatise in that way,

original: dngos po 'gar yang gang zhig gzhung lugs la mi gnas pa de la rjes su 'gro ba yin par grub pa ma yin na gang las de 'grub pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po 'gar yang gang zhig gzhung lugs la mi gnas pa de la rjes su 'gro ba yin par grub pa ma yin na gang las de 'grub pa yin /
translated: If it is not established that anything whatsoever is a universal that does not abide in a substratum, then how could it be established?

original: de'i phyir skabs su ma bab pa'i khyad par ni rtogs pa po 'dod pa med pa'i phyir @40b dang ; rtsod pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / ma grub pa'i phyir gal te khyad par grub na spyi 'grub pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir skabs su ma bab pa'i khyad par ni rtogs pa po 'dod pa med pa'i phyir @40b dang ; rtsod pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / ma grub pa'i phyir gal te khyad par grub na spyi 'grub pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Therefore, since the proponent does not assert a distinction that is not applicable, and since it is impossible to dispute it, and since it is not established, if the distinction were established, the universal would be established.

original: spyi rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis ni khyad par rtogs pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis ni khyad par rtogs pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, it is explained that one who seeks to understand the universal does not seek to understand the distinction.

original: da ni khyad par de nyid bsgrub dka'o zhes bshad pa ni mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni khyad par de nyid bsgrub dka'o zhes bshad pa ni mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, to explain that the distinction itself is difficult to establish, there is also no nonerroneous reason,

original: khyab pa sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid knowledge that establishes the pervasion.

original: skad cig ma nyid la ni mi 'khrul pa can yod de gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la ni mi 'khrul pa can yod de gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in the case of momentariness, there is no nonerroneous [reason], because there is a refutation [of momentariness].

original: mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt there a nonerroneous reason?

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni bum pa dang / tha dad pa dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i spyi dang don gcig la 'du ba can gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sgra dag las gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te byas pa'i phyir ka ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni bum pa dang / tha dad pa dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i spyi dang don gcig la 'du ba can gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sgra dag las gang yang rung bas gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te byas pa'i phyir ka ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no
translated: For example, a pot is either the same as a pot or is the same as a universal that is apprehended by a sense faculty, and it is impermanent in the sense of being a composite because it is produced, like a pillar.

original: // dpe la ni spyi rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: // dpe la ni spyi rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
translated: In the example, the universal is what is to be inferred.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can la ni bum pa las bum pa don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de lta bu'i sgra grub po zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can la ni bum pa las bum pa don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de lta bu'i sgra grub po zhe na /
translated: But in the case of the subject of the proposition, because a pot is not different from a pot, such a sound is established.

original: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba dag kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba dag kyang zhes smos te /
translated: The response is that even in the case of a syllogism that has a second [i.e., a reason],

original: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i spyor ba gcig bsal na /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcas pa'i spyor ba gcig bsal na /
translated: if one of the two syllogisms is eliminated,

original: rnam pa de lta bu thams cad bsal bar 'gyur bas mang po'i tshig byas so //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu thams cad bsal bar 'gyur bas mang po'i tshig byas so //
translated: Since all such forms are eliminated, the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is used.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bstan bcos la mi brten pas ni de 'dra ba skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i khyad par spyi grub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir skabs su ma yin pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bstan bcos la mi brten pas ni de 'dra ba skabs su bab pa ma yin pa'i khyad par spyi grub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir skabs su ma yin pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not based on the treatise, it is explained that such a non-contingent distinction is not a part of the establishment of the general, and thus is not a contingent.

original: da ni bstan bcos la brten pa nyid yin yang skabs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bstan bcos la brten pa nyid yin yang skabs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Now, it is explained that even if it is based on the treatise, it is still non-contingent.

original: bstan bcos la brten kyang skabs su bab pa'i chos las 'da' na ha cang thal ba ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten kyang skabs su bab pa'i chos las 'da' na ha cang thal ba ni /
translated: Even if based on the treatise, if it goes beyond the contingent Dharma, there is an absurd consequence.

original: der yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ni //üîΩmed na mi 'byung la gnod nyid //
analyzed: der yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ni // med na mi 'byung la gnod nyid //
translated: As for the probandum and the property of the probandum,üîΩthe absence of which is not possible, it is explained that there is only contradiction.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: And so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir spyi shes par 'dod pa yin gyi khyad par shes par 'dod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skabs su rtogs pa ci rtag pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag la gnas pa rtogs pa po 'dod pa
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir spyi shes par 'dod pa yin gyi khyad par shes par 'dod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skabs su rtogs pa ci rtag pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag la gnas pa rtogs pa po 'dod pa
translated: Therefore, because you assert that the cognition is of the universal, not of the particular, the statement ‚ÄúIs the object permanent?‚Äù is not the cognition of the proponent.

original: khyad par med pa'i chos tsam ste /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i chos tsam ste /
translated: The mere property is without distinction.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir chos tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir chos tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mere property is without distinction, because it is without distinction.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / de nyid ni rna gtad par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / de nyid ni rna gtad par 'os pa yin no //
translated: That is the probandum, and that alone is worthy of being stated.

original: de lta ma @41a * //
analyzed: de lta ma @41a * //
translated: Otherwise,

original: yin te / skabs su bab pa ma yin pa bsgrub byar khas len par byed na ni don gzhan khas blangs pa'i phyir rgol ba tshar bcad par 'gyur ro //üîΩrtog pa po don du gnyer ba ni bsgrub bya yin te /
analyzed: yin te / skabs su bab pa ma yin pa bsgrub byar khas len par byed na ni don gzhan khas blangs pa'i phyir rgol ba tshar bcad par 'gyur ro // rtog pa po don du gnyer ba ni bsgrub bya yin te /
translated: if one accepts as the probandum what is not the case, then because of accepting a different object, the disputant is defeated.

original: sgrub par byed pa 'god pa ni gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'god pa ni gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of the proponent is the probandum, because the statement of the proof is for the sake of another.

original: de gtong na ni don gzhan du 'gro bas rgol ba chad pas bcad pa yin la /
analyzed: de gtong na ni don gzhan du 'gro bas rgol ba chad pas bcad pa yin la /
translated: If you give up that position, you will be defeated by the opponent.

original: skabs kyi skyon mi brjod pa'i phyir na phyir rgol ba yang chad pas bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi skyon mi brjod pa'i phyir na phyir rgol ba yang chad pas bcad pa yin no //
translated: And because you do not state the faults of the opponent, you will be defeated by the opponent.

original: ma bsal ba'i sgra'i don bshad pa'i phyir slob dpon bzhed pa'i bsgrub bya nyid du khas blangs pa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du bzung nas bshad pa ;
analyzed: ma bsal ba'i sgra'i don bshad pa'i phyir slob dpon bzhed pa'i bsgrub bya nyid du khas blangs pa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du bzung nas bshad pa ;
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the term ‚Äúunproven,‚Äù which has not been explained, the master BhƒÅviveka takes the thesis that he himself accepts as the definition of a position.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i bsgrub par bya bar khas blangs pa de yang ma bsal ba bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i bsgrub par bya bar khas blangs pa de yang ma bsal ba bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: The thesis that has just been stated and accepted is also what is to be proven, which is not to be refuted.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: mngon sum gyi don dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa dag dang ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa dag dang ste /
translated: By direct perception, inference, and testimony.

original: yid ches pa'i sgra ni de'i tshig la 'jug go grags pa ste /üîΩgrags pa'i don gyis gang la grags pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i sgra ni de'i tshig la 'jug go grags pa ste / grags pa'i don gyis gang la grags pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äútestimony‚Äù is used for the words of a trustworthy person.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äútestimony‚Äù is that which is stated by what is renowned.

original: yul don gyis yul can shes par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul don gyis yul can shes par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The object is taught by the subject, that is, the object is taught by the cognition.

original: de dag gis ma bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ma bsal ba'o //
translated: It is not to be refuted by those.

original: phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin par brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs kyi tshig sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin par brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúBut isn‚Äôt it said that the terms of the thesis are not the members of the proof?‚Äù

original: ci ltar de ltar bstan par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar de ltar bstan par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow can it be taught?‚Äù

original: gal te bstan par bya ba yin du chug na zhes smos te /
analyzed: gal te bstan par bya ba yin du chug na zhes smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it can be taught,‚Äù he says,

original: gzhan gyis de ltar khas blangs pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar khas blangs pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äúit is taught by the opponent‚Äôs mere acceptance of it.

original: nged kyi ltar na ni bstan par mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni bstan par mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: But according to us, it is not taught.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi mdo'i bstan par bya ba'i sgra yang gzhan gyi ngor yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan nyid kyi mdo'i bstan par bya ba'i sgra yang gzhan gyi ngor yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that the term ‚Äútaught‚Äù in the Proof of the Thesis is from the perspective of the opponent.

original: gang dag gi ltar na phyogs bstan par bya ba yin pa de'i ltar na 'di lta bu nyid bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na phyogs bstan par bya ba yin pa de'i ltar na 'di lta bu nyid bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: But according to those for whom the thesis is taught, it is taught in just this way.

original: yid ches pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan yid ches ba'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan yid ches ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe words of those who are credible‚Äù means those who are credible to themselves and others.

original: 'dir yang yid ches pa'i sgra ni yid ches pa'i tshig la bya la /
analyzed: 'dir yang yid ches pa'i sgra ni yid ches pa'i tshig la bya la /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúcredible‚Äù refers to credible words,

original: grags pa'i sgra yang gang la grags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: grags pa'i sgra yang gang la grags pa la bya'o //
translated: and the term ‚Äúrenowned‚Äù refers to what is renowned to someone.

original: gtan tshigs la ltos pa ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la ltos pa ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The object that is dependent on the reason is the object of the activity of the reason.

original: tshad ma thams cad don gyi sgo nas don gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin pa ma yin na ma shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don dang 'gal ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang des bsgrub pa'i don gzhan te des
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad don gyi sgo nas don gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin pa ma yin na ma shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don dang 'gal ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang des bsgrub pa'i don gzhan te des
translated: All valid cognitions are in terms of their objects, they invalidate other objects, but not in terms of their own nature. If it is not the case that the non-cognizing is not in contradiction with the external object, then it is another object that is established by it.

original: na ci ste mdo na sum la don smos @41b she na ;
analyzed: na ci ste mdo na sum la don smos @41b she na ;
translated: If that is so, then why is the object mentioned in the definition of direct perception?

original: bshad pa / mngon sum la mngon sum khyad par du bya ba'i phyir don smos pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / mngon sum la mngon sum khyad par du bya ba'i phyir don smos pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is said: That which is mentioned as the object in order to distinguish direct perception from direct perception is

original: kha cig don mi bden pa can yin pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i don can de spangs pa rgyur byas nas tshad ma'i yul gyi dngos po bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig don mi bden pa can yin pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i don can de spangs pa rgyur byas nas tshad ma'i yul gyi dngos po bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because some have an unreal object, it has a real object, and it is taken as the object of valid cognition, having eliminated that which has an unreal object.

original: dbang po la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: That which is consciousness dependent on the sense faculty is direct perception.

original: da ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don can yang yin no //
analyzed: da ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don can yang yin no //
translated: Now, it also has an unmistaken object.

original: de la phyin ci log gi don can sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir don smos pa byas so //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi don can sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir don smos pa byas so //
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is mentioned in order to demonstrate that the cognition of sound and so on that possesses a mistaken object is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te mngon sum tshad mar bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum tshad mar bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not explained as a direct perception,

original: de ci ltar tshad ma yin pa mngon sum du 'gyur zhe na /üîΩbden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ci ltar tshad ma yin pa mngon sum du 'gyur zhe na / bden mod kyi /
translated: how can it be a valid cognition?

original: 'o na kyang 'dir tshad ma ma yin pa yid ches pa'i tshig dang / grags pa yang gnod par byed par brjod la /
analyzed: 'o na kyang 'dir tshad ma ma yin pa yid ches pa'i tshig dang / grags pa yang gnod par byed par brjod la /
translated: That is true, but here the words of a trustworthy person and what is commonly acknowledged are said to be invalidating factors.

original: mngon sum gyi sgra yang bshad pas thun mong du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgra yang bshad pas thun mong du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Since the term ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is also explained, they are common.

original: des na mngon sum ltar snang ba tshad ma ma yin yang gnod par byed par rtogs par 'gyur bas don smos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum ltar snang ba tshad ma ma yin yang gnod par byed par rtogs par 'gyur bas don smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is mentioned because it is understood that although a semblance of direct perception is not a valid cognition, it is an invalidating factor.

original: de lta na yang de'i phyir yang don smos pa yin no zhes don smos pa'i dgos pa gzhan nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩbden mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i phyir yang don smos pa yin no zhes don smos pa'i dgos pa gzhan nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩbden mod kyi /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it that another purpose of mentioning the term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is explained?üîΩThat is true, but here the term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is mentioned for the purpose of distinguishing the two types of direct perception.

original: 'o na kyang gzhan dag gis don smos pa'i dgos pa 'di ltar bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na kyang gzhan dag gis don smos pa'i dgos pa 'di ltar bshad pa /
translated: However, others explain the purpose of stating the thesis as follows.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di bkod pa yin te /
translated: This is set forth in order to demonstrate that this is not tenable.

original: dper na med pa la med pa nyid do zhes tshul gsum pa gzhan dag gis nges par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa can yin par bshad pa /
analyzed: dper na med pa la med pa nyid do zhes tshul gsum pa gzhan dag gis nges par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa can yin par bshad pa /
translated: For example, it is explained that the purpose of the statement ‚Äúnonexistent objects are nonexistent‚Äù is to ascertain the three modes.

original: nye bar bkod nas sun phyung ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar bkod nas sun phyung ba de bzhin no //
translated: This is set forth and then refuted.

original: yang ci'i phyir bsal ba phyogs ma yin /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bsal ba phyogs ma yin /
translated: Why is the elimination of the property of the subject not a fault?

original: gal te des ma khyab pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis de bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te des ma khyab pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis de bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because the reason does not pervade it is not able to prove the probandum,

original: 'o na ni 'di gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi /
translated: then this is a fault of the reason,

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a fault of the thesis.

original: des na 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nas bzlog par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nas bzlog par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this is to be refuted by the mere statement of its definition,

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyis ma yin gyi /
translated: but not by the definition of the subject.

original: rgyu sogs mtshan nyid bsal bya la //
analyzed: rgyu sogs mtshan nyid bsal bya la //
translated: The definition of the reason and so on is to be eliminated.

original: ltos pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad brjod pa bzhin no zhes de ltar dogs na /
analyzed: ltos pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad brjod pa bzhin no zhes de ltar dogs na /
translated: If you think that the expression ‚Äúwithout depending on anything‚Äù and so on is just as it is stated,

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i don la brjod pa de'i phyir bsal ba chad mas bzlog pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rten ma yin la /üîΩgtan @42a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i don la brjod pa de'i phyir bsal ba chad mas bzlog pa ni gtan tshigs kyi rten ma yin la / gtan @42a * //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Because the meaning of the reason is doubtful, therefore the exclusion by negation is not the basis of the reason.

original: tshigs kyi rten ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang phyogs ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs kyi rten ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang phyogs ma yin te /
translated: And that which is not the basis of the reason is also not a position,

original: phyogs kyi gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of the activity of the reason of a position.

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs kyi rten ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs kyi rten ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Why is it that it becomes not the basis of the reason?

original: bsal ba la ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: bsal ba la ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma brjod ce na /
translated: And why is the reason not stated with respect to the exclusion?

original: bshad pa / bsal ba ni zla bo'i tshad ma'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / bsal ba ni zla bo'i tshad ma'i rten ma yin no //
translated: We respond: The exclusion is not the basis of the valid knowledge that is its counterpart.

original: ci'i phyir rten ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a basis?

original: zla bo'i tshad mas bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa 'gal ba la tshad ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad mas bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa 'gal ba la tshad ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the valid knowledge that is its counterpart engages the object of negation that is the opposite of the object of affirmation.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba la tshad ma zhugs pa can de ni bsal pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba la tshad ma zhugs pa can de ni bsal pa yin te /
translated: Because the opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: mnyan bya ma yin pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyan bya ma yin pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the fact that sound is audible.

original: gal te bzlog pa la tshad ma zhugs kyang 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can gyi gtan tshigs kyi rten yin par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bzlog pa la tshad ma zhugs kyang 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can gyi gtan tshigs kyi rten yin par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that even though the opposite of the probandum is engaged by a valid cognition, the reason is the basis of an incontrovertible contradiction?

original: bshad pa / gsal ba ni tshad ma dag gis bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gsal ba ni tshad ma dag gis bzlog pa yin te /
translated: Response: The manifest is refuted by valid cognitions.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But not the opposite.

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir gcig la 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir gcig la 'jug pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the basis of an incontrovertible contradiction is a valid cognition. It is not contradictory for it to engage one thing.

original: ci'i phyir bzlog pa la tshad ma zhugs na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzlog pa la tshad ma zhugs na /
translated: But why, if the opposite is engaged by a valid cognition,

original: zla ba'i tshad ma'i rten ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba'i tshad ma'i rten ma yin zhe na /
translated: is the moon not the basis of a valid cognition?

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a correct consciousness possesses contradictory properties.

original: dngos po gcig ni 'gal ba du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni 'gal ba du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: One thing does not have the nature of many contradictions.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a different thing has the characteristic of a different nature.

original: gtan tshigs sbyor ba yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir yin pa na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sbyor ba yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir yin pa na /
translated: And it is for the purpose of generating correct knowledge of the application of the reason.

original: bsal ba la ni gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsal ba la ni gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is not stated in the case of an exclusion.

original: gal te de lta na ni gtan tshigs kyis de sgrub par byed mi nus pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni gtan tshigs kyis de sgrub par byed mi nus pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then because the reason is unable to establish it, it is a fault of the reason.

original: phyogs kyi skyon ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs kyi skyon ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not a fault of the position.

original: bshad pa / gtan tshigs kyi yul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir phyogs brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gtan tshigs kyi yul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir phyogs brjod pa yin no //
translated: In response, it is said: The position is stated in order to clearly demonstrate the domain of the reason.

original: des na phyogs ni gtan tshigs kyis byed pa'i yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs ni gtan tshigs kyis byed pa'i yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the position is the domain of activity of the reason, not anything else.

original: de lta yin dang bsal ba de ni phyogs ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bsal ba de ni phyogs ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If that is so, then that exclusion is not a position.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul bsal ba ni yul can gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul bsal ba ni yul can gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a reason to have an exclusion as its domain.

original: gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul byed pa med pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul byed pa med pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of the activity of the reason is not the object of the activity.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis de bsgrub par mi nus pas de skyon can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis de bsgrub par mi nus pas de skyon can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the reason is not able to establish that, it is faulty.

original: phyogs ni @42b ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de med do //
analyzed: phyogs ni @42b ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de med do //
translated: But it is not the case that the thesis is faulty.

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyis yul las phyogs gzhan yin par gyur na ni //üîΩgtan tshigs kyi byed pa la mi ltos pa kho nas phyogs kyi skyon nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyis yul las phyogs gzhan yin par gyur na ni // gtan tshigs kyi byed pa la mi ltos pa kho nas phyogs kyi skyon nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the thesis were different from the object of the activity of the reason,üîΩthen the thesis would be faulty by itself, without depending on the activity of the reason.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par mi nus na gtan tshigs skyon can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par mi nus na gtan tshigs skyon can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: And if it were not able to be established, then the reason would be faulty.

original: phyogs ni ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩde lta na ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul nyid phyogs yin te /
analyzed: phyogs ni ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na / de lta na ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul nyid phyogs yin te /
translated: But it would not be the case that the thesis is faulty.üîΩBut in that case, the thesis is the object of the activity of the reason.

original: des na gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par nus pa ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin pas phyogs yin la /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par nus pa ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin pas phyogs yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the thesis is the object of the activity of the reason, it is the thesis that is able to be established by the reason.

original: mi nus pa ni yul ma yin pas phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nus pa ni yul ma yin pas phyogs ma yin no //
translated: It is not a proper locus, since it is not possible.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par mi nus pa ni de tsam las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par mi nus pa ni de tsam las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi skyon yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the impossibility of proof is due to that much, it is a fault of the locus.

original: 'di ltar dam bca' ba'i skyon ni brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bca' ba'i skyon ni brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the fault of the thesis should be stated.

original: khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i dus na nye bar gnas pa de thams cad ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon las mi 'da'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i dus na nye bar gnas pa de thams cad ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon las mi 'da'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: When the pervasion is shown, all that is present does not go beyond the fault of the reason, as has been explained.

original: dam bca'i sbyor bar khas blangs nas /
analyzed: dam bca'i sbyor bar khas blangs nas /
translated: Having accepted the statement of the thesis,

original: de las gyur pa ni phyogs kyi skyon yin la /
analyzed: de las gyur pa ni phyogs kyi skyon yin la /
translated: that which is due to that is a fault of the locus.

original: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin par brjod do //
analyzed: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon yin par brjod do //
translated: Relying on the later part is said to be a fault of the reason.

original: bsal ba'i don don ni mnyan bya ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du mthong ba nyid na sgrub par mi rung ba nyid du mthong ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsal ba'i don don ni mnyan bya ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du mthong ba nyid na sgrub par mi rung ba nyid du mthong ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as with the meaning of the word ‚Äúunheard,‚Äù when it is seen, it is seen to be unsuitable to be established.

original: de las grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de las grub pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is established from that,

original: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not rely on the later part.

original: gal te bzlog pa las zla bo'i tshad ma zhugs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bzlog pa las zla bo'i tshad ma zhugs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin na /
translated: But if the opposite of that is not the domain of a reason because a valid cognition that is its antithesis does not engage it,

original: gang gi phyir de kho na la gtan tshigs brjod par 'gyur ba ci ltar the tshom gyi yul nyid gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na la gtan tshigs brjod par 'gyur ba ci ltar the tshom gyi yul nyid gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin /
translated: then how could the domain of a reason be the domain of doubt, since a reason is stated only in regard to that?

original: the tshom gyi yul bzhin du grub pa la yang bzlog pa la zla bo'i tshad ma med pa yin ta /
analyzed: the tshom gyi yul bzhin du grub pa la yang bzlog pa la zla bo'i tshad ma med pa yin ta /
translated: Just like the domain of doubt, even that which is established does not have a valid cognition that is its antithesis.

original: des na grub pa yang gtan tshigs kyi yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na grub pa yang gtan tshigs kyi yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even that which is established would become the domain of a reason.

original: bshad pa / bsal ba gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul ma yin pa de'i phyir the tshom gyi yul ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / bsal ba gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul ma yin pa de'i phyir the tshom gyi yul ni gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin te /
translated: In response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Because that which is to be refuted is not the domain of a reason, therefore the domain of a reason is the domain of doubt.

original: gang las grub pa yang gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul du 'gyur ba bzlog pa la zla bo'i tshad ma mi 'jug pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las grub pa yang gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul du 'gyur ba bzlog pa la zla bo'i tshad ma mi 'jug pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not because a valid cognition that is its antithesis does not engage the opposite of that, from which it follows that that which is established would become the domain of a reason.

original: des na ji ltar zla bo'i tshad ma yod na gtan tshigs don med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar zla bo'i tshad ma yod na gtan tshigs don med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as a reason is meaningless when a valid cognition that is its antithesis exists,

original: sngar tshad ma zhugs pa la yang gtan tshigs don med pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar tshad ma zhugs pa la yang gtan tshigs don med pa yin no //
translated: and the reason is pointless in the case of the establishment of valid cognition.

original: des na gtan tshigs don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the reason is pointless,

original: rab tu sbyar ba'i byed pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid du @43a * //
analyzed: rab tu sbyar ba'i byed pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid du @43a * //
translated: it is not the domain of application of the proof.

original: grub pa dang bsal ba mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa dang bsal ba mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The proof and the refutation are similar.

original: de'i phyir don med pas byas pas bsal ba gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin pas grub pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom nyid gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin la des na phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don med pas byas pas bsal ba gtan tshigs kyi yul ma yin pas grub pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom nyid gtan tshigs kyi byed pa'i yul yin la des na phyogs yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the refutation is pointless, it is not the domain of application of the reason, and because it is not common to the proof, doubt itself is the domain of application of the reason, and therefore it is a position.

original: grub pa ni de tsam la brten nas 'gyur ba can yin pa'i phyir phyogs ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: grub pa ni de tsam la brten nas 'gyur ba can yin pa'i phyir phyogs ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: The proof is a pseudo-position because it is dependent on just that,

original: bsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bsal ba bzhin no //
translated: like the refutation.

original: gang dag bsal ba phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ci tshig tsam yin nam /
analyzed: gang dag bsal ba phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ci tshig tsam yin nam /
translated: Those who say that the refutation is not a position are just quibblers.

original: 'o na te rigs pas thob pa yin zhes nye bar bkod nas /
analyzed: 'o na te rigs pas thob pa yin zhes nye bar bkod nas /
translated: Or is it obtained through reasoning?

original: gzhung rtogs par byed pa de dag gi ltar na /
analyzed: gzhung rtogs par byed pa de dag gi ltar na /
translated: According to those who posit the text as the object of understanding,

original: 'gal ba dag ni gcig la yang dag pa'i shes par mi rung ba'i phyir phyogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni gcig la yang dag pa'i shes par mi rung ba'i phyir phyogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur bas /
translated: It would be necessary to say only this much: ‚ÄúThe thesis is not the object of refutation, because it is not correct for contradictory things to be in one place.‚Äù

original: the tshom gyi yul la rtags brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dang 'brel ba cung zhig kyang 'brel ba dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi yul la rtags brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dang 'brel ba cung zhig kyang 'brel ba dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is difficult to see any connection between this and the statement, ‚ÄúBecause the reason is stated with respect to the object of doubt.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi yul ni phyogs yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi yul ni phyogs yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of the reason is the thesis,

original: bsal ba ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsal ba ni yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the refutation is not the object.

original: de tsam la 'gyur ba'i phyogs kyi skyon yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: de tsam la 'gyur ba'i phyogs kyi skyon yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho na ltar yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only this much that is the fault of the thesis.

original: gal te tshad ma dag nyid kyis bsal ba phyogs ma yin na ji ltar rnam pa bzhir bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma dag nyid kyis bsal ba phyogs ma yin na ji ltar rnam pa bzhir bshad ce na /
translated: If the refutation is not the thesis, because it is not the object of the valid cognition, then how can it be explained as the four parts?

original: bshad pa / rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yin te /
translated: We reply, it is a division of inference.

original: dbye ba rgyur byas nas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa de ni rnam pa bzhir brjod do //
analyzed: dbye ba rgyur byas nas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa de ni rnam pa bzhir brjod do //
translated: Having made a division, the refutation by direct perception and inference is explained as the four parts.

original: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum du phye bas na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum du phye bas na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase because it is divided into three types of inference means

original: dngos po pa'i rjes su dpag pa gcig dang / brtags pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin la brten nas khas blangs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis kyis so//
analyzed: dngos po pa'i rjes su dpag pa gcig dang / brtags pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin la brten nas khas blangs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis kyis so//
translated: that there is one type of inference for realists and two types of inferences based on effects and nature that are accepted by others.

original: ci ltar dngos po gnod par byed pa de bzhin du khas blangs pa gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po gnod par byed pa de bzhin du khas blangs pa gzhan la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as a real thing is refuted, so too is an assertion refuted.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The phrase in that case refers to perception and so on.

original: khas blangs zhes bya ba ni yul can khas blangs pas khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: khas blangs zhes bya ba ni yul can khas blangs pas khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos mtshon pa'o //
translated: The phrase accepted by others refers to the treatises accepted by others, which are indicated by the word treatises.

original: khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos ni 'bras rtags te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos ni 'bras rtags te /
translated: The treatises accepted by others are inferences based on effects.

original: don gyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: don gyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: They are called inferences based on effects because they are reasons that are effects of the object.

original: 'gro ba la grags pa 'gro ba'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa ni rang bzhin rtags te /
analyzed: 'gro ba la grags pa 'gro ba'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa ni rang bzhin rtags te /
translated: The system of the world is a natural inference that is accepted by the world.

original: rang bzhin gyi ming can don rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ming can don rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: It is called a natural inference because it is a part that causes the understanding of the meaning.

original: rnam par 'grel bar bshad pa ni yid ches @43b pa'i tshig ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtags yin la /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel bar bshad pa ni yid ches @43b pa'i tshig ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtags yin la /
translated: The explanation of the commentary: The words of a trustworthy person are a reason having the nature of an effect.

original: grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid can gyi rtags yin no //
translated: Fame is a reason having the nature of a nature.

original: grags pa zhes bya ba rnams par rtog pa la gnas pa nyid ni don gyi rang bzhin yin no zhes gtan la phebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grags pa zhes bya ba rnams par rtog pa la gnas pa nyid ni don gyi rang bzhin yin no zhes gtan la phebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Fame is a conceptual thought that is based on the nature of an object.

original: gang gi tshe tshig 'bras bu'i rtags su 'gyur ba yid ches pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshig 'bras bu'i rtags su 'gyur ba yid ches pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: When words are a reason having the nature of an effect, what is that effect?

original: bdag gam gzhan ni yid ches pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gam gzhan ni yid ches pa yin no //
translated: It is the trustworthy person, either oneself or another.

original: ci lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /üîΩgang la don ci lta ba bzhin te ci ltar gnas pa bden pa'i don mthong ba yod pa de'i sgo nas ngag 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ci lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na / gang la don ci lta ba bzhin te ci ltar gnas pa bden pa'i don mthong ba yod pa de'i sgo nas ngag 'jug pa ste /
translated: What kind of person is trustworthy?üîΩOne who speaks in accordance with what is real, in accordance with what is true, in accordance with the way things are.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas 'jug pa de 'dra ba'i ngag gang la yod pa'o //üîΩde ltar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas 'jug pa de 'dra ba'i ngag gang la yod pa'o // de ltar 'dod pa ste /
translated: One who speaks in accordance with what is real is a trustworthy person.

original: mngon par 'dod pa ni yid ches pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ni yid ches pa yin te /
translated: One who is trustworthy is one who is accepted as such.

original: bdag gam gzhan yang rung phyin ci ma log par smra ba ni yid ches pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gam gzhan yang rung phyin ci ma log par smra ba ni yid ches pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúone who speaks without error, whether about himself or others, is credible‚Äù is that he is trustworthy.

original: gang gi phyir de'i tshig ni de lta bu'i don gyi dngos po phyin ci ma log pa nyid med na mi 'jug pa de'i phyir don de'i 'bras bur 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i tshig ni de lta bu'i don gyi dngos po phyin ci ma log pa nyid med na mi 'jug pa de'i phyir don de'i 'bras bur 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Because his words do not occur without the reality of the object that is not erroneous, therefore, the object is accepted as the result of the words.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid rang gi 'bras bus yang dag par bstan pa'i don de yang /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig gi mtshan nyid rang gi 'bras bus yang dag par bstan pa'i don de yang /
translated: The meaning that is indicated by the result of the words of a credible personüîΩis contradicted by the assertion of a nature that is erroneous and contrary to itself.

original: rang las phyin ci log tu rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal bar khas blangs pa'i gegs byed de zhes bya ba la 'dir gegs byed pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: rang las phyin ci log tu rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal bar khas blangs pa'i gegs byed de zhes bya ba la 'dir gegs byed pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Here, the position that is to be established is that of contradiction.

original: da ltar ni re zhig gnod pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni re zhig gnod pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúharm‚Äù is accepted as being the present.

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The treatise is the words of a credible person.

original: don gyi 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mtshungs pas na'o //
analyzed: don gyi 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mtshungs pas na'o //
translated: Because the meaning is similar in being characterized by the result of the object.

original: bsdus te zhes bya ba ni bsregs nas gnod par byed pa gcig tu slob dpon gyis brjod do //üîΩgal te don gyi 'bras bu nyid du gnyi ga mtshungs kyang gzhan dag gis 'di gnyis tha dad par brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bsdus te zhes bya ba ni bsregs nas gnod par byed pa gcig tu slob dpon gyis brjod do // gal te don gyi 'bras bu nyid du gnyi ga mtshungs kyang gzhan dag gis 'di gnyis tha dad par brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: The word together is used by the master to indicate that the two are combined in the act of harming.

original: ci'i phyir slob dpon gyis gnod pa gcig tu brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir slob dpon gyis gnod pa gcig tu brjod ce na /
translated: If the two are the same in being the effect of the object, why did the master say that the two are different, and why did he say that the two are combined in the act of harming?

original: skabs kyi rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skabs kyi rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To answer this, he says the basis of the context, etc.

original: 'di ltar mngon par 'brel te /üîΩ'bras bu nyid du khyad par med pa la brten nas yid ches pa'i tshig 'di rang gi tshig dang lhan cig tu tha dad par brjod pa mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par 'brel te / 'bras bu nyid du khyad par med pa la brten nas yid ches pa'i tshig 'di rang gi tshig dang lhan cig tu tha dad par brjod pa mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir te //
translated: The meaning is as follows.üîΩThe master said that the two are different in order to show that the two are the same in being the effect of the object, and he said that the two are combined in the act of harming in order to show that the two are the same in being the basis of the context.

original: 'dra ba 'ga' zhig rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba 'ga' zhig rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin no //
translated: The two are the same in being the basis of the context, but they are different in being the effect of the object.

original: 'dra ba de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the similarity between the two?

original: ci ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes smos so //
translated: To answer this, he says just as, etc.üîΩ The word just is used to indicate that the two are the same in being the basis of the context.üîΩThe word as is used to indicate that the two are the same in being the effect of the object.

original: bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word self is used to indicate that the two are the same in being the basis of the context.

original: @44a * // gal te nga'i tshig ni brjod par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin no zhes gzhan la khas len pa de lta na smras pa la tshig brjod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: @44a * // gal te nga'i tshig ni brjod par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin no zhes gzhan la khas len pa de lta na smras pa la tshig brjod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you accept that my words are not produced without the object to be expressed, then you would be speaking,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not otherwise, because there would be no purpose.

original: nga'i tshig las don 'di rtogs par gyis shig ces gzhan la smra ba yin no //
analyzed: nga'i tshig las don 'di rtogs par gyis shig ces gzhan la smra ba yin no //
translated: You are speaking to others, ‚ÄúUnderstand this object from my words.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi tshig rtogs par bya ba'i don dang ldan par ston pas ni tshig don gyi 'bras bur bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi tshig rtogs par bya ba'i don dang ldan par ston pas ni tshig don gyi 'bras bur bstan pa yin te /
translated: You are teaching that the words have the object to be understood as their result,

original: gal te brjod par bya ba'i don la mi 'khrul pa de lta na /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba'i don la mi 'khrul pa de lta na /
translated: because if they are not mistaken with regard to the object to be expressed,

original: de rtogs par bya ba'i don dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs par bya ba'i don dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then they will have the object to be understood as their result.

original: tshig don gyi 'bras bur yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshig don gyi 'bras bur yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can they have the object to be understood as their result?

original: gal te don med na mi 'byung ba can gyi mthong bas sbyar ba yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te don med na mi 'byung ba can gyi mthong bas sbyar ba yin na'o //
translated: If they are applied by the seeing that they are not produced without the object.

original: de'i phyir smra po tshig brjod pa'i shugs nyid kyis tshig don med na mi 'byung ba dang / bdag nyid kyang don ci lta bzhin mthong bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra po tshig brjod pa'i shugs nyid kyis tshig don med na mi 'byung ba dang / bdag nyid kyang don ci lta bzhin mthong bar ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the speaker, by the power of expressing the words, shows that the words are not produced without a meaning and that he himself sees the meaning as it is.

original: gal te bdag nyid bden pa mthong ba ma yin pa dang tshig kyang mi bden pa'i don can du gzhan la ston par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid bden pa mthong ba ma yin pa dang tshig kyang mi bden pa'i don can du gzhan la ston par 'dod na ni /
translated: If he himself does not see the truth and wishes to show others that the words have a meaning that is not true,

original: tshig brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshig brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then he would not even express the words.

original: tshig gi dgos pa don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi dgos pa don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he does not accept the purpose of the words, which is to understand the meaning.

original: des na 'dir bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tshig tshad ma ma yin par brjod par blta ste /
analyzed: des na 'dir bdag nyid tshad ma ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tshig tshad ma ma yin par brjod par blta ste /
translated: Therefore, here ‚Äúif one is not a valid person‚Äù should be understood to mean ‚Äúif one is not a valid speaker.‚Äù

original: tshig tshad ma yin pa ni bdag nyid tshad ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pas de med na de yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tshad ma yin pa ni bdag nyid tshad ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pas de med na de yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because being a valid speaker is the reason for being a valid person, and if the latter is absent, the former is also absent.

original: de bzhin du bstan bcos la ma brten par te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan bcos la ma brten par te /
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúwithout relying on treatises‚Äù means

original: tshad mar khas blangs par des grags pa'i chos can la dpyod pa mi 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni gang rtogs par bya ba'i don du lhan cig tu brjod par mdzad pa'i 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad mar khas blangs par des grags pa'i chos can la dpyod pa mi 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di ni gang rtogs par bya ba'i don du lhan cig tu brjod par mdzad pa'i 'dra ba yin no //
translated: This is similar to the reason that is stated in order to understand the meaning of ‚Äúthe subject that is renowned to that [opponent] is not analyzed by that valid cognition.‚Äù

original: ci zhig brjod par bya ba'i phyir 'dra ba rtogs par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig brjod par bya ba'i phyir 'dra ba rtogs par 'dod ce na /
translated: For what purpose is the similarity stated?

original: skabs kyi chos can khyad par dpyod pa'i rten nyid la bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: skabs kyi chos can khyad par dpyod pa'i rten nyid la bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The treatise is a refutation of the very basis of the analysis of the attributes of the subject in the context [of the opponent‚Äôs position].

original: khyad par dpyod pa gang du chos can bstan bcos la rag las ba der bstan bcos rten nyid dang / brten par yang gnod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par dpyod pa gang du chos can bstan bcos la rag las ba der bstan bcos rten nyid dang / brten par yang gnod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The treatise is a refutation of the very basis of the analysis of the attributes of the subject in the context [of the opponent‚Äôs position] where the subject is dependent on the treatise.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa'i don du mtshungs par bstan par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa'i don du mtshungs par bstan par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not the other‚Äù is stated in order to express this meaning.

original: tshig kyang brjod pa'i skabs rten yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig kyang brjod pa'i skabs rten yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The words are a refutation because the context is the basis of the expression.

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa 'di gnyis skabs kyi rten can du mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir tha dad @44b pa med par bshad pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang lung dang 'gal ba gcig tu byas pa 'di la dper brjod pa
