analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa 'di gnyis skabs kyi rten can du mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir tha dad @44b pa med par bshad pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang lung dang 'gal ba gcig tu byas pa 'di la dper brjod pa
translated: For that very reason, this example is made into one that is contradictory to your own words and contradictory to scripture.

original: yang 'dra ba tha mi dad par bstan to //üîΩgzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma dag med do zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzhal bya'i don can don dang ldan pa'i tshad ma dag med pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dra ba tha mi dad par bstan to // gzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma dag med do zhes bya ba ni / gzhal bya'i don can don dang ldan pa'i tshad ma dag med pa'o //
translated: Again, similarity is shown to be non-different.üîΩThe phrase the valid cognitions that have objects to be cognized do not existüîΩmeans that the valid cognitions that have objects to be cognized and that have objects do not exist.

original: de dag gi rtogs pa'i don gang yin pa de med do zhes don 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rtogs pa'i don gang yin pa de med do zhes don 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase the objects that are their objects of comprehension do not exist refutes the objects,üîΩsaying that the objects that are their objects of comprehension do not exist,

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: but it does not refute their mere nature.

original: de ni nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are experienced.

original: ci ltar dpe brjod pa 'di /
analyzed: ci ltar dpe brjod pa 'di /
translated: How is this example

original: gnyi ga la yang 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: similar in both cases?

original: tshad ma rnams med na zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams med na zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase if the valid cognitions do not exist is stated.

original: tshad ma med do zhes smra bas ni tshig brjod bya'i don dang ma 'brel par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma med do zhes smra bas ni tshig brjod bya'i don dang ma 'brel par brjod pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere is no valid cognition‚Äù is a statement that is not related to the meaning of the words.

original: brjod par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ni tshig nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ni tshig nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the case that the meaning of the words does not occur without valid cognition, then the words themselves would be valid cognition.

original: tshig brjod bya'i don dang bral bar bstan na ni de brjod pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig brjod bya'i don dang bral bar bstan na ni de brjod pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is shown that the words are divorced from the meaning of the words, then the statement would be meaningless.

original: de bzhin du bstan bcos kyang don med na mi 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur na 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan bcos kyang don med na mi 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur na 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: In the same way, it would not be the case that the treatise does not occur without a meaning, but it is asserted that it does.

original: des na 'di gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir 'di dag gis dam bcas pa'i don la gnod par 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir 'di dag gis dam bcas pa'i don la gnod par 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because these two are untenable, they are similar in that they undermine the meaning of their own thesis.

original: gal te chos can tshad ma lung gis gzhag pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos can tshad ma lung gis gzhag pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the subject is established by valid cognition and scripture?

original: ci ltar 'dir bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dir bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it undermined by the treatise here?

original: bshad pa / rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la gsal ba'i dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la gsal ba'i dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: We respond: This is an example that clarifies the contradiction with their own words.

original: tshig brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa'i tshad ma de tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa'i tshad ma de tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the valid cognition that comes from the force of the words is undermined.

original: lung la ni 'di 'gal ba'i dper brjod pa'i phyogs tsam zhig yin no //
analyzed: lung la ni 'di 'gal ba'i dper brjod pa'i phyogs tsam zhig yin no //
translated: This is just an example of a contradiction in scripture.

original: 'dir gdon mi za bar khas blangs bar bya ba'i tshig gi tshad ma ni dam bca' ba'i don 'gal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gdon mi za bar khas blangs bar bya ba'i tshig gi tshad ma ni dam bca' ba'i don 'gal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, the valid cognition of words that must be accepted is contradictory to the meaning of the thesis.

original: des na phyogs 'dis gang du gdon mi za bar bstan bcos tshad mar khas blangs pa de ni bstan bcos kyi dper brjod pa yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na phyogs 'dis gang du gdon mi za bar bstan bcos tshad mar khas blangs pa de ni bstan bcos kyi dper brjod pa yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by this position, wherever the treatise is accepted as valid, it should be understood that the treatise is an example.

original: de bshad pa ni lung dang 'gal ba 'di las bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni lung dang 'gal ba 'di las bsal bar bya ste /
translated: This is explained as being resolved from this contradiction with scripture.

original: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos gdon mi za ba kho nar khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos gdon mi za ba kho nar khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is valid, the treatise must be accepted without doubt.

original: 'phos nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'phos nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of having been transferred is

original: ring du song yang 'jig rten pha rol yin pas der ba de ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: ring du song yang 'jig rten pha rol yin pas der ba de ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: This is the treatise‚Äôs refutation.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩbstan @45a * //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // bstan @45a * //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe basis of the analysis of the characteristics of pleasure and so on is refuted.‚Äù

original: bcos de la gnod na bde ba ster bar byed pa nyid dang / bde ba ma yin pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid kyi khyad par la dpyod pa 'jug pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bcos de la gnod na bde ba ster bar byed pa nyid dang / bde ba ma yin pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid kyi khyad par la dpyod pa 'jug pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the treatise refutes that, then the analysis of the characteristics of pleasure and so on is not engaged.

original: rten du gyur pa gzhi med pa ste ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa gzhi med pa ste ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis of the analysis is refuted, it is nonexistent.

original: spyi yod na khyad par sems pa yin na spyi nyid ldog pa'i phyir yul gang la khyad par bsam gtan med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs par sems pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi yod na khyad par sems pa yin na spyi nyid ldog pa'i phyir yul gang la khyad par bsam gtan med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs par sems pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the universal exists, then the particular is conceived. But because the universal itself is refuted, there is no conception of the particular in any object, just as there is no conception of the particular of the rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on.

original: gal te bstan bcos la gnod du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la gnod du chug mod /
translated: But even if the treatise refutes that,

original: de lta na yang gzhi med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhi med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could it be that the basis of the analysis is nonexistent?

original: chos can yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de la brten pa'i phyir te 'ung la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de la brten pa'i phyir te 'ung la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the existence of the subject.

original: spyi'i ngo bo chos can ni /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo chos can ni /
translated: The general nature of the subject

original: bstan bcos kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin pas /
translated: is the presentation of the treatise.
